review_body: We had an excellent experience with the Inn. They picked us up from a late night flight, though I had to call 3 times to get an answer, and the room was comfortable, clean and quiet. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.

If I had not already prepaid for this armpit I would have rather slept in my rental car. I could have saved the $117 rate plus the $10 resort (?) fee due at check in. It did not bother me that it is in a district of warehouses. What did bother me was the run down condition, the poor house keeping (evidenced by an obvious long black hair hanging off the "fresh" hand towel) and the level of some of the other guests staying here. I suspect a number of these people may have been staying on a subsity voucher from their appearance and a number of cars that were certainly owned by locals and were not from a rental company. The Chinese restaurant it front was the same caliber as the motel. Every 15 minutes I was subjected to the stench of a smoker as if wiffed into my room.Baffled by the good reviews. Can it be that those reviewers actually stayed in the same dump I did?

The Pacific Marina Inn is very close, clean, well priced w/ a pool, bar & decent restaurant. Most travelers have flown at least 6 hrs & are connecting to another long -haul flight, perfect for an over night layover. The rooms are simple, but plenty confortable.

This place is ok, clean, close to the airport fun little karaoke bar.Staff were friendly except we were catching the shuttle to the airport at 11:30 and got a call at 11:01 to get out of our room. Not so friendly, would not stay there again.

In January my friend and myself stayed in Pacific Marina Inn in Hinolulu .The stay was a nightmare . We slept on top of the bed with our beach towels and our cloths on., fearing we would catch something. The walls were parched up . The sink was falling off the walls and the mini fridge was in the bathroom. The room was freezing and all night someone was walking back and forth outside our room .. I put my luggage in front of the door. The manager would not give us another room or money back.

We like staying at Pacific Marina for two main reasons: the free and closely accessible parking (if you can get one), which makes it easy to go back to your car to retrieve things or run out in a hurry; and the bar downstairs. The pool area is also nice and, since we frequent Oʻahu, the location is very convenient for to most the places we end up going to. But the rooms are hit or miss as far as cleanliness and comfort. For this last trip, our bed was extremely uncomfortable. Just hard like every spring is just done. My husband and I had sore backs every morning. Time to throw out these mattresses. (Oh, and pretty much every “Queen” size bed we’ve had there was not a Queen, they were Full-size mattresses.) I don’t know if this hotel is going to be affected by the rail system coming through—like if they have to close down because they are in the path—and that’s why the rooms aren’t being changed out, upgraded, or given on super good cleaning/painting head to toe. If that’s what is happening, then I understand and will keep staying there while it’s still around. But if they are staying, I hope they do some major cleanup and upgrades soon. There should be some investment into the hotel for the good of their guest, especially the retiring ones.

I love how it's so quite and the house keepers are so nice and how the front and the little store workers are so friendly and nice. I have a question to ask..If I wanted to rent every month how much would it be??

The only reason we stayed here was its closeness to the airport and it suited that purpose. Stayed late February for the one night.Rang for the free shuttle from the airport to be picked up, gave location details and around 30 minutes later we were picked up. The inn is old, the room was old, the bed is old, the entire facility is old.Noise both inside room and out is loud. An old air conditioner tried hard to keep the room cool, but due to noise we had to turn this off. Even with ear plugs in, the noise from outside and other air conditioners near by still impacted sleep.Our third floor room overlooked the pool. the noise from the people in the pool went well into the night.Our room had a musty smell.The over bath tub shower was hot and good pressure.The food at the Chinese Restaurant within the premises was good, tasty and hot.Would not recommend, and would not stay here again.

Pros is that it is close to the airport and the base. If you go on the backside of the hotel there are tennis courts and soccer field that is nice. Cons are that is not worth the price and parking was a nightmare. Looked like in the middle of an industrial area. While i stayed they had a TV shooting of a television show and they closed off parking to paying guest and did not make arrangements for parking in another area. Rooms are small but the service was great and I did not like paying in advance. usually only cheap motels insist on payment in advance. I stayed for a week and was required to pay in advance. Should set running of your card like rent a car companies do and charging when you leave. The housekeepers were awesome and I forgot my key in the room and the housekeeper was not allowed to open my room. Surprised to find the hotel in what looked like an industrial area.

We stayed here only a few nights when we first arrived and the night before we went home, and I must include both good and bad.Good: Close to airport, shuttle runs every 30 minutes but you have to call if you come.in at airport (wish we knew that before, we waited 1 hours until we got the shuttle by luck picking up another passenger). Driver was really nice, she gave us good information about Kaui where we was for 4 days. Her name was Ashlen. She told us about kaui to go to breneke beach, wemea canyon, about good restaurants and to go in the river tube tour which we did all of them because she sughest it.we want to thank her but we did not see her when we got back. When we go back on last night, we had other girls driver who was so rude and yelled at us andshe was older, no help. Check out we meet geno and he was too nice so he make up for rude driver. He apologize for her which is okay for us.geno is so welcoming, he told us where to eat and let us storage our things so we can go out for the day. So helpfulBad: first room we move room because have hair everywhere. They give us new room, its OK. Second time drunk man follow me to room and he was weird but we want to call cop I think he is working for hotel, but he is so drunk and he want to talk to me and my husband almost fight to him. Not professional. I tell manager old guy, but he don't care. He said that guy is working there and can't do nothing. Don't stay here if he works, he is weird and follows lady's.

Stayed at the property because of its close proximity to the airport, and so called value pricing. When I arrived at 2pm, to check in, the front desk did a great job in expediting housekeeping, so that I could check in earlier then the normal 3pm check in. I also found the housekeeping staff to be very polite and friendly.The room was clean, and simple. The air conditioner was loud, but cold, and I noticed they switched their soaps, lotions and shampoos, all to secured bottles, so you can no longer take home the personal size items.Late at night, and early morning, I found the reverse warnings on trucks outside, extremely loud, even thought I was on the third floor.The final day of my stay, I had to wake up at 3am, to attend an event, so went to take a shower. After waiting 10 minutes for the water to get hot, or maybe a little warm, I ended up taking a cold shower. Not quite how I wanted my day to start.Then when I went to check out, I approached the front desk, at 330am, and one older gentlemen was looking at some papers, while a female employee look at me from the back room, but never approached to see if she could help. After a few minutes of waiting, the male then asked if I needed help. I was disappointed that no one made any attempt to acknowledge or help me for at least a few mintes.

Great rates, clean rooms, nice pool, close to the airport, and the staff is great. Stayed here for a month on business, will definitely stay here again!The hotel has a store, guest laundry, a bar,and a resteraunt.

Thank God my cousin and I only needed to stay here one night. (Our AirBnb couldn’t accommodate our entire stay.) Although the room was clean and fairly decent, we needed to stay on a Saturday night. The place was Party Central. Dive bar downstairs serves until 2am, and apparently they’ll serve you way beyond the point of no return. Drunks were stumbling all over the place. One got on the elevator with me and when I got off on the third floor, so did he. I purposefully went a direction other than my own room so that he didn’t know where my room was. He stumbled back on to the elevator and returned to the bar, I’m guessing. Pool was just below us and other guests made use of it well into the night. I must say that the staff was nice. As we were only needing a place for our last night, I looked for something affordable. I’ve stayed in worse places (Bakersfield), but I’ll make sure that when I return “home” (I grew up in the islands), I find a place for my full stay. Auwe!

We loved this hotel. It was the perfect place to spend our last day in Hawaii swimming and relaxing by the pool before a long haul flight home.The hotel was mins away from the airport and the rooms were beautiful. I highly recommend Pacific Marina Inn.

We didn't stay with you. We cancelled 12/4/19 via phone call to 808-836-1131. Cancel confirm # 120 492 9378. Then we also talked to Kahti on 1/10 after getting another email. She said yes, it was cancelled with confirmation # 011011511 for reservation # 135299.You keep sending us emails that we are staying or stayed with you, which sounds like you want to charge us. You are harassing us!!!

We did a day-stay at this property after a cruise around the Hawaiian Islands. It was a wonderful way to end our vacation. All of the staff, especially Front Desk attendant Gino demonstrated the epitome of Hawaiian hospitality. Gino accommodated every wish of our large traveling group. We spent time in the sun, hanging by the pool, reading and playing cards. Very relaxing. The reception shop is well appointed and stocked, there is a bar and restaurant on property, and coffee and tea are available 24 x 7. While we didn't use it, the fire pit is a really nice touch. Then Gino arranged for airport transportation for our group which ended the day in a great way. Rooms are dated, but very well kept. This is a hidden gem for a day adventure after getting off an active ship. Certainly one to give some consideration to! And the price was definitely right!

Everything you could want, good bus access to the city. The rooms are a little tired, good shower and the water is hot. Excellent airport connection. The recption shop is well stocked with essential supplies. Completely tea and coffee always available

It’s a basic room - small and maybe a little dated but, very clean. I’ve stayed here a few times and never had any issues. Close to the airport and convenient to the work I came in to do at Fort Shafter. The AC unit can be loud but tonight I appreciate it because it blocks out the music playing next door.The place is quiet. I don’t need all the bells and whistles. Fair price. I like the fire pit. Parking can be really tight but I have always found a spot.

Flying between islands very convenient cuz it's by the airport. But I did a staycation! Staff is very friendly. Rooms are clean,Ac, icebox, flatscreen t.v, queen bed, or twin bed, bathroom With shower if u hot? There is a Swimming pool & its open late.price is reasonable

The first room we were checked into had a large water puddle right in front of the bathroom door.The front desk person arrived with a towel to try to clean up the mess then finally offered another room.We had booked 2 beds and were now shown a room with one bed and what appeared to be a day bed without bedding for which the clerk offered us sheets to make our own bed.After 2 more tries he found us a crappy room with 2 beds in a smelly, freezing cold room that had seen better times many many years ago and for all the great prize of $200 dollars.By now it was 1;30 am and we had no energy left to try to find a decent hotel.The only positive thing about this place were the drivers of the shuttle !!!!!

We stayed here with the booking through VRBO. Receptionist Scared the hell out of us saying, Expedia booked only a single queen. I showed her the VRBO and floor plan etc and she told me to call Expedia. I had no idea how that could happen. She mentioned hotel is overbooked and no way to get another room. Finally, she said the manager managed to get me the double queen I booked. Magically it happened. Rooms are ok. Beds were clean. Needs little bit of upgrade (Plug points were using extension chords and they were loose and microwave will switch off in between). On the positive side - Rest of all the staff were very nice. Especially, they shuttled us between airport to hotel when we have to take flights to Kauai and back. Final day we returned our rental and they dropped when needed. Overall I wish they did not scare us while checking in. Also upgrade the room with little bit of investments that are not that expensive.

The loudest and coldest air conditioning in the world, it felt like at the time. Had the worst sleep because of it. So noisy and I can normally tolerate air conditioning machines in hotels. But this was on another level...like enter your dreams level.The other thing we were concerned about - not sure if the swimming pool water is treated so that it is safe and clean to swim in. A swimming pool should be treated or chlorinated to prevent the spread of waterborne illnesses and skin infections from harmful bacteria in the water. Something to ask about before you go for a swim in the pool. The cleanliness score we give here does not apply to the swimming pool because we did not know whether it was treated and safe and clean for swimming. But plenty of guests swam in it.

Our room (#165) was in renovation and brought back into temporary service for the night to accommodate our stay as the last to check in the night of our stay. We booked the room last July. Total charges $230 including taxes and a surprise (inexplicable) resort fee (we arrived at 11 p.m. and left the next morning at about 10). The photos tell the story. No closet hanger bar or hangers, unpainted/pealing walls, baseboards gone, etc, see pics. We sent an email with photos to general manager; we received no response. What else can we say? Oh, and the alarm clock was not set to the current time, the shower head dripped all night and there was a domestic dispute going on upstairs with screaming and yelling and more than several door slammings.

Not much to talk about very dated but clean and the staff is very friendly. About a mile from the airport and there is a shuttle service. Restaurant on site some site in walking distance, There are taxi's available but not cheap

We had a suite, 2 rooms, 4 beds. The a/c in one room would not cut off, the a/c in the other room would not cool. The hotel is older and maybe needs some upgrades. Having said that...the staff was excellent! Very accommodating, very helpful. The hotel was very clean also. The location was great for us. I would choose the hotel again. The price was very reasonable.

Hotel is a little bit run down, but for a short overnight stay (between flights), it is OK.Clean, staff is correct, shuttle available. And for thise with a little bit more time in between, an outdoor pool.

We chose this hotel because it’s close to the airport and has a shuttle, but other than that it has nothing to offer. It’s old and run down. There were cigarette burns on our bedding in a non smoking room; it did not smell though, so they were old burns. The bathroom had stains on the floor. The AC was super loud. The closet was a shelf with a rod in the bathroom next to an old refrigerator. The door to the motel like room had a 2 inch gap at the bottom so anything that passed by the door to the outside could crawl in. Nothing did, but Hawaii has roaches and centipedes. The front desk staff in the morning was not friendly. Stay somewhere else!

The rooms were clean upon arrival... and was cleaned every single day i stayed there.. the environment was calm and parking was good.. the restaurant and convenient store on premises.. makes it all worth it..

I made a connecting flight from US main land LA to Seoul by stopping by at Hawaii,HNL . This hotel usually provide free transfer between airport and hotel.However, tgere was no free shuttle on my arrival. The hotel offered taxi ride by myself then reimbursed back. That's ok .Surprisingly, the refrigerator and microwave oven were placed in the bathroom but they were away from water.Free wifi, in room flat screened TV with programs from various channels.bed and mattress are clean but it's slightly easily move on wheels. It's 24 hr snack bar for purchase if you are hungry ar night.yes.It offers free transfer back to the airport too.

I rarely leave such a negative response but felt compelled to let other fellow travelers know so they can make an educated decision. First, I selected this hotel for two reasons: airport shuttle and price. I was arriving into Honolulu around 9:30 pm and had an 9 am flight the next morning and didn’t want to pay for an Uber/Lyft/taxi to take me to a hotel in Waikiki. Let me say that you get what you pay for regarding price. There are only three hotels that are close to the airport. The room was so bad that we got up early and took the 6:00 am shuttle to the airport. The ac unit was dripping water onto our floor. Some gurgling sound was coming from the shower stall. We had no hot water. Paint was flaking off on the door frame. Not enough pillows for two people. Hubby used bathroom towels to plump up his pillow and I used my airplane pillow under my pillow. I am a thrifty/budget shopper but even I was disappointed with my selection. I’ve stayed in hostels that we’re better than this - no joke. Don’t make the same mistake as I did. Spend the money for a better hotel. I wish I could have had some positive comments but this place fell short. Also, roosters were crowing and at approximately 5:03am the airplanes started taking off so even if you wanted to sleep you weren’t going to be able to .

You have 3 options waiting for a late night or early morning plane at HNL. This is option 3. At least it has an acceptable meal. The room is only slightly worse than the other two options. Walk to Wendy’s is easy. Good shuttle service.

We picked this hotel because of its proximity to the airport, however, I was very skeptical after booking, but very surprised when arrived. The room was very clean, great shower, friendly staff. The only negative was the air conditioner, but since it was an individual unit, it is hard to be silent. It certainly did not keep us from sleeping. I am at a much more expensive hotel in Kona and the air conditioning is loud. I Great shuttle lady and front desk people.

Located in an industrial area near HNL Airport, the inn is below par. The website photos of the rooms are misleading and styling is actually antediluvian or outdated. I’m flummoxed by the odd arrangement of the room. The makeshift closet and mini refrigerator are both located in the bathroom. The maid was very nice; however, the front desk staff and shuttle driver were not, lacked enthusiasm, and didn’t even say “Good Morning” or “Aloha”.

The only good thing about this place is it’s proximity to the airport and the free shuttle. Motel is run down with lots of noise outside at night. Our air conditioner sounded like a c-130 winding up and taking off every ten minutes. For the price you would expect way more. I’ve stayed in nicer hotels on the interstate for way way less money.

A few years back I reviewed this property, saying it was satisfactory but waaaay overpriced. The rooms are small, but with beautiful wood look laminate floorsand the beds are comfy and not worn. Now, I've been here a couple times sincemy old review and price is much more appropriate. The only issue is that the parking lot can fill up, which is odd for an airport property.If it doe, the staff will try to help. Note rooms have AC and a compact refrig....hurrah

POSITIVE COMMENTS - and we have stayed here 3 times:1 Staff pleasant and well trained.2 Very close to airport3 Shuttles leave every 30 minutes (24 hours); polite drivers4 Air/con rooms5 Fridge6 Pool with comfortable furniture - nice for an evening meal or glass of refreshment7 Restaurant and bar on property8 Ordering meals out possible for delivery (e.g. Domino's Pizza)9 Nearby bus stop to city and Pearl Harbor10 Small shop on premises11 Elevator12 Wi-fiThe "Very disappointed" comment from Paula G is surprising. The amenities for the price and location are reasonable. Maybe Paul G wanted a 5-star hotel further from the airport. I'm sure she paid a lot more! We'll continue to return to this small, comfortable, economical hotel for our one-night layover.

This hotel is near the airport which was ideal for one night before flying to Kauai. Nothing fancy, has air conditioning and is clean. Some reviewers complain about the location but it served our purpose. We were not looking to take a stroll in the neighborhood, just somewhere to spend the night. The 24 hour airport shuttle is a plus. They also allowed us to keep our bags there while we went on an excursion to Pearl Harbor. Then afterwards took the shuttle to the airport. Staff was very pleasant and accommodating.

I picked this hotel because of the price and close proximity to the airport and that they provided a shuttle to/from the airport. I was traveling only for a day for a family party Sunday night and needed to fly out the first flight the next morning and just needed a place to sleep over. I called to let them know I was going to check in around 9-10pm and not to give my reservation away. When I got to my room a little after 10pm, I was at first apprehensive because the light was on and I was thinking they gave me a room that was already occupied. I don't travel that often and when I opened the door, I realized that because I had called, they had put the air conditioning on and turned the lights on to welcome me instead of coming into a dark and hot/stuffy room. That was a nice touch. I took a shower and went to bed and slept well and my wake up call was on time at 4am. The shuttle left on time at 4:30am. Everything was what I expected for the price I paid.

From the moment I checked in I felt I was a bother. The receptionist was AWFUL, provided no information just pulled up and handed me a card. While the room was clean, I hated the location and it being my fist time in Ohau, I felt unsafe. I never stayed in the room, I pretty much used the bathroom and immediately searched and found someplace else to stay for my layover in Honolulu. This is a NEVER AGAIN for me

We didn’t want to fight with Waikiki or Honolulu traffic on a short trip, so this hotel was perfect for what we needed. Parking & Internet were “free” but we still had a $10 “daily resort fee” on top of what we paid for hotel. The info on hotel said the resort fee paid for airport shuttle, a daily local paper and free ice & coffee. When I called I was told we would have coffee in our room and fridge/microwave, but when we arrived we were told that was not the case but we could get free coffee in the lobby 6-10am. We did have a fridge)World’s loudest air conditioners and room felt very damp. In fact, the inside of the room door was warped from being so damp. Room did have a hair dryer and they gave us soap & shampoo. There is an “honor library”in lobby, too. Staff was awesome and did everything they could to make us comfortable. Very busy place with free shuttle to and from airport. Nice restaurant on property with good food, but restaurant closed Mondays. Many good restaurants close by. (Drive). Would stay again, but would get email confirmation of amenities promised.

Hotel in an industrial area and even with iPhone map prompts I got lost twice (very hard to find). Close to airport was only plus about this hotel - room was small and cramped (queen) outdated 1960's style, bathroom had broken tiles, broken sink fixtures, light fixtures wired backwards, broken wallboard, peeling and chipped paint,. By mainland standards this was a $49 room for $125. Room 254. Front desk staff was 5 star working in a 2 star hotel. There is a very good Chinese restaurant attached. The bar was OK. Would not stay here again - it tended to cheapen the aura of a last night stay and delightful overall visit to Hawaii. Will remember the really good memories of Oahu, but not this one. I'm just being real honest .....

We were only there for the night and was drawn by proximity to airport as well as free shuttle. We were told to call when we landed which we did. Had to call twice while we waited 40 mins for it. No apologizes either by driver, who turned out to be pretty awesome or front desk. Not bad of a hotel but probably wont visit again.

The customer service was great here, the local girl who helped me was friendly and sweet. The room was very clean. The AC was blessedly cold on a hot humid day. We actually had to make it a tad warmer when going to sleep that night. The minifridge kept our drinks cold. Some reviews complain about the the AC being loud... It was fine to me, I had no trouble sleeping. It actually buffered out some of the noise that was coming from some kids having a good time splashing around in the pool right outside our door. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The Chinese restaraunt smelled good, but we already had plans to eat elsewhere. Affordable, clean and good customer service. That's all we really needed, and that's what we got. And thank you so much for free parking.

The Pacific Marina Inn is a good comfortable hotel at a reasonable price in Honolulu. Not fancy but clean, comfortable and easy to access. Considering the hotel market on Oahu and the recent legislation restricting Air B&Bs this hotel is a good buy.

Nothing works in this hotel. Very old premises in need of upgrade for the price you pay. In middle of industrial area. Nothing near by except airport. A/C makes more noise than cooling. You cant get even cold drinking water or any cups or dishes to use in Microwave.

Affordable and very close to the airport. Shuttle was good, available early and late. Only issue is the resort fee, sure isn't a resort in a bit of a sketchy area. Not impressed when calling hotel, guy must have been busy, basically wanted me to make reservation online--quoted a much higher rate.

I've stayed here a couple of times now. It's convenient to the airport and not as expensive as many hotels in the area. It's not fancy but perfectly acceptable. Our room was clean and quiet. The individual air conditioning unit does get loud but it works well. Staff that we interacted with were friendly and professional. No coffee pot in the room but it is available in the lobby. Shower got hot and had decent water pressure.

Perfect for 1 night before an early international flight. Free shuttle service. Friendly staff.We had a Suite for 3 adults and 2 children.The only reason we didn't give a 5 star rating was due to the fridge not working and no one came to check it.. we worked out that the power point was the issue and moved the fridge ourselves.

Tiny room in crappy area. Cheap but don’t do. Charges you for cancellations. Staff not friendly at all. Booked through Travelocity and were still charged cancellation fee for 1 night. Do not go to this hotel!

Room was smaller than expected and bathroom was very small. However, room was clean, bed was comfortable with plush pillows and there was always hot water in the shower.Soaps and shampoos were provided and there was free WI FI in the room. Complimentary coffee was served in the lobby and the staff were very helpful. For a short stay of overnight to a few days this was definitely value for the money.

The staff gave my room number out to another guest. He called my twice in the middle of night. Asking me if I wanted to have a drink. I was frightened. This in not acceptable in my opinion. Not good enough.

My hotel in Honolulu is OK. Great price for the 5 nights but a little below average on the inside. The highlight is the strength of the shower spray!!! (also the bathroom sink take a lot of time to fill up the plastic glass they give you to drink. I just timed it with my I-Phone and it took a little over 20 seconds to fill the glass to drink)!! The lowlight is there is a gap in the door that’s large enough to let in a mouse. I did see bugs crawling under to get in!!! Also when reading later at night with my overhead light on, bugs are crawling all around the globe and yesterday when I got back to the hotel late at night my room was like an oven. The lady who cleaned my room changed my thermostat setting from 64 to 75. I was not happy!!!!! The AC is cranked and not very good. I put it on 64 degrees but it’s never been that temperature…always warmer. There is NO dresser for your clothes, only some shelves in the bathroom. There is a cool looking fan above the bed and the place seems ok except for the bugs. The TV is a flat screen and very tiny…there is a refrig and micro in the bathroom. There are no rugs and the internet for my room went out and the front desk told me to use the internet from one of my two contiguous rooms. The parking lot is constantly full and at times there are no places to park on the grounds. The workers at the front office or check in are nice. It’s super close to the airport but my room is constantly hot even with the thermostat set at 64 degrees. I guess I got what I paid for!!!!! The bed has 3 pillows but they are all the same and very hard. There is a bar and a Chinese Restaurant on site. I have tried neither yet. Another good thing the workers here are super nice!!!! Now this, my toilet is stopped up and I have called the front desk 6 times in the last two hours NO ANSWER at #185 which is also the same number for housekeeping????? Where are they???????????? The guy finally showed up and did a great job at unplugging the hotel. He was a nice guy!!!!!!!!

PMI is a lovely little hotel, close to the airport. They offer a free shuttle service to & from the airport which we found SO handy at the end of our island-hopping holiday. We were also able to store some of our excess luggage with them (for a very reasonable fee) prior to our stay there, saving us having to lug it around with us, and collected it when we arrived back there to stay. The staff were all very friendly & obliging, the room was very clean & airconditioned & the pool looked sparkling (although we didn't have time to use it). We were very happy with our stay here.

The front desk workers (2 tongan looking females) are very rude and unprofessional. Do not stay here and pay $10 to $20 more to get something better. Elevator is far and the hotel is completely rundown. I don't mind if the place looks bad, but the workers there makes the place look even worse. Don't waste your money, better on the beach than dealing with this slum and scums.

Bed was great, shower hot, room tidy and AC quite strong. Nice staff. There’s an on-demand shuttle from the airport and half-hourly back to it. Minimal airport noise. That said, this is not your Hawaiian holiday resort. The lounge was the island version the bar scene of Star Wars. Not a bad thing, just be ready for odd. Located among warehouses with nothing of interest. Get a ride town. If you have a very early flight or a stark budget, it’s a fair compromise.

This hotel is so run down!! There were hair on the towels, the walls were damaged n cracked, the a.c was so loud that it kept me up n the shower was disgusting! The only good thing about this place was the new flooring and the friendliness of the front desk.I DO NOT RECOMMEND STAY HERE EVER!

The room was okay but not great, and there was a roach in my shower. In addition, my suitcase was thrown around during the shuttle ride from the airport and a wheel was broken off. When I asked for assistance in fixing it that night, the woman at the front desk was completely unwilling to help or provide compensation and told me to come back tomorrow and try again. I wish they had been kinder and more understanding/accommodating about their fault in the breakage. Thankfully, I was helped the following morning as I was leaving by the handiman -- he was great. Aside from that, though, all-in-all an unpleasant stay.

I saw some pretty harsh reviews of Pacific Marina Inn and was very concerned. I have stayed in many four and five star resorts, so i do have some experience with high level accommodations. But I had a good experience with all of the staff who treated me and my kids with nothing but Aloha! I agree that there could be some upgrades to the rooms, but overall it was clean and worked fine for an affordable overnight stay. I would not recommend it for longer stays if you don't have a rental car. And there sounds like some people who have left poor reviews may have had worse rooms so I am not saying they are wrong. With the tough economy in Hawaii, providing affordable accommodations must be challenging for any establishment. Sending my Aloha and appreciation to the staff today!

I requested the building I wanted on our reservation but my partner didn't listen to me and I was not we him when he check in. The front desk ask him what he wanted he replied corner unit away from pool. Well we totally got a local ghetto room I was upset till I turn the television on there was a red line straight down the middle didn't want us to get damage charges so I went to the front desk the change of staffs didnt get his name he was a black gentleman who said no I'm gonna change your room better roomi so go and pack within 5mins he called our room to see if we needed help with our belongings I said no we be right there. We booked the suite that would accommodate 5 but mistakenly put 2 people as staying in the room so the hotel we ahead and MOVED US to a room that only accommodated 2. WE SPECIFICALLY CHOSE AND BOOKED THE SUITE IT SHOULD'T MATTER HOW MANY PEOPLE WE SAID WERE STAYING; and we were charged the same price. Also there wasn't enough parking spaces available for guests.

The pictures for this place are a masterpiece in deception. The rooms are disgusting, the grounds are littered with trash, and the location is abominable.The slow working staff act annoyed if you need anything, even if it's as simple as checking in or asking for the wifi password.Everything is in a run down state of disrepair. No one should have to stay here.

I'm from the Big Island, and usually stay here when I visit O`ahu. So, I've seen this property over the past few years.While a lot of improvements have gone into common areas, there seems to be no incentive on the part of the management to upgrade the rooms. The three I would recommend as being the first are 1) modern toilets, (oval and higher); 2) quiet air conditioners (current ones are ridiculously loud), and: 3) add some electrical outlets.These upgrades are sorely needed. While the hotel now represents a decent value, before too long it won't.

Just don't! If you are not used to 3rd world country living conditions stay away! Dirty sheets (as in hair and crumbs). We slept on towels only because our rental car wasn't ready. If we would have had the car all 5 of us would have slept in it and had a better nights sleep I'm sure. Such a disappointment especially since we paid nearly $200 and booked several months ago. Don't book here thinking you'll get a quick clean bed before your vacation starts!

I was traveling to an outer island and had an overnight layover. I usually stay at another airport hotel but they were full so I booked at Pacific Marina Hotel. The shuttle came to pick me up and driver was pleasant and professional, helped me with my heavy luggage. Check in was smooth and I was in the room quickly. The room was clean, quiet and smoke free. Hot water in the shower and cable TV. The room opens to and the pool courtyard, but the door had a secure locking mechanism and I felt secure. Bed was comfortable and the air conditioner worked. I had a great nights sleep and then left the room 8.5 hours after entering to get back on the airport shuttle. Bottom line, this was a terrific value and I would stay here again if I needed an airport hotel on Oahu. I would also like to point out the yesteryear charm of this hotel. When I was a girl, all Hawai’i hotels were like this one and I could see from the decor that the owners are dedicated to keeping the old world charm while running a clean safe hotel for budget travelers. Don’t hesitate to book.

The guys that was at the reception wasn’t not nice or gentle! I was asking him to send the shuttle to the airport and he seems impatient! When they pick me up at the airport the guys was not nice or gentle, was like he was doing me a favor! I knew that my room was not ready cause the check in is only at 3pm but I just want to let my case there cause they said in the email that we could leave there until check in time and he told me 3 times that the room was not ready, I KNOW I JUST want to drop my bags! Anyway the hotel is nice, there’s a small but nice pool, the room was very nice and the beds clean, but the workers need to be more gentle and friendly with the guests! Thanks

The setting: You are 10-15 minutes away from the airport, via the free hotel shuttle. The shuttle was packed full as we landed on Saturday evening. This hotel is a popular options for those arriving late into HNL. I was the first off the shuttle and quickly checked in, pleased that the request I made earlier, by phone, for a room close to the lobby, was being honored. The lobby is an inviting, large area with interesting local decor features; the ceiling light fixture is impressive. In the morning, complimentary coffee is offered in the lobby, as one waits for the shuttle. The shuttle runs on a set schedule and the next morning, driver gladly dropped us off at a car rental office by the airport. There is a bar next door to the lobby, on the property of the hotel, popular with guests and locals. There is also a small convenience store with basic groceries and sundries in the back of the lobby. towards the patio and pool area. The hotel is two mid-rise room blocks, with a pool between them. At night the pool is nicely lighted up. There were plenty of chairs and loungers poolside.The room: Ours was a small room, on the ground floor, facing the pool, close to the lobby. The room had a queen-size bed, with basic bedding. There was a small TV, a desk with a chair and a loud air conditioning unit. There was no safe in the room or a closet. The bathroom was also small and basic. Make sure to bring your own toiletries. The shower water pressure was decent. The WiFi was free but sluggish at times.All in all, this is a good option if you just need a room to sleep after you land in HNL, before departing the next morning. The rooms are small and need much updating, but the value is solid and the free shuttle is a great perk.

review_body: A quick “staycation” to rejuvenate the body and mind. Always happy to get away for a little break. The room was nice, although I wanted a queen bed, settle for twins. Nice atmosphere over all. Will stay here again.

Yes, two stars is two stars! Our unit overlooks the parking lot not the swimming pool. The room has no tea/coffee making facilities, no fridge... so very, very basic. We chose it for proximity to the airport but after 5 phone calls to organise the shuttle I wished we had got a taxi. Then to get to Waikiki - forget it, it’s 1 hour by local bus. We’ve paid for Ubers to take us downtown. This money added to what we paid would have bought a much nicer hotel. As the other reviews have said - never again!

I gave it a 3 because it wasn't as pictured online when I booked our suite. The online ad shows 1 room with 1 bed and a living room space with 2 beds. When we checked in, there were 1 bed in the 1 bedroom and a little couch in the living room area. The TV didn't work in the living room And maintenance needed to be called in. The swimming pool has no lifeguard and we pulled an 8 year old girl from the pool after she was left unattended by her aunty. (Pray she made it) A recent visit back in May 2019 we also took a huge loss with our personal belongings after our laundry and bath towels we're stolen from the dryers. A few of the staff there has a lot of Aloha and makes you feel welcomed as some of the others need a lot more training or maybe need to find them another type of work because their customer service sucks and they have no hospitality what so ever or just sits behind the counter on their cell phone and looks at you dumb when you go in to report something or ask a question. Overall it's a decent enough place to rest your head.

Do not stay at this hotel!Location is about the only thing it has going for it!If I had known just how terrible it was I would have payed a bit more for a nicer place!The room was very dirty and small the WiFi quality was poor.The AC itself looked disgusting and had something growing on it!You can’t even open a room to let in some air!Absolutely and by far the worst place that I have ever stayed in.

We stayed one night in two rooms. The place is good, with comfortable beds and a fine swimming pool. Restaurant closed very early, but there is a Wendy’s fast-food nearby. Shuttle to airport works well.

Clean room, very basic but we only stayed for its handy location to the airport. They do offer a shuttle service. But we didn't even have a microwave, online it said we would, very small room and the fridge is in the bathroom - that seemed a little strange. Extremely basic - for this price we expected basic but not this extreme.

The hotel is more like a motel of days gone by. They are working to update it, but seems like they should expedite that plan. My room seemed like it was half done (353), there was a gap at the bottom of the door that let all the air out and on a rainy Saturday morning it allowed our room to almost flood had I not been awoken to put a towel in front of the river. Vent fan in bathroom was coated with dust and the shower tiles were visibly dirty (my OCD made me want to clean them each shower). There was one front desk woman, a little older who was RUDE! My door key stopped working several times and she acted like I was doing it on purpose. Bar area is nice with great bar tenders and Chinese restaurant was not bad.

This is my second night ..choose this because it was the least expensive and near the hospital Looks like this hotel is situated in an industrial area ..so not much around Room small and run down but clean comfortable bed Nice bath amenities Good WiFiThey have a little store with snacks Did not try the restaurant It was fine for my needs but otherwise I would not have stayed here Staff very friendly They have a free airport shuttle

Small and simple but clean and convenient hotel, with a lovely swimming pool in the courtyard. A Deliciious and genuine Chinese restaurant on the premises, but it closes early. All personnel were jsut so friendly ! Aloha !!

Cheapest hotel available with an airport shuttle. The other airport hotels were booked or much more expensive $40+. OK hotel, clean, felt safe but old. Nothing in the area. Did not see anyplace to eat breakfast. A few food items and microwave in the lobby you could purchase. Free coffee in the lobby was nice.

My husband and I stayed here due to an unforseen change in our travel plans. We chose this hotel as it was close to the airport and it had a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport and we were due to fly home the next afternoon. It was terrible. The room was less than basic with old beaten up furniture and a full one inch gap at the bottom of the door to outside. The bathroom wasn't fresh and both the bedroom and the bathroom had several long black hairs on towels and bedding. The fridge which was located in the bathroom was old and rusty.The air conditioning unit had seen better days and was really noisy. I refused to use the shower because of the state of it. As we'd had a lot of travelling, my husband fell asleep reasonably quickly however I was anxious the whole night and didn't sleep as I felt unsafe and was worried to go to sleep. In the morning there was an awul noise coming from the room next door, presumably workmen drilling against the wall in our room, No warning or apology was offered. I have recorded the noise on video however I am unable to upload it on here. The hotel charges a resort fee! Resort? I have no idea why they can call it that. Also I have no idea how they have managed to get photos of the place looking like their photos as it does not represent how the hotel actually looks. The only positives I can say about this hotel is that the staff were reasonably polite and that there's a free airport shutttle. I definitely do not recommend this place.

We wanted a hotel near the airport, and they were 4 minutes away, with free parking. Bed was comfortable, room was clean, and bug-free. (We did see an exterminator come by in the morning.) It was convieneint for a night's stay. Room was fairly small but had 1 chair, desk and a refrigerator and microwave (in the bathroom!) Pretty pool and grounds near the pool, and a Chineses restaurant co-located there. Quiet on the mid-week night we were there. Quick and easy check in and out, with free coffee in the lobby in the morning, and a small convienience store off the lobby.

Hands down, the worst hotel I have ever stayed at! Cockroaches crawling all over the wall, AC is extremely loud, they didn’t do anything about loud neighbors who partied all night. Reported the bugs, and she said “oh no” and that was it. No apology or anything. Avoid this place. Nothing good. Absolutely disgusting!!

Location: Close to airportGrounds: Building looks okay from the outside. Locals hanging around talking about run-ins with the Honolulu Police Department and conflicts with Hotel Property Management.Staff: overly casual and impatient. Guest felt like a burden. Room: Very basic. Spare towels were laid on the floor to serve as a clean walking surface (for bare feet) from the bathroom to the bed. The place felt dirty and old. Positive: It has flush toilets and is a little better than a tin shed with a mud floor. Summary: If you're a contractor trying to find cheap accommodations for a work crew, this is the place for you. If you're a weary traveler with a layover and want to feel rested for a very long flight to Asia, pay the extra $60 or $70 and stay somewhere else.

I stayed here for five days for a “babymoon”, and I wish I had just splurged and stayed at a nicer hotel. From the outside, the hotel looks decent. The rooms themselves are horrendous. Every time the towels were changed, I found hairs from other customers on the “clean towels”. The entire room is dusty and outdated, and it seems like the cleaning staff just doesn’t care. I can’t even begin to explain the insane amount of dust on the bathroom vent and mini fridge. I ended up having to change rooms, because there was a strong cigarette and marijuana smell coming from the next room (although all rooms are non-smoking). I commend the staff for putting us in a new room, but it was as dirty and disappointing as the first, just minus the smoke smell. I’d only recommend this hotel for those that might only be using the hotel for a shower and sleep, not for lounging in the room. It would definitely be sufficient for a short stay if you don’t have high standards. I would not bring children to this hotel at all.

The room was fine for what you pay for. I found a few long black hairs in my bathroom and on my towels but that was the only problem I found. I find it odd that the fridge and microwave are in the bathroom. Wifi is good although the cable cut out a few times while watching TV. Would I stay again? For the deal I got on my room sure. The staff were nice and the free shuttle to and from the airport was a definite plus.

Check in and check out was a relatively smooth process. The daily cleaning of the room was also good, with fresh towels and amenities left by the cleaning staff. One of the things that we noticed when we came back to the room while it was being cleaned was that the staff leaves the doors wide open (to air out the room we were told) while they clean other rooms. This compromises any of your personal items that are left in the room. Since the front desk does not offer any safe keeping services involving locked areas, then the only thing available to guests would be to take your valuables with you as you go visiting the attractions, and hope that no one breaks into your rental car,or other unpleasant experiences involving robbery.

1st off, I made ny reservation a few days before my stay and when i come to check in the front desk clerk could not find my reservation. Even though i had the email confirming my stay with my special requests, it was for nothing. Now once i got to my room, it was so basic. Room was echoy and bare. The remote could only turn on the tv but not switch channels. I found hair in the bathroom in a few places. The only things i liked bout this place was the nice hardwood floors and the free parking. For the price I paid, I woulda been happier stayin somewhere else w more amenities.

This hotel has a 2 star rating and struggles to achieve that.Desk staff care little and any effort to help is too much for them.Room is small, poorly equipped and barely satisfies the description of somewhere to sleep.No opening windows, no control over ventilation and an air conditioner that operates at a level it decides if it operates at all.Proximity to airport is marginal, at least the shuttle got us to our flight in a timely manner.Overall I recommend avoiding this hotel as there are others for a little more that mean you are not isolated in the middle of an industrial area.

This hotel is minutes away from the airport and offers free parking! Room came with a fridge and free WiFi. In the hotel there is laundry service in case you gotta do laundry there’s also a lounge/restaurant and store for all your last minute needs. Overall great low price, great location, and great amenities.

Let’s just say it’s cheaper for a reason. Shuttle service was ok. You need to wait by the smoking area outside. Not cool if you’re not a smoker. The person I spoke with was rather curt. Luckily I was able to get a room early. It’s clean. That’s about it. Sheets were scratchy. No blackout curtains. AC was finicky. Noise all night. Shower was just ok. The shuttle to leave is in the half hour. I was down by 5:50AM and it was gone. Left early. They tried to tell me the next one was at 6:30 but I wouldn’t have it. They allowed an extra trip in between. I will not be returning to this hotel.

We stayed here for 8 days. The hotel room was older but it was clean. We stayed here because it was cheaper and the resort fee was only $10 which was a lot less then staying in Waikiki. However we had a lot of issues. We asked for a non-smoking room and it said non smoking in the room but several nights our room filled up with smoke as the air vents are connected with a smoking room. The walls are thin and I could hear the people talking through the air vent on the other side. It's a good thing that the air conditioner is super loud as several nights we had people outside the room and in the parking lot yelling, talking, swearing. Last night one guy was yelling constantly from 4-6am! You'll need the air conditioner to help drown out the noise so you can sleep! We stayed on the 3rd floor and didn't see any bugs but there was a big gap on the bottom of the door. We put the towel under the door when we slept.The staff didn't seem very helpful, a few times we asked for pool towels which we knew they kept behind the front desk. When we asked they told us those towels are extra and to go walk around to find the cleaning ladies. What? I'm expected to walk around 3 buildings on 3 different floors to find the cleaning lady? The parking lot fills up quickly. You pay for $10 resort fee for parking yet they don't have room for everyones cars? There is parking on the street, but I would rather park at the hotel to keep our car safe. One good thing was the wifi in the rooms was great!

We arrived at the Honolulu Airport and got our luggage and called the Marina Pacific hotel for a shuttle. They told us to proceed to the pick up area in front of baggage claim 20. We waited and waited and waited... 2 others were waiting with us for the same hotel shuttle. After several unanswered phone calls and the others giving up and taking a taxi, our shuttle showed up an hour later. We started toward the hotel noting the time we left, 3 minutes later we arrived at the hotel!! We checked into the “handicap accessible” hotel tired and wanting a shower. We were told, “sorry we only have one handicap room and we already rented it out.” And “sorry, I see you did request a handicap room.” So it’s now 1:30am in a dirty closet for a room that my wheelchair can’t even get me into the toilet area let alone no accessible shower. Horrible experience and I wouldn’t wish this $158 mistake on my enemies!

My wife and I stayed at the Pacific marina inn on 2/20/19. The room was a fairly clean. The bed was absolutely a piece of crap the 1970s spring mattress that you can feel the springs in while you try and sleep with out falling off the bed because it was so wore out! Was the worst night of sleep I've had in years.for $181.29 per night been better off sleeping in the car. And the air conditioning was loud and didn't do a good job either. Needless to say I will take my money somewhere else next time! Thankfully we only had to stay one night

While definitely not a luxury hotel, the Pacific Marina Inn is perfectly adequate for the no-fuss business traveler, or budget minded tourist, looking for a clean, comfortable, private place to spend the dark-hours. I spent 5-nights during a business trip and found the property very convenient and comfortable and as a solo-female traveler I felt safe. I found the guests to be a mix of business and vacation travelers. While small and local-style, it is apparent that the owners take pride in their small slice of Oahu hospitality. The rooms are very compact and sparsely furnished but have all the necessities and are very clean and tidy. The beds are comfortable. The linens are clean & white. The water is hot and has great pressure. I saw no evidence of Hawaii's state bug - roaches! Free parking but rent a compact car as stalls are typical Hawaii-Narrow.The on-site bar (dive) and separate Chinese restaurant (excellent takeout!) are very handy. The State Park out back is very convenient for the evening leg-stretch session and appears to be popular with the local soft-ball leagues and canoe racing clubs. Note that this is a classic Hawaii old-school hotel -- stress on the 'OLD'. There is evidence of several decades of use in the tropical climate that is Hawaii - warped wood doors and cracked paint resulting from humidity battles - but for the price and location, this hotel is a very good value. My only complaints; The individual wall-mounted AC units are loud and lack a low-level setting to provide quieter ventilation which is needed because there are no windows that can be opened and leaving a door open to the main walkway isn't an option. The rooms do have ceiling fans which help. While the Chinese restaurant has outstanding food, I did catch a whiff of their garbage on occasion when walking near the front of the hotel.

The hotel is right near the airport which is it's only plus. Very overpriced for what you get. The room was dirty. The hotel is run down, I doubt they have put any money into the place since the 1950s.

Near the airport. Veryyyy run down, not worth the money. I guess nobody realizes it does get cold in Hawaii so plan on being very cold like I am right now. The water changes temperatures throughout the shower. The bed is hard. If you need a quick place to crash to be near the airport I would suggest a AirBnB not this place.

Not a fancy or new place, but clean and adequately comfortable for a night before a flight. Free shuttle to/from airport. Small refrigerator in room, large pool surrounded by plants in an attractive setting. Was not happy with Chinese restaurant on-site in terms of quality, though prices are reasonable.

Location very near airport and Pearl harbour. Rooms are reasonable. Restaurant and grocery available in campus. Free shuttle service to and from airport. Wifi free. Comfortable and reasonably priced. No elevator.

Needed good night sleep for early am flight. But late night noise from pool, loud A/C (had to turn off), hot room, made that impossible. Room & bathroom needed a lot of repairs, but was fairly clean. Shuttle driver was great.

It is an ideal location close to the airport and car rental sites.Our room was small but clean and comfortable, everything worked. Used the pool facility, clean.Had good Chinese food from the restaurant.Fitted the bill for our one night stay , not a five star place but we would use it again. Elevator was out of action for repair , glad we were on the ground floor.Located at the eastern end of an airport runway , some noise from light aircraft taking off over us but not excessive.

I didn’t expect perfect stay since it’s affordable hotel.However, when I checked in, the lady in front desk was really rude!She did not even say “hi”?? She said only “your ID”. I checked in without my husband, having my suitcase. My room was 3rd floor(it’s actually top floor in the hotel) so asked her, ”do you have an elevator?”She just said “no”.. without any care about I have to carry suitcase all the way to 3rd floor. And it was raining, no roof from 2nd to 3rd floor.Can she at least smile or say nice greeting to guest??? Room was decent. House keeper were all friendly and nice.Just only that lady just don’t know how to talk to the guests.

Therewas a Chinese restaurant adjacent to the hotel which closed downas I arrived. The check-in happened quickly: I was assigned room 157.This is on the ground level, facing a swimming pool.The WiFi Internet worked fine.The room itself was reasonable-sized, with a window with blindslooking towards the swimming pool. A small corridor separated therooms from the pool, with a small stone wall. On entering theroom, there is a small luggage foldable shelf under thewall-mounted flat-screen TV, and the refrigerator in a recess.The bathroom is beside it. To the left is a nice and softbed, a small study area, with sufficient lighting. There is aroom far with a light on the ceiling, and an air-conditioner. Thecolour scheme is interesting: green and white, and this extends to the runneron the bed as well.The bathroom is interesting: to the right is the recess for thefridge though opening outside, and a set of shelves, with clotheshangers. The bathroom has a closet, a hair dryer, and iswell-stocked with amenities. The shower area is separate, andwell-stocked, again. The towels were enough in number and quality.There is complementary tea and coffee in the early morning hours, in the lobby area.

We Enjoyed our stay and all the staff were friendly. We were allowed to check in early and the room was clean. They had a washer and dryer to use, convenient to a Chinese restaurant and they had a little store to buy odds and ends we needed.

Pacific Marina Inn is basic hotel in an airport industrial area similar to many mainland roadside motels, and is a good value compared to Waikiki hotels. I’ve stayed there several times when in town on business trips. If you’re looking for the exotic tourist resort experience though, this is not your destination. Complimentary morning tea and coffee are available in the lobby. Frequent shuttle vans run back and forth to the airport. Housekeeping staff is friendly and helpful. If you have a car, parking is free. The new elevator will be operational in the near future. Basic rooms are comfortable and mostly quiet. The lobby is decorated in a retro tiki theme with island-style chairs and a desk with tourist brochures. The hotel is located near a lagoon park, which might explain the increase in apparently homeless individuals wandering the property during my most recent stay. While I have sympathy for their situation, I expect not to have to deal with noise, smoke (both cigarette and pakalolo) and scary characters during business trips. Perhaps a security guard is needed.

I would not recommend this hotel. The service is slow and some of the staff had very bad attitudes. The rooms are clean but run down. The shuttle is very slow and crowded, do not rely on it for a flight. We ended up taking an Uber.

The hotel was clean and provided free transportation to and from the airport. I was just staying overnight for a flight the next day, so this was perfect. The property seems a bit older and the room seriously lacked available outlets to charge electronic devices. This was my only real complaint though - everything else was fine, at the level of quality you'd see at a typical roadside inn. But the rooms were well maintained and clean, had free WiFi and TV, and contained beds that were reasonably comfortable. For the price, it's a solid place to stay in Honolulu. Just be aware also that this hotel is not near a beach or tourist area - it's by the airport in a relatively industrial zone. That didn't matter to me, but it might to some. Overall - it fit my needs and I would stay here again if passing through Hono.

Hotels are suppose to make you feel at home, when you’re away from home. This hotel room, just made me want to go home. I did not get my money’s worth with this room. I felt like I was just in a motel room in the middle of no where. There was mold in the went, cracks on the walls, and just felt like I was in some random room. Did not feel like I was at a hotel room. TV channels we’re not really working as well, the only channel that was actually good was the weather channel. Had to stand on a chair just to change the temperature of the air conditioning, but even when we tried to change the temperature, it just felt like hot air. Eventually after 15 minutes, cold air came out.

I've stayed here seven or eight times, and the service and facilities have improved since my first visit. This is one of the best values in a environment where there are very few vlaues in the hotel industry.One area for improvement: the airconditioners (which you have to have on!) will make you go deaf! Quieter ones are needed.So, I highly recommend!

If you are use to staying at the YMCA, then this place would rate high for you. The only PLUS....it is located by the airport. We purchased a bundle package through EXPEDIA, as well as the insurance to guarantee our trip. This included Free Wifi, Free Airport shuttle, and most important Free Parking. Once e got there, the hotel clerk argue with us to pay an addition $10/day Resort Fee for parking. We paid it and immediately called EXPEDIA to ask for a refund and to be moved to another. In the room, the fridge was located in the closet, the door had been previously broken into, therefore the lock was inadequate, there were transaction of drugs being sole on the property., and parking for full. People who were not staying at the hotel were parking on the property, Therefore we sat outside on the public street waiting for a vacate lot. If we were paying for parking, then I should be guaranteed a space. Other than that, we had a great time in Hawaii.......at another hotel. Thanks Expedia for helping us to recover our hotel payment with penalty.

We booked 1 night here, because we had an over-night layover between flights in/out of Honolulu, and the Pacific Marina Inn was close to the airport, offered a complimentary airport shuttle, and was significantly less expensive than any other nearby hotel. After making our reservation we looked at the TA reviews (below) and started to get nervous... "What have we got ourselves into...?" There are not many flattering reviews below.As such, we arrived with very low expectations. I am pleased to say that our expectations were greatly exceeded! :) This accommodation is great for what it is... a no-frills, inexpensive, conveniently-located airport hotel with great WiFi. The complimentary airport shuttle was prompt, fast, direct, and the driver was friendly, helpful and informative. The front desk agent was welcoming, friendly and helpful.The room itself is rather small (10' x 12') with a tiny bathroom. But it had a good A/C (if a little loud), the bathroom was clean, as were the bed-sheets. The WiFi signal was strong. I probably wouldn't recommend walking around to the supposedly nearby restaurants after dark...All in all, it is a good option for a 1-night stay, if you are in transit.
