Keith-B-Robinson
Waterton Lakes National Park, Canada

review_body: This hotel is in the middle of an industrial area. Despite the website alleging that there is an onsite restaurant as well as other eateries nearby, the restaurant was closed and the closest place to eat was a Wendy's. As a woman travelling alone I was not game to walk there in the dark. I felt unsafe enough in the grounds of the hotel.There were people and cars moving round all night and cigarette smoke smells wafted on under the door. The air conditioning was too loud to allow sleep.The room was clean, but the fridge was in the bathroom. There was nowhere to make a hot drink.I was profoundly relieved to check out.

I stayed at this inn for overnight before catching international flight back home. Firstly, pick up service from airport need my call to arrange this within 15 minutes, there's 24 hours shuttle service to the airport ,just showup at the lobby.there is bar and restaurant but it's opening hour not too late at night.20 sq meters room with shower is worthwide the money I paid.24 hr snack shop is next to the lobby. The configuration of room is so confused with number room begining witj "K" and 3 digit numbers.There is no lifts so be prepared with heavy luggage.

My partner and I were both first timer in Hawaii. We stayed in this accommodation two weeks ago as we had a more than 24 hours layover to Los Angeles. The hotel lobby was not as fancy or huge as the 4 or 5-star hotels, but it was clean and presentable. The room was clean and tidy. It was equipped with a Wifi, Television and telephone.We couldn't complain about their service as ALL the staff were very accommodating, helpful and approachable. They helped us on how we can spend our few hours layover in Honolulu.The only reason why I didn't give it a 5 is its location. My partner and I came back to the hotel late after spending some time wandering around Waikiki beach and the city centre. It was around 8 pm. There were regular buses from Waikiki beach back to the hotel. However, the bus stop was about 5-10 minutes walk to the hotel, and it was a really dark street. When we got off the bus and had already walked for about 10 metres, there was this suspicious man who seemed like sniffing some drugs who looked at us and acted like he's going to follow us, so we ran until we got to the entrance of the hotel. Better ride an Uber if you're coming back to the hotel after sunset.

I am not sure where to start. I honestly do not have anything really negative to say however I do not have any 4 or 5 quality things to say either. I have been in Hawaii for 2.5 years and I have never seen this place before except for my arrival. I am in the military and I booked this about four days ago because I needed to get out of my current house quickly so I booked Airbnb. Upon arrival the receptionist was very nice very professional the lobby was cleaning I got my room it was on the first floor thank goodness because I don’t like stairs. They provide coffee complementary 24 hours a day. They do offer shuttle which I strongly encourage you to use because parking is very very limited when it fills up. Upon entering the room it’s kind of small for a queen bed and the bathroom is tight however it is acceptable for one person. If you had two people it might be a little congested and tight regardless. I change my mind here are the three things about this place that r horrible the TV reception, the Internet and the shower head!! Laaawd gwiz. Don’t expect good water pressure, Internet service and the TV reception is in and out. The bad quality is comfortable, the sheets are clean pillows are clean, bathroom is clean everything was great about the room as far as cleanliness, but the hotel is very very outdated and old. I really don’t mean to put down the hotel itself - if you stay here don’t expect for them to roll out the red carpet and that’s OK... I got it. I would stay here again though. High 3!

We stayed at Pacific Marina for two nights. I chose it because it was close to the airport, and offered a free shuttle. This is a motel, not a hotel, and I've given it five stars because it is an excellent MOTEL.Pacific Marina had 24 hour desk clerks and a little 24 hour store that had fresh milk, pre-packaged sandwiches, chips, candy, ice cream, cookies, and various convenience store type products. So if your jet lag left you absolutely ravenous at 3:00 a.m., these folks had you covered. The rooms were clean, neat and pleasant. The pool looked lovely and was also very clean. I didn't swim in it as I was only there a short time. We checked out at 10:00 a.m. after our second night, and had a flight to Maui at 3:40 p.m. The inn was kind enough to store our suitcases for us while we went sightseeing and they also shuttled us back to the airport for our flight, even though we were no longer guests. A couple of notes about businesses near the motel but not actually part of it: do NOT, repeat DO NOT eat at the Chinese "restaurant" next to the motel. If you have happy memories of Chun King Chow Mein, you'll love the place. Otherwise, do yourself a favor and buy a sandwich from the 24 hour shop at the motel. There is a small "saloon" near the motel as well. It's a "local" in the most highly-colored sense of the word. I am glad I went, just to have the story. Perfectly fine booze, if a somewhat limited selection, with a karaoke machine that really gets a workout and some truly original decorations. Stop in for a whisky and watch the show.

We started staying at the PMI years ago when Cal Joseph was manager and Gino was a new desk clerk. This was our “go to” place on Oahu for years, affordable, friendly, clean, convenient!!!! What more can anyone want in hotel accommodations!!! Our daughter moved home from the mainland with her family for two and a half years (2015-2018) and during that time, we didn’t need a hotel for Oahu trips, but since they decided to move back in mid 2018, we have renewed our acquaintance with PMI...the rooms are a bit upgraded, the rates a little higher, but it’s still the same friendly, clean and convenient hotel we knew from a long time ago!!! Mahalos for keeping Aloha in your hotel experience!!!

I needed a place to stay near the airport, this was it. They provide a shuttle all night and it was quick to get there. Customer service is great. The hotel is older and could use renovation. Room was small but decent. Refrigerator is in bathroom and theres no microwave. Overall it was decent for a short stay.

Nice place to stay for a night. Chinese restaurant adjacent to Motel and frozen food available at he counter with a microwave oven. Too bad a bunch of idiots decided to party at the pool at 3 am with their stereo blasting.

Adequate accommodations, no frills, but convenient and reasonably priced. Located next to the airport, not a lot of restaurant choices nearby within walking distance (we didn’t rent a car.) Friendly and helpful staff!

Stayed here as it was cheap, had parking (either around the building or on the street as the off street parking is quite hard to come by) and was super handy to the airport. Definitely more of a motel. There was a scary warewolf in the lobby - not sure if it's a Halloween thing or not. Staff were friendly. Stairs only to the 2nd and 3rd floor. Room was very basic but the aircon was strong and the wifi worked very well - as you'd expect if there's a router in each room. The bed was comfortable enough. The fan and main light are both turned on from the same wall switch. I couldn't turn the light off to leave the fan running in fear of the pulling the fan off the ceiling in an attempt to pull the cord which seemed to be the light switch. My room only had a fridge and no microwave.I was going to have a shower towards the end of my stay but when I went to take one, no water would come out. In fact, the hot water tap had been completely open for the entire time I was there (and who knows how much longer) and yet there was still no water. It was too late to bother about.The aircon was strong but also very loud. I turned my unit off but even then, the noise of the units from other rooms was very loud and I needed noise cancelling headsets to be able to sleep. Not to mention the aircraft and car noise as the place is situated close to the end of one of the runways.If all you plan on doing is sleeping (with the help of earplugs), then this place may suffice. Otherwise look to avoid it.

This place is a dump! It isn't a HOTEL, its a MOTEL! When we drove up to the location we were shocked. Tried to cancel our reservation but they were going to charge us the full price. WAY over priced and crappy. We almost slept in our car. There was a mini fridge and microwave in the bathroom, just in case you want a bite to eat while you take a dump! Thankfully, we only had one night and we were outta there.

My stay was short, and I didn’t spend much time at the inn itself due to the gathering I attended each day. But the staff was very, very helpful, kind, and knowledgeable. The cleaning staff did an excellent job, and I came back each day to a very tidy room with a newly made bed and fresh towels.

After a long flight you’ll sleep anywhere. This hotel is way overpriced. Hairs everywhere. There was not even a wall between the next room but a door... Bagage keep service was handy though. Better go elsewhere

Although the age of the hotel reminds me of when I was growing up, it was clean, well cared for and the entire staff was polite and accommodating. A comfortable bed, a basic room and the only thing I can say I wished it had was an air conditioner that could keep up with the heat and humidity. The park next door allowed for a nice walk, the pool was a great place to cool down. Restaurants were within walking difference, the hotel sits among commercial warehouses. The airport was a simple, 5-minute shuttle away. Mahalo.

It's only interest is the shuttle to the airport. But aircon was super louf, couldn't sleep! On top you'll get car noise, airplanes, car alarms! It was outlet worst hotel in Hawaii. Only it's staff is ok. The rooms suck and it's barely clean! Skip this hotel if you can!

Very outdated, rooms not at all like pictures. Tv doesn’t come in, very small 8x8 rooms, bathroom barely has enough room to turn around in, looks like a pay by the hour room. Would not recommend kids here at all. It is in a industrial park with warehouses all around.

Honestly, I wouldn’t want to stay here again. As a first impression of Maui it’s not a great one. The rooms are outdated and smell a bit funny. Some staff members were helpful, others didn’t seem to want anything to do with you. You can probably find somewhere better .

We stayed at the pacific marina inn for 1 night and we would not stay there again. The staff was very unwelcoming. The room was extremely outdated and unclean. We overpaid and we are not happy at all with any part of our visit.

Small room, bed moves all the time. Water pipe burst with hot water to start my day. Avoid this hotel. It is difficult to say anything good about this hotel. One star rating is too much for it. The air condition is an old style one with loud noise and leaking. Wi-Fi was working fine.

We stayed for 4 nights & we’d stay here again. The location was great for attractions. It had what we were looking for, good size bed, a/c, hot water, good water pressure, fridge &pool-4 a great rate!

Older hotel , Small rooms , No tub , Shower only . Near Airport , but nowhere Else , It's in an Industrial Park , Nothing is in Walking Distance , Next time I'll pay $20 more a Night and be in a Modern Large room with Amenities !

Everyone was exceptionally helpful. The shuttle operates 24/7. The room and pool area were clean. The on-site restaurant was good and the bar patrons were friendly. It was karaoke night and a ninja warrior show was on the television. I felt like a local. Would definitely return.

It was a clean room and they picked up and dropped off at the airport which was very convenient. The staff was very friendly, informative and helpful. Would recommend hotel. It was close to the airport which was awesome. It is no frill inexpensive room. It is not the marriott, but for a one night stay it was great.

only stayed there for one night to be near airport. Was charged a $10 resort fee, but this was not really a resort at all. Located in an industrial area about about a mile from the airport. Only thing good was 24-hour free shuttle service to airport. They had a restaurant on site, but it was closed due to Hurricane Lane. Only food option was to buy frozen foods at small their small on-site convenience shop with microwave and then bring to our room. Wifi worked fine. Room Air conditioner was loud.

Had to leave Maui early to get to Honolulu to fly out due to Hurricane Lane. Front desk was very helpful and friendly. Room was comfortable and acceptable. Had a microwave, fridge, personal WiFi, and plenty of room. We had a quiet night, no complaints. Not the best of neighborhoods but we did see police patrolling. We Ubered to Waikiki for $20 each way. Hotel itself was very good!

So us 3 sisters had a stop overnight so we got this airport motel with free shuttle , it was dated but not chipped Formica , but heavy decent furnishings and good bedding towels etcetc.Cute reception area and best staff ever, Shuttle was no problems and overall if you just need a bed , do stay here.Only teeny sad we had was restaurant not open and no where else to find a meal unless you order pizza in or buy a frozen something to reheat in room. Shame the pool is in shade most of day.Free 24 coffee at recpt is a lovely touch and again if it's really an in and out this is great.

We stayed here our first night in Oahu because we got in so late. It is close to the airport, but it is in an industrial area. The room we had was not good. The paint was peeling off the walls and the power outlets had so many plugs in them, that it was probably a fire hazard. The people in the office were nice enough but I cannot recommend this hotel.

I stayed here because I didn’t want to stay out in the heat all day for State Races. Okay rooms, super small. Okay place for location. Nice staff. Close to airport, which is the only perk! It seems as if was in a transition phase. Needs to be remodel!

The inn is in fair upkeep with few updates. However, it is reasonably priced and very close to Pearl Harbor. They should market it as such. Under certain circumstances, I would recommend it. The small shop is well equipped. Coffee in the lobby is free.

Had to stay overnight due to a missed flight. This was one of the cheapest and closest hotels to the airport. Employees are super nice. Convenience store came in handy when I was super thirsty. Currently there are only stairs and no elevators but it looks like one elevator might be being built. Coffee and tea are available in the morning in the lobby area. Each room has its own router for WiFi. Swimming pool area was tempting but I didn’t want to unpack before flying out the next morning.There aren’t many walkable places to eat (though there are some) but Zippy’s was a quick drive! Thank goodness for Lyft and Uber. We can tell this place is in the process of revamping a lot of things so I’d def give them another try if I need a place by the airport. This place is no 5-Star hotel but I’m giving it five stars for what it’s worth. Thanks!!

This hotel is basic but all the bases are covered. Its close to the airport with a free shuttle. the rooms are small but clean and nicely furnished. The chinese restaurant on site has great food at reasonable prices. There is plenty of outside seating and although the pool isn't as big as it looks, its still a good size. Its a 5 minute walk to the bus stop into town.

Very convenient and free shuttle from airport. I stay here one night every other year because I can walk to an event held at the Keehi Lagoon. Otherwise, this would not be my lodging of choice. And it may not be the next time.

Since our Delta Flight cancelled due to maintenance problems we needed a hotel for one night. As usual the internet photo was deceiving, even though this is an older hotel it is well maintained and very clean. Even though we were 1 mile from the airport there was no problem with noise. The desk and shuttle staff were very friendly and helpful. The shuttle service runs every 30 minutes to the airport without fail. I would consider staying here again if the rates were cheaper than $303 per room for one night, I used booking.com to book our rooms.

I was traveling from Alaska to Sydney Australia and needed to stay overnight near the airport. This was very convenient for me, free shuttle anytime day or night, you can call them and they would come immediately. The area is commercial but to me that was better, no crowds, none of that homeless issue either nor tourist traps all around you.Sure its not a very expensive resort but its a nice place, i have it booked for my next trip through Oahu.

This hotel was a dump. Friendly people but needs an upgrade. Our bathroom had a dirty rag in the shower and hairs everywhere like it hadn’t been cleaned. I couldn’t wait to leave the place. I didn’t even shower there because it was so gross.

This hotel might be fine if noise doesn’t bother you- we had to sleep with the A/C off as it was so noisy, and then we could hear all the cars pulling into the car park at all hours. The bathroom was basic but clean. The shuttle was useful and staffed by helpful cheerful people. If you must stay here- and it is only 10 minutes from the airport- ask for a room away from the car park.

I highly do not recommend this place. Even though it is conveniently located near the airport, I recommend spending extra money for a lot nicer. The rooms are dated and the wifi is non-existent. My room vent had mold on it. The parking sucks. The location is in the middle of an industrial area. There are no amenities nearby. The photos on the website are a lie. They do not really represent how bad this place is.

Staying at an airport can often be a risk as the nature of being in the airport area can mean being around industrial buildings and no facilities. This is certainly the case with Pacific Marina Inn and a google maps view will show you this. They offer a free shuttle which was modern and good service though a wait of approx 20mins from when we called them.The room had 2 double beds, small with old decor and also wasn’t very clean. The only aircon was a ceiling fan which was really noisy so couldn’t have it on during the night.We booked the Pacific Marina Inn as we had a flight in the morning to Kauai and this worked really well. However, do consider the cost of an Uber to and from Waikiki which was $35 and $50. So staying in Waikiki could be a better option, which is what we would do next time as it’s only 30 mins to the airport.Service at reception was good and helpful.

The stay was fantastic and the front desk help was very accommodating in light of a reservation mix-up. I had reserved a suite for 5 people, but when we arrived they only had a reservation for 2 people. However, the front desk people did everything they could to accommodate all of us. They were apologetic and immediately went into problem solving mode. The only suggestion I might have was the shuttle. When we arrived we called for the shuttle and they told us to wait between 19-20 outside of the airport. We stood by 20 and later another family stood by 19 and they were picked up first. Perhaps taking the name of the party would help with these type of mix-ups, since they only have one shuttle that makes the trips back and forth. However, due to the proximity of the airport it was not a problem at all. We reserved here due to a 14 hour layover and I would do it again.

We needed to stay close to HNL airport for two days or about a day and a half and did not want to pay the price for hotel downtown. We were not expecting a fancy hotel. We got a reasonably priced hotel. The hotel was a little older and furnishings was adequate and the bed slept very well. The shower was excellent. with plenty of pressure and hot water. The room also had a small refrig and a microwave. The room was clean. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Coutesy van service was excellent and very timely. I really liked the large selection in their lobby store for drinks, snacks, and just about anything you would need or want. You did not need any vending machines. They are adding an elevator so that you do not have to take stairs ;up. We used the pool one day and very refreshing. All our needs were met.

We knew that we were expecting a basic hotel, but it was below our low expectations.We had e-mailed the hotel about 12 hours before we travelled, asking for the shuttle to pick us up. It didn't so, being aware of how long other people waited for the shuttle when phoning after arrival, we got an Uber from the airport to the hotel.Check-in took a little while, and we paid our "Resort Fee". I'm not sure what the fee is for as there was no TV signal or internet in the room. If it wasn't for the fee I would have given the hotel a rating of 3.The rooms were basic but OK. The air conditioning was noisy but we couldn't sleep without it.I'd certainly look at other options before staying there again.

We stayed here for one night before a long international flight home. Below is a summary of our stay:1. After numerous calls to the hotel, the shuttle finally picked us up after 45 minutes. Ironically the flight from Maui was shorter than the wait for the shuttle from the hotel that’s only 5 minutes away.2. There’s no wifi in the room. Where I come from, this is called false advertising. When I told the front counter about this, they said they were going through a “transition” and that some rooms don’t have wifi. It appears that this is the same excuse that has been used on other negative reviews. 3. The house keeping staff were very loud early in the morning yelling outside which isn’t ideal when sleep is needed before a long flight.4. Our toilet was blocked and we couldn’t use it for the duration of our stay.5. The hotel claims to have air conditioned rooms - yes this is true, however the air conditioner is as loud as a 747 roaring in your room.The only shining light is the Chinese restaurant down stairs. We enjoyed our meal there. Other than that, I probably would’ve preferred to sleep in the airport. I also don’t know how this place justifies a resort fee (money grab). Don’t make the same mistake as us. Stay elsewhere or just continue your journey home.

The room was clean and the staff in the office was friendly. The information about “the bus” was super helpful. A small table and chairs would have been helpful. We enjoyed our stay and will be happy to use the Marina inn again

It’s close to the airport and there is a reasonable swimming pool that the kids enjoyed. The Chinese restaurant on site is cheap and cheerful. The rooms are pretty average but clean. The air conditioning is very loud which can make it hard to sleep. Ok for a one night stop over but that’s about it.

After spending the day with my family in central oahu due to the passing of a family member earlier in the day, as i was driving home back to waikiki i guess all of the days stress just hit me and i was starting to drive a little unsafe. I decided to check into the pacific marina because ive always heard that they had decent prices. I checked in about 10 / 10:30pm. Check in staff was very friendly. When i got into room, it looked pretty decent. I layed on bed for about 30 mins then decided to shower before going to sleep. After i showered, as i was drying off i noticed some small black things on the ceiling by the light then noticed some on the wall. After inspecting closer i realized they were bugs. At that point i knew i wouldnt be able to sleep in room because i dont like bugs. Anyway, i went down to the front desk and told the clerk what was going on, i told him to go have a look himself. He said that the customers are always right but said that there wasnt anything he could do. So in conclusion, for the use of a bath mat, 1 towel, and a hand towel, and a bar of soap for less than an hour and a half, and having bugs in the room, i was billed $205.00. Totally not what i was expecting.

This was a lay-over stay for one night so I was only there from 3:30 am to check out at 11:00 am. This is my review -the location was very loud, heard planes coming in the entire time. The rooms face outdoors and my room faced a parking lot and warehouse. There are no elevators so I had to lift my 50 lb bag up the stairs. The faucet in the shower dripped constantly and the room is outdated. The only hotel nearby was the restaurant hotel and I did not feel as if they were glad to have my business but more of a burden for asking. It is my recommendation that if this is your only hotel in order to come to Honolulu that you should pick another island.

This motel is close to the airport and had its own free shuttle bus. A basic standard room.Shower worked well with lots of hot water. We were next to the pool and were comfortable for the night. The bus driver was helpful with his knowledge of the area.

This hotel charges a $10 resort fee, which they claim gives you Internet in the rooms. It doesn't. You can connect in the lobby although even there the service is very slow and doesn't always work. For instance, I was never able to get Remote Desktop to work and streaming audio or video is totally out of the question. They give you a number to call for support but the people at that number say that they no longer have a contract to support the hotel.

Gordon175
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Nice place and fairly close to the beach. Good shopping and restaurants nearby. Kids loved the pool. Lots of good places to eat and buy cool stuff. Staff was very friendly and helpful with any all needs!

Unfortunately this was very over priced for the facilities. When I booked it said it had a microwave - there was not one present. There was no cold water - funny but yes I did want a shower = The workers staying decided to have a pool party but to be fair the young chap was good at moving them into their units. The receptionist wasn't particularly friendly or happy...And the air conditioner was like a freight train coming through every time it clicked on. Not a happy stay but the shuttle driver was great - efficient and helpful.

The hotel has really upgraded. Staff is very friendly and its really clean. Not to mention low affordable prices. Air conditioner is very strong and cold but the hot water lasts a very long time. My room was across the pool but it was quiet. The lounge is comfy. You can enjoy drinks while singing your favorite karaoke songs.

This hotel is located near the airport, and offers free shuttle service to the airport. We had a flight to take early in the morning on the next day so it was very convenient. The staff were very nice except one lady. She was at the reception when we arrived there. No greeting, no smile at all. She seems like she’s not interested in working at all. Horrible attitude. We had a very bad first impression of this hotel. The room itself had weird smell and we didn’t like it. Also I felt it was strange that the minibar was at the bathroom. Minibar and the toilet were at the same area?? Very strange.

Pacific Marina is way better then before the rooms are renovated so much nicer. It was our second stay cation. Thanks for a good time.No problem will go back so long kamaaina rate are reasonable. Wish the rooms at a microwave that would make it even better and make the coffee in the lobby all day since we pay resort fee of 10$. Otherwise its so much improved. Thanks

The Pacific Marina Inn Airport is kinda a diamond in the ruff, it is located minutes (less than five) from HNL. They have a free airport shuttle and the driver was very friendly and helpful, providing all sorts of tips for the stay in Honolulu. The location itself would appear to be a bit sketchy at first, as hotel is located in a industrial area, not an unsafe area just industrial with not much in the ways of restaurants, stores ect. The property contains a onsite Chinese restaurant with limited hours, and a hotel bar staffed by a friendly bar tender, with cheap drinks and offered free roasted turkey with white rice as a snack. There was karaoke going on with the same singers over and over. Not bad free entertainment. The room I had was recently updated with paint, flat screen tv and new flooring. There was an opening under the door which allowed quite a bit of light through but after 10 hrs of flying, it didn't matter much. The bathroom was also updated with new shower tile. The room and bathroom were overall smaller than usual for motel's but was comfy. The window unit AC allowed for the temp to be set so it turned on and off instead of running constantly. There is an onsite store for soda/snacks/ect which is decently priced. Fairly large selection also. A true advantage of this location is the proximity to Pearl Harbor and the Norwegian Cruise Line Pride of America cruise ship. Pearl Harbor is approx. a $12-14 Uber ride and within 15 minutes of the property. The Pride of America is about a $15-20 Uber and for Hawaii this is a deal!!! The entire staff was friendly and helpful and you can observe the property is still making renovations to improve. I paid about $100 a night which is a steal for a hotel in Honolulu and I cant find any true negative about this diamond in the ruff motel which is decorated in Hawaiian culture and hey Hawaii 50 has filmed there! I saw the pictures on the wall!!

After working on the Big Island for a few days, I stayed for one night at Pacific Marina Inn. The room was fine. The front desk however...I arrived at 9pm via Hawaiian Airlines, called the front desk, and was told to "exit the Baggage Claim C, turn right, and wait by the two large white umbrellas. The shuttle will be there in about 20 minutes." There's a small parking lot at this spot, so I settled in and waited.And waited.After 40 minutes I called the front desk again, verified that I was in the right spot, and was told to wait another 10 or 15 minutes. After another 20 minutes (an hour after I had first made contact), I again called the front desk. The guy working the front desk was confused, attempted to tell me that I was in the wrong place, and finally reluctantly that the shuttle would be there shortly.So I waited for another 10 minutes.The van driver was there promptly after I called and we had a good conversation on the 5 minute drive (!) to the hotel. I could have walked to the hotel, if only I had known.

My family and I spent one night here at the beginning of our vacation and had no complaints. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the airport shuttle was quick and easy.

The worst hotel we have seen next to Knights Inn in Orlando,Fl. At that hotel you could see the black mold in the carpet and on the walls. You can`t see the mold in the Pacific Marina Inn,but with the smell of bleach as we opened the door. They must be trying to hide something. The smell of old hotel was even stronger than the smell of the bleach. They are supposedly in process of renovation of rooms. We were not lucky enough to get a remodeled room. We were only there for two nights or we would have checked into another place.The room is very small. A bathroom so small only fits one person. Paint and plaster cracking and falling off the walls.They have been building a elevator for months and still not even close to completion. They allowed a group of guests to scream and make a lot of commotion for hours. Right up until the pool was closed for the night. These were grown adults and were certainly not act as they were. For the price we paid for two nights it was very disappointing,over three bills! The Chinese restaurant was also a big waste of cash. I do not remember having this bad American /Chinese food for 3 decades. Do not waste your money eating there. This is a very industrial area . No food no stores close by. The only positive we can say is the proximity to the airport. It is close walking distance to the bus routes,only $2.50 for a day pass each person. Take bus 20 or 42 into Waikiki. Where you will find everything you need.

I stayed one night at this hotel after a flight delay out of Honolulu. I chose the hotel due to the close proximity to the airport and a free shuttle. Staff were friendly and helpful, but the hotel was pretty overpriced for what you get. Very simple rooms with loud A/C. In the future I would likely choose another option.

Well, after checking in we left and went to dinner. Upon return there was no parking, we parked on the left side next to a fence hoping our car wouldn't get towed away. I got up twice to check if the car was still there and it was. The TV wasn't working, called the front desk for help and was told someone could come and check it but it was close to midnight and didn't want any service at that time. It was mentioned the next morning again and someone from maintenance came up to find the wiring was damaged and needed to be fixed. We then watched the morning news and left. The A/C was loud and noisy.

We missed our flight because of our fault. The staff here were super nice - loaned us the phone to call out, reassured us, stayed positive, drove us to the airport to finalise plans and then drove us back! They also secured a room at the cheapest rate with a swimming pool for us since we now had to stay an extra night.We enjoyed the extra day in paradise - their convenience store was stocked with food that were affordable. Well maintained.Tip - take the higher floor if you can walk up the stairs. It's a lot quieter. Also the wifi is alot stronger if the rooms were facing the pool.Big shout out to Emil and Gloria for their aloha hospitality.

Want something close to airport this is probably the place. Those pictures make this place look like an elegant resort. Trust me it is not that nice. You are in an industrial area only. One restaurant (attached to hotel). Chinese Food only. That is your choice for breakfast as they make some American breakfast food (Eggs take like eggs used in rice dishes). Place is loud. Seems like people living there (I may be wrong). Shuttle: I called when I got there...OK be there in 15 minutes. 45 minutes later I call again. He is at airport should be there in a minute. Shuttle showed up about 20 minutes after that. Claims people needed to be dropped off first (guess let ME wait an hour). Rooms are very small. My room had a 6x10 room for sleeping. a 4 x 10 room for bathroom (which had fridge inside it). We were at end room and all we could hear was cars parking all night in parking lot. Not impressed at all. It is cheaper but splurge a little more...I know I will!

I'm afraid this is a hotel that seems to be in business for one reason: to provide a room near an airport. Everything else indicates it doesn't care a whit about its guests. Our arrival was greeted with indifference by a front desk clerk who seemed unhappy and distracted, and our room seemed to scream: "Let's put in a bed and a couple of desks and they'll be content". No colour or warmth, no bedside table or lamp, no coffee machine. In fact, nothing but a small, spartan room that is perfectly suited to the industrial area in which it is located. But there's wifi and a television, we observed. Ah, but the wifi doesn't work. Surprise, neither does the telly. Morning coffee/breakfast consists of a coffee pot and Cremora in the lobby. Breakfast? Oh, it's not served till the restaurant opens at 9am. Excuse me? An airport hotel that doesn't offer its guests any morsel of food till 9am?? Better pack a muffin or bring something from the airport if you're hoping for anything to eat here. We did try exploring the area for alternatives. Unfortunately the industrial area we explored for more than an hour yielded little more than a fast food joint and a Chinese cafe --hardly the stuff breakfast is made of. And it's certainly not the most scenic area for an early morning jaunt unless you enjoy strolling alongside busy highways. All this may be tolerable when you're paying dirt-cheap, budget pricing. But when you're paying almost $150 dollars for accommodation, I have to say it's pretty pitiful. Ending on a positive note, it's very close to the airport and there's a free shuttle.

The Good: it's close to the airport, shuttle service. The bad: it's in the industrial part of town, the only restaurant around closed down. The ugly: the rooms are small, in desperate need of refurbishment. The ac unit is so loud sounds like a jet engine. Paid $119 + taxes, twice too much for this run down place. Never again.

Great hotel close to airport, basic but excellent for the price and hotel for travelers. It's not a resort, just a simple hotel with great local staff.Bar and restaurant on premises.Airport shuttle service which is very convenient.

Stayed for overnight after long transatlantic then on from Vancouver. Place is totally overpriced, stayed in better college rooms in London for less. Felt like we'd walked into a bad movie set - unfriendly staff, no lift, rooms less than basic, t.v. didn't work, noisy, noisy air con - for our first night of a long awaited holiday just wanted to cry and couldn't get out fast enough. Airport shuttle took ages to get to us and no offer of help with bags either. Just don't do it - our neighbours were of the same opinion too.

Very simple, but has a fridge. Had to call tech support to get the wifi to work at all, and then it was slow. Pool was clean, as was everything else. Front desk staff very good. Location is odd, but close to airport.

Always stay here when transiting through HNL. It's not a luxury hotel and the rooms are showing their age (my 4 of 5 rating instead of a 5). Still the property is kept in good repair, the room is comfortable, everything works. Hotel staff are friendly and efficient. Free Wi-Fi too.

We only needed this hotel for one night as we were flying out early the following morning. There was nothing special about it. Very basic. It had the 2 beds we needed for the 4 of us and a shower. It was small. We actually only spent about 8 hours (probably less) in it, so it was fine. Only problem was there was seemed to be some people not staying at the hotel using the carpark till about 12:00am and making a racket.I would recommend it for anybody needing a place to sleep before an early flight out of Honolulu. Oh, and it has a free shuttle for pick up and drop off for the airport.

Situated in an industrial park with nothing nearby. Unless you want to eat to the onsite restaurant, it is a $20 Uber - each way - to a restaurant. Rooms are Motel 6 quality. Courtyard was under construction so no place to sit outside. Shuttle was convenient and free.

Mostly a quiet place to stay, free parking, old Hawaiian style, excellent staff service, free shuttle service to airport. Rooms are small but have comfortable beds, great water pressure. Have stayed at this spot many times; being from an outer island, this has always been a convenient place to stay.

My sister made last minute reservations at this inn since all other hotels were solid booked. Well she and her husband checked in after 11pm and what a mess. The door looked as if it was broken into. The blinds had mildew all over it. The paint was cracked on the walls. The basin was rusted and moldy. The a/c was louder than our voices. There is no entry upon entering....open the door and there’s the bed. I’m sure this room was being renovated and they decided to rent it out because of a desperate sale. I’m sending photos to BBB, board of health, fire inspector, dept. of taxation, all travel bureaus and the media until we get a full refund (over $600). It was filthy. Shame on pacific marina inn......no aloha there.
user_name:
Harriet Nina C
Pahoa, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We were a bit disappointed upon arrival as it is a very old style motel in an industrial area BUT the room and bathroom were clean, great water pressure in the shower, comfy beds, there is a Chinese restaurant there and the food was delicious and cheap and we had a great night singing karaoke in the bar! Close to the airport with a complimentary shuttle so great spot for one night between flights.

I was extremely disappointed by this place. The rooms look nothing like the photos and are absolutely dreadful. I feel like I was completely ripped off. At almost $300 American Dollars (much more in Canadian Dollars) I felt I was horrifically cheated. I have taken photos of how terrible this place is and I was expecting a much nicer room and the room I got smelled, wasn't painted as shown in the photos, the walls were stained, the door kept popping open in the middle of the night, the bed was lumpy and uncomfortable. Everything in the room looked worn, dated, and scary. The loudness carried throughout the night and I couldn't wait until morning to get the heck out of there. Then they charge a $10 resort fee? For what? There was no freaking internet, the pool looked nasty, there was construction going on all over the place, what the heck was the $10 for? This hotel should be ashamed of itself for the horrific prices they charged me. My hotel in downtown Waikiki was half the cost of this place and had loads of amenities!!!! This place is disgusting! I will never return, and I have never been more furious about being ripped off so badly. This place should be reported!

Great place for the value. Comfy beds, nice pool. Stayed one night. good location for us. Near Pearl harbor and airport. Great shuttle drivers, free shuttle to and from airport, that was a huge help. Nice drivers

Very convenient for an overnight near the airport. Nothing special, but clean. Actually has a pool. Staff were fine. Food can ordered, we didn't. Vending machines on site. Shuttle leaves every 1/2 hour to airport.

We had an 11 hour overnight layover and picked this hotel for the proximity to airport and the free shuttle. We checked in late and left early and that was enough time there. I wouldn’t have wanted to stay here for a vacation—it felt like we were in the midst of an industrial area—but for the night it was fine. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. There is no insulation and hence no sound barriers and so you are at the mercy of the people walking around outside being quiet. Luckily by the time we were ready to sleep it was fine. The room was small and dated, but felt mostly clean. The do have maintence issues that need addressed like the crack above the air conditioner and the parts of the wall coming off. The cost to get a cab or other transport to hotels is such that this place was worth it for a night.

A nice simple hotel to crash in after a long flight . I chose this hotel because it offered free shuttle to and from the airport and it was close. The hotel is under construction right now but that did not bother us at all except early in the morning the workers parked out front of our room and we could hear them talking. The onsite restraunt does not open till 9:00 so all you can get for breakfast is coffee from the lobby or juice from the vending machines. A little overpriced but O.K. for a one night stay.

Came late and had to depart next morning so we chose this hotel. The room was clean but very basic. Free shuttle. I would stay there if you only need to sleep. Nothing to stay longer for. There are vending machines in the lobby. Really nothing special but clean.

The list of what I didn't like is extensive. In point form: 1. The check-in staff was unfriendly, insolent, and indifferent. 2. Overpriced (as well as overcharged). 3. Filthy floors. Wear socks, you've been warned. 3. No working elevator (and no offer to assist with luggage. Met with eye-roll when asked for help up 3 flights of stairs.) 4. Charged 10 dollars in cash extra for "amenities" upon check-in. 5. No breakfast on offer until after 9:00 am. No food available after 10:00 pm. 6. Filthy, broken blinds. This is the WORST hotel experience I have ever had. From the eye-rolling check-in staff, to the filthy floor in my room, to the exposed wires for tv and A/C, to the 10 dollar charge in cash upon check-in for amenities. I could go on, but will end with this; Do NOT stay here. If you do, refuse the 10 dollar cash charge upon checking in. When I made a phone call from my room, I could not call out. When I called to the front desk to inquire, I was told I must pay 75 cents for local calls. Yes, the phone (an amenity, right?) was blocked from use until I confirmed I would pay 75 cents. When I complained in the morning, I was refunded $9.25 in cash (yes, they deducted my local call to the taxi company). When I checked my receipt, I had been billed 10 extra dollars anyway. This place is a hole that exists only because of its proximity to the airport for quick stays. That being said, there are absolutely no "amenities" for quick transfer passengers. In particular, no food for early morning departures, or later evening arrivals. The cost for this experience? $214 USD. STAY AWAY.

Close to airport with free shuttle between airport and hotel every 30mins. Good location to catch early flight! There is AC Chinese Restaurant next to it but close at 8:00pm and open from 9:00am. Food quality is good and price is fair.A bit noisy as airport nearby.

Accommodation is very basic but the showers are hot, the staff are friendly, and its so close to the airport. Not glamorous but simple done well. Didnt get a dip in the pool this time but looked inviting.

After reading the recent trip-advisors reviews after booking my stay, I was very reluctant and a tad worried about what I might find! But it was unexpectedly wonderful. Everything in those reviews is very contrary to what I experienced. On arrival into the airport, I spoke to one of the airport staff, who directed me to the phones to ring the hotel. They came and picked me up promptly. The staff at the hotel, were friendly and helpful. The pool was amazing and great for a late night swim, with a very clean room of ample size- even perfect. The only downside - if there was one - was that the restaurant wasn't opened because of christmas - but hey, I could've gone downtown. But I simply ate some of the snacks in the vending machine. This is a great place to stay for the price, especially on the kiwi dollar. And so handy for the airport. If I came through again, I wouldn't hesitate to stay. Thanks.

room was clean and comfortabledesk staff was great and very informativevery affordable place to stay in Hawaiigreat location near the airporthighly recommendvery nice pool and parking lotshow was great

Ballwin, Missouri, United States

review_body: My flight would depart very early on a Monday and I chose to stay in a hotel near the airport on the previous Sunday. The choice for the Pacific Marina Inn Airport could not have been better! I arrived before the check-in period, but they took an extra step and managed to get me an appartment almost immediately. I had lunch and dinner at the Chinese restaurant at the premises and at 6:45 on Monday their van took me to the airport on time. I recommend the Pacific Marina Inn Airport!

If you are high maintenance and want apologetic, super polite staff, this is not the place for you. This hotel is good value ( by the expense Honolulu standards) and close to the airport. Just use the complimentary phone on your left as you leave the airport to arrange your free pick up. The only restaurant ( at the hotel ) , within a mile serves fatty /stodgy food, and opens at 9am....seems pretty popular ( is closed Mondays) The hotel is located in an industrial area. with not much to see in the area. If you want better, pay 40 bucks more. and stay at the best western. I will stay again , based on price .

Nothing fancy. A simple and clean, if dated hotel. Not bad if you're just staying between flights, though absolutely Not A hotel if you're spending more than one night.Currently a lot of construction at the hotel, so check that it's done.

Don't let the picture of the pool fool you. It looks nothing like that. The room was smelly and dingy. Not great service. Don't rely on them for a wake up call, that's for sure. The only good thing was the free airport shuttle. The thing I didn't like about the shuttle was signs all over reminding you to give a tip (signs like that make me not give a tip). If you need a cheap place to stay for one night, it's ok. But don't expect anything special

It is expensive comparing the value. Rooms are small, not nice, quite noisy. Shower is old and you can hear it to the room. Good only for short oversleep before departure. Coffe complimentary as well as airport transfer for free to the airport every half an hour.

excellent photo of the swimming pool. Actual pool is tiny. And how do they have the audacity to charge a "resort fee" for this place? Broken hair drier, no lotion, no coffee in room, no decaf even at the lobby, not even a cheap pen in the room. Internet signal is weak. Really, what is there to justify a resort fee, other than owner greed? What it has is proximity to the airport, and a shuttle service that worked for me.

Eventhough it’s not the cheapest hotel it’s the only affordable option close to the airport. They have a nice big pool and there rooms were very clean. The food in the chinese Restaurant that works with the hotel is just okay imo. But would definitely stay again if you have an overlay e.g..

So we stopped over at this hotel in between flights from New York to Australia . Shuttle bus!!! Well lol we emailed and requested to be picked up and got no response we arrived no one was there , called and were told someone would be there within 15 Mins, 45 Mins later no joy, called back hotel got a little grumpy staying driver sat there for 20 Mins you weren’t there. As much as I love a game of hide and seek after and 11 hour flight it wasn’t a game I wanted to be playing. Hotel called driver to be told her had gone to the wrong terminal. 1 hr later we arrived at the hotel. Got booked in and asked if they had food this was around 2 in afternoon. No but tonight you can get food in the pub great. So we go to our room get sorted and decide to do some washing, washed clothes and popped them in the dryer after 3 cycles clothes were still wet. When I asked staff, they laughed and said oh no you used the bottom one it plays up!!! They did not offer a complimentary dryer just laughed. So now it’s closer to 6 and we get dressed and head to the ‘pub’ use your imagination with this one! The pub is a room with no aircon so everyone was ridiculously hot and sweating. When we asked for the food menu we were given a dominos pizza menu!!!No food just dominos, in fairness the best part of this hotel was the female bar staff she was great and ended up closing the ‘pub’ as it was too hot! I wouldn’t go back pay a little more and head somewhere a little nicer and more reliable. Last thing you want is hassle and to have to find food when your in between flights .

Room and location is perfect. I like the fact that I don't have to pay for parking.Room is always cleaned every day. All the maids are very pleasant.I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. It's perfect.

The flight back to New Zealand leaves early so we had to sadly leave magical Maui the day before. Having done Waikiki previously we decided to spend our one day on Ohau driving to the North Shore so we just wanted a place to stay overnight, close to the airport where we picked up our rental car for one day. This worked perfectly as the Pacific Marina is literally 5 minutes away, the staff were very nice and when we asked if they could look after our bags for the day they let us check into our family room very early. Room was perfect for our needs with two rooms and four beds. Clean and tidy, very basic but the price is reasonable. My husband was even able to drop off our rental then jog the five minutes back to the hotel at the end of the day! We found it to be very quiet overnight, no people talking or banging doors and even though close to the airport little airplane noise (could have been the wind direction?) Our kids even had a swim even though the pool was chilly! The free shuttle made things very simple. The lobby is funky. If you know what you're getting I think you would find this fine for one night, especially for Kiwis/Aussie families used to travelling.

Excellent place to stay if youre in transit because it has both shuttle service to and from the airport and front desk services for checking in and out is super efficient. Rooms are a little tiny but comfortable.

I stayed at this hotel when I arrived late into Honolulu and had to leave early for a flight to Kona. The shuttle service, cost and distance to airport were excellent. Older, 1950's classic but clean and staff were very friendly.

The free hotel shuttle took us from the car rental to the hotel and back to the airport for our flight; drivers very congenial. Hotel room was small, but very clean with a comfortable bed. They let us check in at noon as we were exhausted and had colds. We ate a good dinner at nearby old time Tiki Bar. I would recommend this hotel as inexpensive and totally adequate for our needs.

This hotel is very close to the airport, but not so many restaurants close by. The bus stop is very close to go downtown. The shuttle is very efficient and clean. I would recommend for one or two nights but not much longer. The hotel is great but the environment is not that great.

Close to the airport and the free shuttle service makes access going and coming very easy. Rooms are clean, air conditioning worked well and wifi is included. Our evening check-in before a flight out the next day was less than impressive (not much more than a gruff request for ID and credit card) but that was made up for the next morning with smiles and greetings as we checked out and took the shuttle back to the airport.Aside from the shuttle and an OK place to sleep for the night, there isn't much more to say.

I stayed here for one night between flights. Shuttle pick up drop off was fantastic!!! Room was small but clean. Not much with in walking distance in the way of food or sights. Restaurant attached was good. There is a pool and bar also.

If you are just looking for a place to stay before heading on to another island this Hotel/rather motel might be a good option as it is close to the airport and the shuttle for free. My room and bathroom was clean so I could not complain. Of course one did hear planes and cars during night, but being located only 1 Mi away from the airport this is kind of obvious. This being said the area around is rather sketchy and you should propably not stroll around on your own after dark.

The room we had was very clean and the front desk was extremely helpful and nice. Plenty of parking available and accessible. I visit O'ahu often and never knew about this place. I'm glad I do now. It's definitely on my list to visit and stay again and will recommend to anyone who just needs a place to sleeo and shower. They also have a pool. I didn't use but it looked very well maintained and clean.Mahalo!

After some rerouting, I ended up with a nine hour layover in Honolulu between two long-haul flights. An inexpensive and clean rooom one mile to the airport. Free shuttle service and accommodating staff. If you need a respite between flights, give them a call. Hopefully, they will have an available room.

I was under no illusion, before I arrived I knew I was booking somewhere basic for a few hours sleep between flights.Having called for the shuttle it arrived at the terminal within 10 minutes and the driver was friendly and helpful.The people at reception was similarly helpful.The room was modest and simply furnished but was clean and the bed was comfortable. The air conditioning was a quite noisy but was very efficient and so didn't need to be left on the whole time.The wifi was pretty reliable, if not the fastest and free tea and coffee were offered in the morning, in the lobby.There's certainly nothing sophisticated about this place but for a good value spot before an early flight, after a late evening flight or between flights I'd happily stay here again.

Located in an industrial area so not a lot around. About $17 Uber ride to downtown if you want. Perfect cost effective place to stay near the airport with a free shuttle. Rooms are small, motel style entries (from outside). Rooms are clean, only two towels in room so if you need more just ask from front desk. Front Desk staff very friendly. 2 of the 4 vending machines only really take $1 dollar bills well so break your larger bills at front desk if needed, they don't even really take coins. Our room (156) had great air-conditioning and a fan, desk, wall mounted TV with cable, small table with a lamp and luggage rack. Our room fit our travel baby bed as well. Coffee and Lipton tea in main lobby in the morning. Lagoon Chinese restaurant does breakfast lunch and dinner but is closed Mondays. The Lounge opens in the afternoon but is closed Sundays. If you don't want to venture out you can have food delivered, by Domino's or BiteSquad (look it up online). Wifi is touch n go. They had to reset the modem in our room and it was still finicky and would go in and out so keep that in mind. Solid hot water. Small refrigerator in bathroom but doesn't seem to keep things too cold, though I didn't try and adjust this so it might have been a setting issue.They do allow late check out if you ask at arrival. As of this review: noon at no charge. $50 to stay till 3p. $80 to stay till 7p. This was convenient for us as we had a red eye that left at 10:35pm and we didn't want to be hanging at the airport with a toddler for 10+ hrs.Nice clean swimming pool available with lay back chairs and covered tables.This was a good place for us as we transitioned between trips to and from the airport. No frills, basic, clean accommodation I was pleased.

One of the advantages of staying at this motel was the closeness to the airport and the free shuttle that was provided. The staff was friendly and I was able to get a room earlier than the normal check-in time. So for this, I was grateful. In terms of location, apart from being close to the airport, is not the best. There is nothing nearby apart from being situated in the middle of an industrial area. That did not prevent me from enjoying a good sleep.The Wi-fi was ok but from a cyber security point of view, I have a major reservation. Price wise and what was on offer I would say that it was average if not a bit high.undergoing the renovation that is well overdue is a good move. I hope that part of the renovation would encompass a top-notch restaurant and other facilities that would make anyone staying there self-sufficient with no need to go wandering around for basic necessities.

This hotel has the bare essentials to get you through the night. There is a great shuttle service and the drivers were good (the Australian driver was exceptional and we enjoyed a friendly chat with him). On arrival we noticed a sign about local construction taking place from 8pm - 5am... I asked about the noise as I'm a light sleeper. Not ideal, but the man at reception was good to move us to a room at the back of the hotel to avoid noise as best as possible. Turns out the air con was so loud I couldn't hear anything else.The room was clean and had decent air con, but it is very dated and in need of a refurbishment. Thanks to the staff for their friendly service, this could be a great hotel.Conveniently located close to the airport for early morning flights.

The rooms at this hotel were clean and tidy but dated. They allowed us early access to our room as the room had already been cleaned. There is a Chinese restaurant (food is great) and a bar to choose from. There is a transfer bus that can pick up and drop off from the airport plus a pool which is a good spot for some afternoon drinks. Overall, Staff were friendly & helpful when required and rooms are good for the price.

While I'm at a air bnb without acThis place is super cool and friendly giving a basket of fruit everyday ... super clean and very well priced for our loved one after seeing what they received we wished we stayed there!

We Hotwired a hotel near the airport the night before we were returning home. We waited over 45 minutes for the shuttle to take us to the hotel which was only a few miles away. Three phones calls and several drive bys and we finally got picked up. Itl is in an industrial area and is old and run down. Very old style motel that has probably just seen its best days long ago. The room wasn't very clean. The A/C rattled all night. The beds however, had super clean, crisp linens. The morning shuttle was on time and quick. I guess it is hard to find reasonably priced lodging in Honolulu but I wish I had paid more and stayed in e.g. a chain hotel where I knew what I would be getting.

Arrived here after a long day of traveling in hopes of getting to a nice hotel. We could not have been more wrong. It's not that the staff don't try to keep this place looking nice, it's just that the building is very old and shouldn't be used as a hotel. The place is right in the middle of the industrial region in a very sketchy and poor neighborhood. Close proximity to the airport makes a lot of noise. Rooms have bad noise isolation. When walking to the rooms, there are plastic buckets outside of almost every room to catch water from the leaky AC units. There are no restaurants nearby and walking down the street to find one is highly advised against given the surrounding neighborhood. The rooms have holes in the wall and the power strip broke free of its mountings so one night none of my devices charged. HOWEVER, the staff keeps the rooms very clean and comfortable, and I managed to sleep fairly well given the circumstances. But for 125 bucks a night?? Find a hotel in Waikiki for a little more and you will be much happier.

I've stayed here a few times. basic, but super cool staff, clean, and close to airport. if you're looking for fancy go somewhere else.. if you're looking for cool local people and fair prices stay here. good job gang!

This hotel is good for those who has a late flight arrival or early flight departure at Honolulu Airport. It is a 5 minute drive/shuttle ride or 30 minute walk between the hotel and the airport. The hotel is situated in a quiet industrial area with no amenities nearby, and it is pretty expensive. But this is the cheapest option near Honolulu Airport. The cheaper hotels are all in downtown Honolulu or Waikiki.The hotel itself has a swimming pool, a Chinese restaurant and some vending machines for drinks, snacks and basic medicine. My room is clean, but the air-con is quite loud and the wi-fi is intermittent. There is nothing to see around the hotel, but a 5 minute walk will bring you to the nearby Keehi Lagoon Beach Park, with large open spaces, a few sports facilities, a children's playground, and a so-so beach. To travel from the hotel to downtown Honolulu or Waikiki, you can walk to the nearest bus stop (Nimitz & Lagoon) and take a bus (USD 2.50). But I took Uber instead (because bus service is infrequent and slow).

We were caught with an extended layover at HNL and didn't want to hang about for an extra 8 hours. After a quick look there are only a very few hotels close to the airport. Pacific Marina Inn has it all. Small clean rooms although extremely dated, a restaurant and a separate bar / lounge, and a free airport shuttle. No added pictures are needed as the hotel's are fairly lose to what we found.

while the location is industrial like, the room was clean and comfortable for only a nights stay to catch an early morning flight. The shuttle service to/from the airport was very helpful and the staff was very friendly.

In transit in Honolulu, to join another island, I slept one night in Pacific Marina.Its a correct hotel but a bit expensive according the quality.Rooms are correct, good bed, shuttle from the airport every 30 minutes or at your arrival if you ask it from the airport (courtesy phone available, luggages zona, carousel 3) quiet calm despite the initial impression.A little bit old, in the industrial area of the airport, no choice of restaurants around are the weak points.But very practical for this kind of transit.

I chose to stay at this hotel due to the convenient location and free transfer to/from the Honolulu International Airport. However, I'm glad my family didn't have to stay with me and therefore only experienced the nice and pleasant Waikiki suburb. Since most accommodation options in Hawaii are overpriced, I wasn't surprised that the Pacific Marina Inn hotel was only $10 or $20 cheaper than better options in Waikiki. However, the cost of transport to/from Waikiki and the time it would take caused me to choose the Pacific Marina Inn, since it was a one-night stay only. The hotel itself reminded me of the Red Roof Inn chain in mainland USA, but a run down version of their counterpart. The room looked old and the gaps in the door, walls and windows allowed for the smell of people smoking outside or in neighbour rooms to disturb my stay. The very thin walls meant that the stay was noisy too. Also, the internet was extremely slow and unreliable. I didn't try any of the amenities and in fact was ready to catch the shuttle back to the airport at crack of dawn! On the bright side, the shuttle driver was very friendly and knowledgeable and we had a good conversation.If I ever visit Hawaii again, I'd rather stay in Waikiki or catch the very first flight from a neighbouring island to avoid having to stay at this property.

A great place to sleep and shower. Room small, AC good, rod for clothing, T.V., pool, vending machines, no coffee maker in room. Coffee maker in lobby a.m. only.Pickup at E down from baggage claim NOT baggage claim. If you complain then you should have paid 4 x as much and headed into town. What a great staff. Thank you

Can't say what the hotel is like, but don't book at the Pacific Marina Inn. We had to change our travel plans, and so cancelled our reservation well before we travelled, and within the time allowed so we did not incur a fee. After not getting a response from the email included in our reservation, we called their number. The lady was friendly and said our room had been cancelled, however, our credit card was still charged. We have emailed several times, and the phone number on their website and via Google no longer works. Castle Resorts used to run this hotel, and it looks we were mistakenly charged around the time they stopped running it, so the mistake may be something to do with the transition. In any case, not being able to contact the hotel to rectify this is frustrating. Don't go there!

Our flight from Vancouver arrived too late to fly to the Big Island, so we stayed here. It was only 10 minutes from the airport and had a free shuttle service, so it was excellent value for someone in our position. The room was very basic and quite small, but it served our needs.

The rooms are done up nice and gives one a great tropical vibe. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, shower was hot, everything I needed. The free shuttle service was a big plus, one driver was awesome and in the morning one was not, same with the checking in the first guy was very friendly and helpful the next one was just the opposite.The free coffee in the lounge in the morning sure hit the spot. Overall very happy with my stay.

This property is no longer a part of the Castle Hotel/Resort chain. I booked the reservation with CastleResorts.com months ago and wasn't notified of the change in management. Thankfully, the front desk was able to honor the booking price made with the previous search engine.Security is very lax. Rooms face out directly to parked cars and courtyard facing rooms look moldy from outside. The saving grace for this hotel is their shuttle services to and from the airport. The driver is very kind to let me make a pitstop by the lei stands before dropping me off to the terminal.As for the room itself, It's adequate for a layover where you only need to sleep. Plumbing fixtures need to be replaced in room 166 and the bathroom amenities could be better (crumbly cakes of soap and shampoo that dries out hair). The adjacent bar and Chinese restaurant closes early. Nothing nearby is walking distance. The bus stop to downtown wraps around the next block.
