KKua
New York City, New York

review_body: we arrived late, stayed the night, left our bags at reception for a day exploring Honolulu before flying out at midnight.close to the airport and has a free shuttleshuttle service not most convenient - we called and waited over an hour and while we found the right spot to wait the directions given were not clear.however, the shuttle drive was very friendly as were the staff at the front desk. located in an industrial area but short walk to bus stop into downtown to see the sights. the hotel is very basic - furniture dated and bed older.room and sheets were clean.free wifi but no password. did not seem secure.good value compared to other options.we did not use the outdoor pool.

This hotel is fairly close to the airport and has a free shuttle to and from the airport (free but as per US standard TIPS ARE EXPECTED AND RECOMENDED on a notice at the reception). The shuttle service though free is not the most convenient to access. When we arrived at Honolulu we had to call and the directions given were not clear - we finally found the shuttle. On the way back despite informing the driver of our airline we were dropped off at the wrong entrance. The rest of the hotel is very basic - so if you want to save money and have no other option stay here overnight.The worst thing about this hotel is that it is in a secluded location - seems like an industrial area. The other thing is to ensure that you get a ground floor room as there are no elevators and if you have large bags carrying them up flights of stairs would be inconvenient.Would I stay there again - Definitely not.Was it value for money - Probably Yes considering the prices in Hawaii.

this is an older hotel but maintained well and clean. small rooms, but efficient. great for and over night stay and close to the airport. Surrounding area is industrial. our stay was pretty quiet. parking is pretty tight.

We stayed on our way to and from Maui. It is a clean and basic hotel good for an overnight stay. It is situated in an industrial area so limited in regard to food outlets nearby. Coffee is provided in the morning in the lobby but perhaps given the limited availability of food outlets the management could put tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. The Chinese restaurant is quite dated but don't be put off as the food is very good. However we would recommend you get a takeaway and sit around the pool. When I was checking out they told me about the cafe down the road but it would have good to have this is information in the room or given on check in. If you want to stretch your legs after a long flight the adjacent beach park nearby is good but I only discovered this using goggle maps again in room info regarding local area would be good. Shuttle service to the airport would be another reason to return again.
user_name:
Annette D
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: My boyfriend and I spent a night there before an early flight the day after. It was clean and the room was nice. There is a pool if you want to relax and a free shuttle to the airport every 30 minutes. The check-in was really fast and the receptionist (didn't catch his name) was really helpfull and friendly.

Room wasn't ready at 2pm told to come back in 45 minutes, finally just got into the room and it looks very nice for the money. Walking by the pool, it is very clean and upkept, property as a whole is very clean and presentable. When we first walked into the room my wife was bummed that there was no microwave but it and the refrigerator were tucked into the closet inside the bathroom, air conditioning blows cold, nice flat screen tv, desk/chair and Hawaiian style ceiling fan. Nothing special but a fantastic bargain considering parking is also free. No free breakfast but they offer a nice menu of $5 breakfasts. Be prepared to walk 2 flights of stairs if your on the 3rd floor, I had to lug up 3 suitcases and a case of water that pretty much pooped me out in the Hawaiian humidity

I stayed her last night... my room was clean and comfortable and the property is well maintained. Enjoyed the cocktail lounge and the locals singing karaoke! I recommend this place for a quick overnight near the HNL airport.

I was pleasantly surprised when i ended up staying at the Pacific Marina Inn by accident. It turned into blessing in disguise. The rooms are basic and sparsely furnished but it was so comfortable, quiet, safe and a treat. It was close to the airport for my business needs and offered to hold my luggage after check out while i worked all day. The desk staff were friendly and helpful and made a big difference. The rate was low in comparison and with a liberal check in policy my stay was stress free. I will definitely stay there again when in the area.

Not a good experience, mostly because the bed was so hard it was like sleeping on the floor. We can put up with a lot but the bed at least needs to be a reasonable bed and this wasn't. Restaurant is right on the property but the food was marginal. It's an old motel in an industrial dock zone so the neighborhood is questionable too. The airport shuttle was the one good thing......big new vans, friendly driver, prompt service, and free too!

Perhaps "very" good mis-represents this property; I read about 20 of the reviews and found it hard to recognise the place where I stayed recently.Yes, it is located in an industrial area. And, yes, you sometimes can hear planes of various types coming and going. And, also, it is an older property, probably from the 60s or so.But, let's consider the rates: depending on through whom you do your booking and when, it is an inexpensive overnight. And, as it is 10-15 mins - at the most - from the lobby to the terminal, of course there is going to be aircraft noise as well as the light industrial location.I found the staff very pleasant, both front desk and service. I did not experience any rudeness.The room was clean and basic, but had the usual big (for me) screen TV, air con (with a welcome fan option) and a fridge. The "Shaka Net" worked pretty well, but did drop out from time to time. There is no charge for it.Because it is so distant from the town, there is a Chinese restaurant serving all day just off the lobby. That restaurant runs also a typical American bar/lounge, dark and air con with the usual booze available. The food is fine and not remarkable. But, so are the prices. It is not fast food.In spite of the photograph at the top of this review, no one mentioned the pool that is available for guests. As well, there is a nook with vending machines, serving up the sort of revolting snacks that the USA people think are so neat. There is an ice machine that works with your room card, just near the vending machines.As I did not want to run to the expense of hiring a car, it was handy to have a "TheBus" stop nearby for going to the Ala Moana Mall and Waikiki, the latter to rummage around at Bailey's antiques and vintage "aloha" shirts.Remember, though, with TheBus, that you must have the exact change for your travel; they give you a "transfer" for changing buses. The Marina desk clerk informed me of those requirements and offered change from his till.I stayed for two nights in early Feb 2017 and, again, for 2 nights just before coming home in late Feb.Finally, in the morning for a couple of hours, there is American style coffee and tea bags (and hot water) available in the lobby if you have to wait for the shuttle that operates 24 hours.I would stay at the Pacific Marina again and recommend it to anyone as a good airport hotel. There seemed to be a number of cars outside the rooms of various makes and vintages, so I suspect locals use it as a motel.Of course, there are better properties, but they are costlier and further away, so the "Marina" really is an airport hotel, with a pool thrown in.

We just needed a place to stay overnight on our way to another island. Thought this would do the trick. The phone was filthy and bits of the wall were broken off at the entrance to the bathroom. So we opted to sleep (kind of) with our clothes on, on top of the covers. Haven't stayed in a place like this since the 80's. Way over priced at @ $200US per night. Only good thing was the shuttle.

We stayed here for airport convenience, which was ok. They offer luggage storage, and though not under lock-and-key, they give a claim tag, and nothing was amiss when we collected it. Their internet service (Wi-Fi) is not trustworthy (shaka-net) I didn't feel at all comfortable entering credit card information. When the desk was informed, I was given a toll-free number to call. Not my job, sorry. Not a place that I would stay for a full vacation, for sure. Very small room, not worth the expense. Sorry, Castle and Pacific Marina, no recommendation from me.

The ONLY good thing about this hotel is that it is located close to the airport and has a shuttle. The room was tiny,rundown and dirty. It was very basic- didn't even have a box of kleenex. The toilet was constantly running so we fixed it ourselves.It was obvious the owners didn't care a bit about customers only about getting your money.STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

I recently stayed at the Pacific Marina Hotel in Honolulu. The room was basic but it was only used for sleeping due to site seeing the majority of the time.  A small coffee pot in the room would have been appreciated. Instead, I had to go up and down 3 flights of stairs in order to have a small cup.  The mini fridge was in the bathroom which took some getting used to.  My main complaint was the rude staff- front desk employees as well as housekeeping. Everything seemed to be an inconvenience. No smiles. No "aloha" felt whatsoever. Not tourist friendly.  The only plus was that it was close to the airport and free shuttle with very little wait time.

We stayed here one night due to an early flight the next morning. The hotel felt run down and is located in a sketchy area. The walls in our room were paper thin and we could hear our "neighbor" throwing up in his bathroom. It felt like we were in the same room. No restaurants close by, except for Wendy's. The hotel offers free shuttle to the airport, which was about the only good thing. No breakfast. Pick a different hotel!

Easy pick up and return to the airport. It is in an industrial area so it is not a place to stay or experience Hawaii but it is clean and cheaper than most hotels. I would stay again depending on my flight arrival or departure times to get to the airport quickly. They offer free and fast shuttle service.

I'm saying this hotel is average because although my room was dated, it was very clean; otherwise I'd likely give it a poor rating ... although I had no grand illusions of luxury considering I paid just over $100. The benefits are free parking, free internet, and , no "resort" fee, which often add up to nearly $100 per night at the resorts. Yes the overhead military and airport traffic is noisy at times, as are the adjacent rooms. If you need an affordable clean place to simply crash, Pacific Marina Inn Airport is acceptable.

We stayed for one night prior to our flight and were delighted to be able to check in around 10am! Thank you for that.Our room was comfortable and immaculately clean. We believe cleanliness is the most important aspect of a hotel stay and we were not disappointed. Thank you again.We would recommend this hotel if you need to be close to the airport. It has snacks available and is next door to a Chinese restaurant.It also has a lovely pool and lounging area.The bus stop is close for travel into Honolulu.An excellent choice.

5 people each had a proper bed, air conditioning that worked v well. Pool that we didnt use due to only staying 1 night looked beautiful and felt great when stepped in. V close to airport and has a shuttle. Was noisy with other room occupants yelling in early hours of morning but was otherwise quiet.

Overnight stay to catch a flight to Maui the next day. The shuttle was complimentary and the ride there very quick. The driver from Australia was extremely friendly during the ride and gave a little history about the island. The room was basic and standard for a motel-type of accommodation. Two single beds, noisy AC. It was good enough for the night. The first floor rooms open up to the parking lot so if you are a woman traveling alone, you may want to request a room on the second floor. Also, this motel is located in an industrial area with not much around except a Wendy a few blocks away and a Chinese food place not too far away. On January 1st the restaurant was closed. It is very dark early in the evening and since the motel is in a desolate-type of place, I strongly suggest NOT to venture out walking alone after dark looking for places to eat - take a taxi or eat at the airport. They provide coffee in the lobby which is always a bonus!

We landed at 11pm and had a flight at 5.30am the next morning, so just needed somewhere to sleep for 4 hours. This did the job nicely; the shuttle bus was great, and it's very close to the airport. Checkin was quick and efficient, and we got a decent night's sleep. Aircon was very loud in the room, but we were so tired we fell asleep in seconds.

We stayed there before our cruise. The hotel at best is a sub-Motel 6. The room is small with noisy A/C. There is a min-fridge in the bathroom (yup). The location is close to the airport with free shuttle (a plus) but it takes almost an hour by bus to the cruise pier and Waikiki. The close place to eat (except the hotel restaurant) is Wendy's about a few blocks away (10 mins walking). The closest bus stop is #709 just on the Nimitz Hwy about 2 blocks away. If you don't mind taking the bus to downtown and beyond, then it is ok. Thrifty and Dollar car rentals are close by. Walking back at night could be tricky as it is dark. Better to have a flash light with you.

This is a very friendly and economical alternative to paying big bucks in Waikiki. They have a free shuttle to and from the airport (which is only 5 min away). The rooms are ok. The pool is nice. the chinese restaurant is actually very good. And the people are very friendly. Buses (to Waikiki, Cruise terminal, Pearl Harbour, or Aloha Stadium Market) are only 2 blocks away ($2.50 per ride). If you are over 55yo ask for the senior's rate.

Room was clean, with all the things you need for a good night's rest. only thing is there is no restaurant nearby as the Chinese restaurant is closed on Mondays. Pick up was quick and the Australian driver who picked us up was friendly.

Location is close to the airport, would definitely recommend staying here for those early flights. Staff were very helpful and no question was too silly which is good when you are tired and not thinking correctly. The rooms are basic but that is all you need when you staying for one night before a long haul flight home so it suited us.

Gosh this place is the pits! It makes the Trave lodge UK hotels look luxurious in comparison. It redefined my concept of a basic hotel. It was kinda depressing. The reception staff where not so friendly. The rooms where very small and very very basic. It's in the middle of an industrial estate, it felt a little shady. We have never stayed in such a basic hotel at such a high price anywhere in the world, and hope never to experience this again.Positives:1) Great location 2) The driver was absolutely fab, so friendly and helpful2) It was clean3) I liked the books in the main area

Kinda sketchy area but room was small and clean and well maintained. Convenient from the airport and shuttle service is good. Driver was friendly. Front desk people ...hmm... One greeted me with a "What's up?" as soon as he saw me (around 10pm). Interesting, huh? I just really needed a cheap-er place to stay and that' what I got.

The hotel is the same. Great value for passing through Hawaii. Shuttle driver was quick and courteous. Front desk was short and curt. Gave me my room key, and disappeared around the corner. I had no idea where room 268 was. A lack of signage didn't help. I wandered around for a bit, climbed 3 sets of stairs, and figured it out. Luckily, I wasn't dragging luggage. The temperate night air was punctuated with the foul odor of roasting coffee beans from a nearby business. I guess falling asleep knowing that the bitter smell from the night would be a sweet aroma of fresh coffee in the morning was a good trade off.While the bed was satisfactory, (and for sure better than the floor or chair in the airport), I was torn between using my backpack as a pillow over the 2 hard ones provided on the bed. Management could take a look at softer pillows...Once again, a lackluster stay at a lackluster price. I'm sure I'll be back when passing through Honolulu. Meanwhile, I'll look forward to my shuttle ride back to the airport.

Lloyd G
Ceres, California, United States

review_body: This is an older hotel near the Honolulu airport. It is located in an industrial area.The hotel is well kept and is near the highway.The hotel has poor soundproofing& you hear everyone outside the room, the people next door & the water running in the next room.They claim to have WI-FI but we were not able to get in the 2 days we were there. All we got were excuses from the front desk & their Wi-Fi provider.

Small room but nice shower, TV, and good internet. The bed was comfortable, but most important- it is very close to the airport and the staff was great. Free coffee in the morning and convenient van service to airport. Would stay here anytime!

Stayed for just one night while waiting for morning flight. Tidy room. Good bed. Good value. Shuttle pickup got confused and took 40 minutes because we stood in wrong side of road. Otherwise all good thanks.

We stayed here on our last night in Hawaii (after returning from the Big Island and with an early flight back to Sydney the next morning) and we were very impressed. We called the free shuttle from the airport and Reid arrived within 10mins. He was incredibly friendly and chatted to us on the short drive about our trip and let us know about the restaurant hours etc. He also happily took our bags to our room and was genuinely grateful for the tip we gave.Gloria at the front desk was efficient and helpful, after checking in she provided us with a map to find the bus stop to get to Waikiki. The shuttle also took us to the airport the next morning for free. The room was clean and nicely decorated with everything we needed including AC and free wifi. We felt it was perfect for what we needed, for the rate and would stay there again as well as recommend it to anyone needing airport accommodation in Honolulu.

We wanted something cheap as it was just for the night before we flew out. But the room was gross. There were stains on the bed. The walls and headboard were sticky. We turned the AC on and I got a horrible cough, I think there must have been mold in the unit. It was fine once we turned the AC off. If you plan on spending any time awake in the hotel room I don't recommend it.

Booked this hotel as it was one of the cheapest airport hotels and we only needed one nights accommodation. It was close to airport, free shuttle, free wifi. Room was basic but very clean and adequate space. Only issue we had was upon arrival to the airport we called for the free shuttle, it took an hour to pick us up despite it only being a 5 minute drive away. Leaving the hotel was easy on the free shuttle though.

If you are too tired to be bothered going to the tourist area of honolulu or have a tight schedule but need some sleep, then this place will fit the bill. Yes it could do with a paint job and a bucket of money tipped into it, but it does have 4 walls, a bed, and is close enough to the airport to throw rocks at the planes as they go past. A bit pricey, but then again, so is all of Hawaii. $200 a night is lucky to get you a spot under a bridge with a tarp in waikiki. Dont expect glitz or glamour.

We were a little apprehensive when we checked the location on Google Maps because it looks like the hotel is in a run-down industrial estate but it wasn't as bad as we feared. The hotel itself is a bit 70s, but it was spotlessly clean, the pool looks nice (though we didn't see it in daylight) and the staff are friendly and efficient. We were staying just one night as we had a late flight in from Kona and an early flight out next day. The shuttle is great - and the drivers are friendly and full of information. The restaurant and bar were closed by the time we arrived but the shuttle driver told us where the nearest Wendy's was (about two blocks away) and there are snacks and soft drinks available from vending machines near the pool. We had a great night's sleep in the comfortable bed, and the shuttle got us back to the airport in plenty of time. It's not a great location if you want to visit the tourist sites in Honolulu and Waikiki - but if you need somewhere to sleep between flights, this fits the bill perfectly.

This is a comfortable inn located in an industrial area. We arrived after a flight from Maui to Oahu before our international flight the next morning. We were picked up by the 24/7 complimentary airport shuttle which arrived within 15 minutes of contact. We walked to Wendy's for dinner which is located 2 blocks away. This walk did not feel 100% safe at night but was the closest/cheapest option for my partner and I. The room had an outdated and loud A/C and a fan however we couldn't figure out how to have the fan on without the light on with it. We slept with the A/C off as it was too loud to sleep with. There is a mini fridge located within the bathroom area which I thought was a little unhygienic however we didn't need to use the fridge. Overall the room was comfortable for the purpose we required before our flight. The shuttle runs every 1/2 hours from the hotel so we caught the 5.30am shuttle for our 7.30am flight. I found the shuttle drivers and hotel staff very friendly and accommodating. I'd stay here again for an overnight stay

Arrived at 9pm in the dark industrial estate where the hotel is located. Restaurant was closed and only vending machines on offer. To be honest I wouldn't have eaten in the restaurant anyway had it have been open as it looked awful. The bar had two Asian ladies singing Karaoke in English at full volume which was kinda funny but rendered the bar un-usuable. The staff were OK, if a little quirky for some tastes but everything else about this hotel was desperate - particularly for the price. The bedroom was smelly with an ancient air conditioner that looked to be on its last legs pumping out freezing air. There was months of dust built up in the slightly difficult places to reach. The door had what looked like an axe wound! There was pubic hair on the floor of the bathroom as a final flourish. Possibly the worst hotel I've stayed in for the price anywhere in the world. Don't even consider swimming in the pool.

Yes, it is in an industrial area, but honestly apart from the air conditioner being noisy, not a bad place to spend the night. It could do with a freshen up admittedly. The Chinese restaurant serves pretty good food, the bar is old school with karaoke . Gino was really friendly and instantly likeable. No drama at all getting to the airport

The hotel is in a light industrial area. The shuttle was a bit grubby and old but free and runs 24hrs. The Chinese Restaurant that you can get to from the hotel had empty cartons lining the walls and looked really dingy and dirty. We ordered in rather than eat there. Room was small but clean. No tea and coffee making facilities, no ironing board or iron. Had a fridge and TV. Staff ok. Would pay more and stay elsewhere next time.

I really liked this hotel, car parking was awesome convenient if your on bottom floor (other hotels it was a hike and parking cost lots) grounds were clean and tidy, used the pool which is nice for for a dip. Room was a good size enough room for a couple and we had a lot of suitcases too it was clean and tidy. Ate dinner at Chinese restaurant was cheap and cooked fresh, server very nice and efficient. Used laundry facilities which were cheaper than other hotels I'd been to. Over all I would stay here again and bring my family... Staff were very helpful.

The air conditioner (outdated wallbanger) was so loud I had to find earplugs to be able to sleep. the property is very dated, and has not had any upgrades done for some time. The "Inn" is located in an industrial area, not close to anything.

Not bad for just one night before a flight to another island. The staff definitely make this place great. The shuttle drivers were really helpful and I appreciated their assistance helping me locate a lost stuffed animal. The free shuttle service was also a huge plus too.

This place is fantastic. Like going back in time. The real Hawaii Five O experience. You can hear every argument, door slamming and toilet flushing ..... Loved it!! Brought back awesome childhood memories. The rooms are perfect, you can lay in bed and reach everything but you do have to get up to use the toilet. Set in an industrial area so no annoying tourists to deal with and not a beach in sight. Take a walk to the freeway and check out the new camp ground!! Remember though that this place has guns so don't bad mouth anyone. You can walk to the airport from here for a quick get away. The guys in the office are super helpful. Loved the old surfboards on the ceiling. Highly recommend a stay here. One night is not enough.

Arrived at 8 pm at night. No restaurant in hotel or within walking distance. Decor was VERY dated and run down a bit, but room and bed was comfortable and clean. 24 hour availability for quick 5 minute courtesy bus to airport.

We drove past the hotel road on the first attempt because it is right in a warehouse district. From the outside, it really didn't look like a very nice place. The room was pleasantly surprising though. We had a separate bedroom with a king bed, and there were two queen/double beds in the outer room. Our kids were pleased because there were two beds, rather than a sofa bed. There was a fridge. The bathroom was in the bedroom, which was a little awkward. There were AC units in both rooms. We got there late and left very early, so it was a perfectly adequate stopover for an early flight. The drive to the airport from this hotel is a very short back-street drive that avoids major highways.

Colin H
Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

review_body: This hotel has a free shuttle and is close to the airport and that's the main positive. the rooms are dated and pretty basic but if you are only stopping over it's ok. I didn't have time to try the restaurant or bar.

Very simple accommodation... There's a Chinese restaurant on site but otherwise there is no where to eat anywhere close by or in walking distance... Other than subway and Wendy's. Rooms are very simple and minimalistic- air conditioning is either on loud and cold... Or turned off the room heats to the outside temperature instantly. Met our needs for a nights stay before departing internationally... But as soon as we entered the hotel we felt like we were in a transit hotel as opposed to in Hawaii. Ridiculously overpriced for what you get. On sale we paid $180 a night.... In Australia that would have been a budget $70 room.

The Pacific Marina Inn is in an industrial area and caters mainly for one night stopover travelers to and from Honolulu airport. It performs that function well. Our room (#151) was clean, comfortable with an excellent bed - firm but not hard - with crisp clean linen. We were able to check in to the room on arrival (90 mins early) which was a nice surprise. The Chinese restaurant is closed on Mondays and we were not keen to walk outside for dinner so we ordered a pizza from Domino's and ate this by the pool which was very pleasant. The wake up call for our early morning flight was right on time and the free shuttle to the airport (every 30 minutes) is very professional with helpful drivers. The hotel has a free call phone at the airport for arriving passengers. We felt that we received good value for our money

My husband and I recently had the misfortune of booking two nights in this motel, The first visit was on our way to Kauai so it was an over night stop. We had just had a 22 hour day due to time zone changes and had flown from London Heathrow to Los Angeles with a 6 hour stop over then our flight to Oahu. When we arrived we were ready to drop. FIrst problem was the telephone number on our receipt was not the correct number for the motel so we had to spend over an hour trying to locate the correct number which meant we wasted time at the airport doing this. Then when we had been given the right number by a help desk at the airport we had to wait about 20 minutes for the bus to arrive. The best way to describe this motel is that its in the middle of an instrustial estate and at the end of the runway. The noise of the planes taking off was really loud. We booked in okay but oh my god when we saw our room. I thought I was in the film bird on a wire with goldie hawn and mel gibson. It was straight from that film. Dated Yes!! dark yes!! then it was a case of what the hell was the noise we could hear, it turned out to be the noise of the water flushing down the pipes each time someone on the block flushed their loo. This continued throught out the night. What next we thought but hey its a tropical island so we needed to switch on the air conditioning again the noise was absolutely horrendous. It was such an old fashioned type of conditioning that it was to loud for you to be able to sleep. Its only one night we told ourselves but try as we may sleep was not be. But we travelled to Kauai the following day thinking oh no we have to stay there again on our way home.The return visit was worse we arrived midday only to be told the resturant isnt open on a monday so we have no where to eat. As we are in the middle of no way we ask where the nearest place to eat is. We were duly given a map and was told its about a 10 minute walk. While the walk is through the industrial estate and the only way I can describe the resturants is to say they were more like transport cafes not good wouldn't go there again.We thought to go to the bar and have a couple of drinks before going to bed this turned out the be the best thing we could have done it was Karoke night and it was very good fun and the bar lady made us some wonderful mia tis. But again once back in our room no rest for the wicked at we had to be up at 3.00 of our 5pm flight feeling really exhausted I have never been so glad to book out of a hotel in my whole life . Only use this motel is you have too I would never recommend it nor would I ever stay there again
user_name:
happylittlecamper201
Weston super Mare, United Kingdom

review_body: This hotel is close the airport and many of the car rental companies in Honolulu. We were able to walk back to the hotel in 20 minutes after dropping our car off at Alamo. It is definitely located in the industrial part of town, and we saw a couple homeless people on our walk, but the sidewalk was well-lit and no one approached us. Our room was basic, and the toilet plumbing made some really odd noises, but it was fine for one night. The airport shuttle was punctual and dropped us off in plenty of time to catch our flight.

Our need was one afternoon/night from airport and back to airport the next morning.It was PERFECT FOR THAT!!Staff sent a shuttle (for free) for our family of 5 with a million suitcases.The pool is nice. The hotel is clean.It isnt super modern or fancy but it is definitely nice.Bus was super close so we hopped a bus to the beach and life was sweet!Williams recommend!

Waikiki was sold out because of the hoolaulea Needed to stay one night near airportVery substandard hotel less then 1 starI would give it 1/2 star if thatSuper scary, thin blankets Towels thinner than a napkinDid not want to take my shoes off to walk on the floorWill not repeat sorry

The staff at the front desk was friendly but the area was pretty scary. The bed sheets felt like sandpaper and the bed was as hard as a rock. The shower was dirty and there was hair in the drain. There's no way I'd stay there again!
user_name:
Kristina B
Muncie, Indiana, United States

review_body: It is the cheapest hotel and definitely you should stay for just one night to get the free shuttle to the airport. The room was small but clean. We stayed on both our way into Hawaii and again on the way out mostly due to price and they had the shuttle. The Chinese restaurant was fine. The morning breakfast was great and reasonably priced. We will stay again in our situation of needing a short one night stay coming and going.

This is a sub standard 1 star hotel, that really struggles to meet even that standard.We were very disappointed that our tour group was given this el cheapo awful place to start our tour.The older guy at the reception desk was rude, altho the rest of the staff were fine.Give it a miss.Only thing going for it was the closeness to the airport.

We stayed here on two occasions because it had a free shuttle to the airport and we had early flights. It worked out cheaper than getting a taxi from other areas. This is a 2 star hotel/motel style, good for an overnighter. Don’t expect too much. The rooms are small with TV and desk and chair in the corner. We had nowhere to put our two suitcases. Perhaps a folding luggage holder would help. We used the chair in the corner and the desk chair. There is hanging space available in the bathroom at one end with the bar fridge and shelving. No vanity area to put anything on. Maybe you can put things behind the vanity mirror. However I would have forgotten to pack those items. The room smelt musty even though it looked like new carpet? As I am an asthmatic I thought I would have an attack (thankfully I did not).Then I realised the air conditioner was leaking with condensation dripping onto the carpet (these old rattlers need to be replaced with split systems). The slat door to the bathroom would also add to moisture in the room. Maybe a solid door would be better. The room could have been a bit cleaner; there were hairs on the bathroom floor that I could see, nothing a good vacuum wouldn’t fix. There was not great lighting in the room to see anything on the carpet. The hotel is in an industrial area. We walked to the main road and got a bus. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, however a bit slow and there seemed to be a line up at times.

For locals the property was a great deal at a fair price. but not anymore ! For a few dollars more you can upgrade to nicer properties in the area. What happened to the Kama'aina rate at this location.

We selected this hotel for it's price, proximity to the airport and the free shuttle that is offered. We weren't expecting too much after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. The lovely photo of the pool and surroundings on Trip Advisor paints a very different image to the over all reality. We intended to stay for 2 nights, but only stayed 1 night. In fact, after arriving, we would have cancelled our reservation had it not meant loosing 1 night's accommodation fee. The surrounding area is appalling! Located in an abandoned (for railway construction the manager informed us) industrial estate there is absolutely nothing appealing at all.The only nearby food was in in a Chinese restaurant attached to the premises. When were walked in to book for dinner we were taken aback by the appearance of the place. It was quite dingy inside and there were boxes for take away stacked around the walls. The tables were covered by stained plastic sheets and it smelt of cooking oil. We went elsewhere by taxi for dinner..Our room had a sitting area with TV and kitchenette and a separate bed room. The appointments were very dated. In spite of No Smoking rules, our room smelt of stale tobacco and was musty. There was a ceiling fan and wall/box type air-conditioner in the bedroom. The air-conditioner was so noisy that we turned it off, but the ceiling fan was fortunately adequate. Sleep quality was poor as we were direcly over the pool and kids were having a wonderful time, late into the night. There was also a continuous hum of background noise - probably from all of the other air-conditioners running all night. Our bed was reasonably comfortable. The bathroom was clean and OK, but clearly old. Apparently, our rooms were upgraded to the second floor instead of the 3rd, as we commented on the lack of an elevator to get our very heavy luggage (SCUBA gear) to our room. We were grateful for thatThe following morning our wives mutinied and refused to stay the second night. The manager was very understanding and helpful when I requested to cancel the second night. He assisted by providing the phone number for the on-line booking agent we used and also spoke to the agent . We received a full credit for the second night. Thanks for your help! Let me make it clear - we aren't snobs and have stayed in some pretty dodgy accommodation in our diving travels, but for our final night in Hawai'i, we wanted something better. We ended up in a lovely hotel in Waikiki for just $5 more than we paid here.For a fly in-fly out one nighter, because of the shuttle the Pacific Marina Airport is ok. This wasn't for us. My fault for not being thorough enough in my research.

Clean and friendly. Not for those looking for a resort hotel, it is very close to the airport. Does have a nice maintained pool and grounds but again, not resort like at all. Small Chinese restaurant attached in front is not fancy at all but has wonderful favors and is fantastic in price. It even served breakfast. Shuttle runs every half hour to the airport at no charge too.

We found the property to be clean, comfortable with spacious rooms. staff were very friendly & helpful. Excellent for access to airport - free shuttle to & fro. We had pre-booked a helicopter flight & hotel very kindly made their shuttle service available FOC - much appreciated & says a great deal about their intention to make visitors stays memorable. No breakfast, but coffee,muffins & cake are available in reception. Diner about 5 minutes walk from property - very ordinary but adequate.Situated near the airport so not in the main tourist area, but bus stop is about 3 minutes walk.Property was inexpensive, if travelling on budget has great rates.

I am a Kama'aina Haole who stayed at this hotel both coming and going on my trip. During my first stay the shower dripped loudly and they gave me another room. However, on my return stay the Night Manager said they didn't have my reservation even though I presented a copy showing that I had booked directly with them (Castle Resorts & Hotels). So he said he would give me someone else's room which made me worry about those guests. I was given twin beds rather than the double bed that I had booked. He said my room was on the second floor but even though my room number was only 217 I had to discover for myself that it was in the second building. He said I would have to wait a while for someone to haul my luggage up the stairs so I took it because it was late and I had traveled all the way from London. I was thankful that another guest assisted me with my bag. The Manager's nose kept running and he used his hand several times instead of a tissue without any hand sanitizer gel. Of course, three days later my nose is now running. In the morning the coffee was cold because the pot had not been properly plugged in. I mentioned it to the Morning Manager and I was ignored. I asked her to warm it up in her microwave which she then did. At the same time a local man had cold coffee as well but she apologized to him and said she would get him fresh hot coffee. The rooms were just adequate for a few hours sleep and a shower and the shuttle was great but next time I will pay to have a better experience and not worry that my reservation might get lost.

I had to stay at this hotel one day during my vacation since it has easy access to the airport.Pros:1. Quiet and okay parking.2. Friendly staff. 3. Easy access to airport4. 24hrs airport shuttleCons:1. Rooms are small2. Outdated and over priced

This is an excellent place to stay if you have an early morning flight out from Honolulu as it is only minutes from the airport in a free shuttle!Room was great with an extremely comfortable bed and lovely crisp, freshly laundered bed linen. Free car parking and free Wifi.There is no elevator to 2nd and 3rd floor

Very basic but close to the airport and good shuttle service. The room was very small but functional and clean. The shuttle was very prompt when we called after arriving. When we used it in the morning to return to the airport to get our rental car they were very accommodating. The location is not great for Honolulu but for a quick over night okay.

This place is highly recommended for people who are flying home the next day. They have a free shuttle bus that runs 24hrs every half hour. We stayed there 2 nights and found this place to meet our needs. We had just traveled the Island and were looking for somewhere close to the airport so we didn't have to get up too early to beat the peak hour traffic in the morning. The staff were very friendly and informative of what was available. There is an Asian restaurant on site but not much variety to choose from on the menu. Just a basic meal so if you desire something other than asian food you need to travel elsewhere if you have transport otherwise catch a taxi/Uber. The PMI is located in an industrial area so not much going on at night or during the day, however we still found it excellent accommodation. They have a washing machine and dryer on site as well. The rooms are not too big, with the bathroom consisting of a bar fridge and closet. Keep in mind you are only there overnight so do not expect the world. The free wifi is unsafe so be careful when using it. They have a swimming pool available which is quite nice as well. Overall the Pacific Mariner Inn is highly recommended for travelers ready to fly home and is very close to the airport i.e 10min away. The free shuttle they have available is like an added bonus as they go directly to the airport and not wasting any time making other stops and having to pick up other people.

We stayed here for a night prior to an early flight and found it to be just what was needed. It offered a free shuttle to and from the airport, the staff members were cheerful, and the coffee and muffins weren't bad for 5:20am.The room was larger than expected, with a separate living area providing good space to re-pack luggage ahead of the flight. Had we had time for either, the kitchenette and TV looked decent.The place was clean, the shower powerful and the ceiling fan a good alternative to the noisier air conditioning unit. A spare electric socket closer to the bed might have been helpful, but that's a minor quibble.While pricey compared to US mainland offerings, it compared extremely favourably to other Honolulu hotels, particularly when you factor in the shuttle. We'd definitely stay here again if flight times warranted.

Friendly staff, closet hotel to the airport, free shuttle service, clean rooms. I would stay here again. I had no problems with the room or the location. The family was all tired from the US to Hawaii flight and needed a convenient place for a 24 hour layover to the Philippines. Our trip was back in 2013, I am a slow poster lol.

It seems some reviewers are disappointed that they didn't find themselves in a big hotel in Waikiki. If thats what you want then thats what you should book.This is a cheapish hotel very near to the airport with a free shuttle. Ideal for the night before an early flight.The rooms are fairly small and dated, but perfectly clean, and the staff are all friendly.There is a bar and Chinese restaurant on site but I din't use either so can't comment. There are also a number of vending machines selling drinks, snacks and things you may need like toothpaste and band-aid.

This is one of the few hotels close to the airport. They offer a fast shuttle service compared to others. The hotel has tiny rooms and bathrooms. The bed was quite comfy. There is also a bar and restaurant on site but nothing else close by. There a nice large outside pool. Staff was friendly and helpful. It's convenient but pricey for what you get.

Close to the airport. 5 minutes by hotel shuttle. Call after you collect your bags they will be there in 10 max. Basic hotel motel nothing fancy. Bed bathroom shower smallish. Room could need a vacuum, stuff left from previous guest. Staff friendly. Restaurant take your time. Mostly Chinese and hence take out. Coffee so so. Knifes must have been in short supply. CLEARLY state your wishes and relax and remind.

The room was a little dated but it was comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly. It is a little of the off the tourist path but I kind of liked that because it was quiet. We had a car and did not have a problem getting anywhere. I would recommend it to anyone price conscious. I went to enjoy the sites of Hawai'i not to stay in the hotel room. We stayed for 6 days and did not have a problem.

This Inn had the best price and location for what was essentially a 12 hour layover, about 7 of which we were asleep. The room was small but clean, the front desk attendant was friendly, the on-site bar and chinese resturant were good value, the airport shuttle was fast and efficient. I recommend it highly for a quick preflight or layover.

Quite adequate if that is your purpose for booking here. It has a free shuttle that is reliable going to the airport, but not from the airport. (We had to wait 40 minutes despite phoning immediately after retrieving our luggage. Second phone call brought it in seven minutes, so I don't know what happened after the first call.)Free Wi-Fi and pool. The attached Lagoon Chinese Restaurant is very reasonably priced and serves large portions, but the service is typically Hawaiian slow.

Staff, location, shuttle, breakfast....perfect spot for a layover, with Pearl Harbor on one side and the airport on the other. With airport departure hours away, the hotel staff offered to keep my backpack in a locker while I enjoyed a tour of Pearl Harbor.

Horror movies could be filmed hereDidn't know this place existed but needed a room on short noticePaid $149 but should be less than $50Time warp warning, room screams 70's and smells it tooTowels so thin it could be a sheetSeedy bar downstairsWon't ever go near this place again

If you travel through HNL often enough, you're going to be faced with a layover. Pacific Marina fills the bill adequately and inexpensively. The room is serviceable. There is a pool for a quick dip,and a Chinese eatery if the need arises. (I'd rather eat at the airport.) Most importantly their shuttle is reliable and quick.

My wife and I arrived in Honolulu from Maui on the last day of our trip, but because we were not flying out until midnight, we took a room at the Pacific Marina Inn for the day, after first checking by phone to ensure that a room was available at 11:00 am. The free shuttle came promptly, after we called for a pickup from the airport and also took us back to the airport, as soon as we said we were ready to leave, in the evening. With tax, we paid $139. There was a double bed in a small room. The room and bathroom were clean. There is no elevator and so you must carry your bags upstairs. This is a very tired facility, but the staff were pleasant. It is located in an industrial area, with absolutely nothing of interest nearby.There were taxis in the parking lot. We took one to Pearl Harbor, in the interest of saving time and this cost around $19.00, plus tip. However, buses run along a main thoroughfare, just a few blocks away and cost only $2.50 per person. We were told that, because it was a Sunday, the buses only come every 45 minutes, which is why we took a taxi. On the other hand, from Pearl Harbor, we took a bus directly to Waikiki and returned later in the afternoon to the hotel the same way. The bus ride to Waikiki from the hotel takes about a half hour. There is a Chinese restaurant in the hotel, but it did not look inviting and we waited to eat dinner in the airport terminal.For a daytime stopover and a place to leave your bags, take a nap, and freshen up, this place is okay. When we first arrived in Hawaii, on this trip, we stayed overnight at the Best Western, which cost 50% more, and would do so again, rather than staying overnight at the Pacific Marina.

This hotel have free shuttle to and from the airport which is really a plus. Its not a luxury hotel, but its okay I guess. They don't have any elevator so I have to hand carry my luggage three floor up on a narrow stairs. There was supposed to be free wifi internet but that was not connected when I logged in. The phone lines were not working as well despite being told a couple of times that it is "now connected". Oh well, those were minor "disappointments" but overall, I think this is a really good place if you want to stay overnight for your next flight out of Honolulu.

Whenever visiting Honolulu, The Pacific Marina Inn is " always" my pick for a place to stay for several reasons. I recently took my annual vacation the week of Valentines 2016 to the islands. Just as I expected upon arrival the staff was very friendly and immediately made me feel welcome. An authentic welcome of Aloha!! Unlike previous experiences at other well known hotel chains (Luxury and moderate) that I've stayed at when I first started visiting the islands my greeting is not canned and routine.The pricing is affordable and room is very clean. They have made some slight in room upgrades from my last visit making the room feel luxurious. The bed was very comfortable with clean sheets and pillow. I Think there is a layer of memory foam or something because every morning I woke up, I felt like I had a good nights rest even after a night out . complimentary coffee or tea and muffins is provided in the lobby.The location of this place is central to places where every visitor goes to. The Ala Moana shopping center ,Ala Moana beach and Waikiki is about 15-20 minutes away, downtown Honolulu where Chinatown and open marketplace is also located is about 10 minutes away. If you like again hunting , the Aloha stadium flea market is 15 minutes.The Northshore is about 30 minutes and the world Famous Kailua Beach and Lanikai Beach is 20-25 minutes away via the H3 freeway that provides a gorgeous view of the Winward ( as locals refer to) side of the island as you exit to what feels like a mile and half of tunnel through the mountains.The hotel has restaurant on site and a cocktail bar that has karaoke nights and seems to be a place to go on the weekends. The property has a well manicured garden and landscape with a pool in the middle of the hotel complex giving the courtyard feel making it feel like a hidden paradise. There is FREE wi-fi and to my surprise I did not have any connection problems with high speed connectivity. The room has a microwave, mini refrigerator, hairdryer and Air conditioning. On this trip I learned they had a mini laundromat for guest that I did not know of..Although there is no room service, there are a lot of places to eat within walking distance and minutes away by vehicle. And BTW, almost forgot there is FREE shuttle to and from the airport and I'm sure they would consider taking you somewhere nearby .Until my next visit to the islands , as locals say: ALOHA!

It wasn't a luxury hotel by any stretch and was small, but it served it's purpose as a late-night crash pad since our flight got in really late. It's open 24 hours, which made checkin stress free. It had a mini fridge, which was nice. The walls were so thin that you could hear literally everything in the rooms on either side of us and outside. It was a basic hotel next to the airport.

We love this hotel. The shuttle is excellent, the staff are super-helpful and efficient. You get what you pay for, it's no frills but always clean and they pay attention to your requests. We will stay again - we always do!

This place served its purpose very well. We arrived in the evening and were flying out to Maui the next morning. The free shuttle was at the airport as we left baggage claim so our wait was zero. Check-in took approximately 45 seconds. Rooms are small, but the place was clean and the shower was forceful and hot. That's all I wanted. In the morning the shuttle leaves every 30 minutes. Its in an industrial area by the airport so I don't think anyone would want to go there for the Hawaii resort experience.

Four of us spent two nights, two weeks apart at the Pacific Marina. It compares favorably with the Best Western and Honolulu Airport Hotel but was much less expensive. The airport pick-up time was reasonable, check-in was fast, and the rooms were fine. The shower could have been hotter, but I like it almost scalding. It was quiet both nights we were there. There is an on-site Chinese restaurant which had good food and a small pool. Coffee and nut bread were available in the office in the morning. Next time we need a hotel near the Honolulu airport, this will be our choice.

Came in late from an overseas flight and just needed something close to the airport as we were leaving in AM for an outer island. This hotel was one step up from sleeping on a park bench. The only positive thing was a prompt pick up from airport. Other than that, we were in a third floor room in what was an old decrepit looking building with no elevator. We had four bags with us from a month long cruise which had to be manhandled up stairs. The room was Spartan. A bed, a desk and nothing more. On top of that, there was no soap or other toiletries and it required a 11:00 PM visit to desk so we could wash. AC was noisy and room was old and dirty looking. We didn't even want to set luggage on floor. Couldn't wait to leave in AM and get to airport for coffee. Would not even consider eating anything here. If you want a basic bed and nothing more, this is your place. We should have gone into town and had a decent room and a decent nights sleep.

After reading some reviews I was hesitant in booking this room but it's proximity to the airport was the deciding factor and I'm glad I did. Our room was spartan, no coffee maker but they did provide early morning complementary coffee/tea. It was very clean and the staff were most friendly too. For the price it was very good!

Good shuttle service picked us up from Honolulu airport, quite late at night and then dropped us off again in the morning - all part of the price. Other than that, the basic room was fine for our purposes. The bed was comfortable and it was quiet, except for a dripping shower head.

This hotel is obviously family owned and well run. The room was very clean and had a nice smell. It is the very simple essentials of what one needs in an accommodation. I recommend it 100%. How much time do you spend in a hotel while on vacation in Hawaii?! It's a good value for the price.

A group of us needed a one day stay at the end of cruise before our long flight out that evening. We booked this hotel, because it was close to the airport. That is about the only thing that is good about this hotel. Not sure it is a place where people live there full time, or just use it for a few hours. Located in a very bad part of town with some shady people hanging around the outside and back of hotel. Our two families left everything in our cars, went out for the day and only used it for a quick shower before our flight home. We left our flip-flops on while showering and used our own towels. The pool looked to be the nicest part of the hotel and it was occupied by the families that I think live there.

Cost a lot of money,cant find it,because street namecan't see, it is between warehouses and room has a horrible smell of bleach.I said I will not stay,men in the backsaid I will rent it the minute you walk out of here,of coursedidn't offer refund.

Cheap, efficient overnight stay in Honolulu. Rooms are old but clean. Free airport shuttle as well. No breakfast, staff was not overly friendly but accommodating.The other two hotels near the airport were advertised for much more than this one, and for a one night stay, this hotel saved us $70-80. Do check pricing on the rooms here as advertised rates online may be more than what the rooms actually are. If you're staying here and looking for an early breakfast, we hit up the Regal Bakery, which was about a 10-15 minute walk to the west of the hotel. They had donuts and a few other breakfast items (omelets, pancakes, etc.).

We chose to stay at the Pacific Marina Inn because we were looking for an affordable option for one night close to the airport. We enjoyed the location and the local Hawaiian people. If you are a snob and you want everything new and shiny, spare everyone and don't bother staying here. If you enjoy a little Hawaiian culture, you'll like this place. This inn is older but we found our room very clean. Bathroom was small and spotless with fresh, clean bedding. We had a double bed which is a little cozier than our queen but we know that would be our option. Even though parking at the Inn is free, we opted to drop our rental car at Alamo the night before our departure to save a days car rental and the Inn staff offered to pick us up. We opted to walk because it was a beautiful evening and the car rental return was 1/2 mile from the Inn. At sunset, we walked out to the park and to Keehi beach right behind the Inn and enjoyed watching the student rowing teams practice. It is a very local scene and enjoyable for us. The small pool looked lovely but we did not have time to use it. In the morning, coffee was available with some muffins. The shuttle runs regularly and is an older van with a super friendly grandmother for a driver. Honolulu traffic can be challenging so we were relaxed knowing we were only 1 - 2 miles to the airport for our morning flight.

The shuttle bus was old with torn seats, the room was small and dark, the soundproofing between rooms was poor, the outside space was cramped, the only restaurant on site / nearby was a very basic Chinese. Shops and other restaurants were a minimum 20 minutes’ walk in a rather run down part of town. You couldn't take a drink from the bar to your room. We were woken at 3am by people screaming and shouting. This may be just about OK for a one-night layover waiting for a flight but certainly no more than that. Even if the price were halved it would still not be great value for money.Next time I will spend the significant amount of extra money needed for taxis etc. to stay at a hotel in Waikiki On the small plus side the hotel is near the airport, the staff were friendly, the room was clean and the water in the shower was hot.

It was a Saturday night and seemed there was a locals party in the lounge, my wife thought she heard a fight late in the night outside in the driveway. The room was clean but we both felt if we turned on the lights we would see critters in the middle of the night, thankfully we didn't. We felt $124 was way overpriced for this place but it is Hawaii and isn't everything here? Staff was very nice and they also offer free ride to and from airport.

Gurnee, Illinois, United States

review_body: The hotel was nothing fancy. But as far as an airport hotel goes, it is not bad at all. I felt safe and the room was comfy. It was small but what do you expect for an airport hotel. And it is right near enterprise. I wouldn't stay there long term for vacation, but I would definately stay there again if I needed a quick stop to or from the Honolulu airport.

We knew we were taking a risk staying here but we wanted a place with free parking. This place isn't worth more than $60/night. Seems like more effort goes into the outside property than the room. The pool was nice & clean. The hotel is situated in the middle of an industrial area. In fact window world and a jeans factory are next door. To say the room was basic is being kind. Bare white walls & beat up furniture. Fixtures were rusty & dusty. I think someone was trying to warn us by leaving a sticker of a bug on the bathroom wall.

I really like staying here. It was a great deal. Clean and affordable. Restaurant and lounge right in courtyard. It also has a free airport shuttle. Staff is very friendly and courteous. It has air conditioner and refrigerator. Really enjoyed our stay here.

Spent the last night of an 8 day stay here to be close to the airport for an early flight home.The Good: Very close to the airport, free shuttle leaves on the hour and half hour, friendly staff, Chinese restaurant & bar attached (did not try). Walking distance 1.2 miles to a great restaurant, Henry Loui's Restaurant 2850 Paa St in Mapunapuna, great food & full of locals.The Bad: Not very clean, room and bathroom were dirty, vent covered in dust, bathroom door had been sprayed with some kind of dark drink, bathroom floor covered in hair, did not risk taking a shower. Obviously has airport noise because it is so close. Surrounding are is a bit iffy and industrial, graffiti etc.

Not a luxury hotel by any stretch, but free shuttle to airport, nice staff and at least clean rooms. Unique bar attached to property that has great local flavor. Not a place to stay for a Hawaiian vacation, but for overnight, will do.

This is a basic motel very near airport -- the location is practical -- a few minutes to the airport. So it is useful if you have a late arrival or very early departure and need to be close by. Rooms are very basic, coffee and a muffin in lobby, grounds are nice. Not fancy in any way. A/C works well.

Ok, we knew what we were in for after reading the reviews, hence well prepared mentally. As we had a very early flight on a stop over, it was what we needed. In the end we actually stayed 2 nights as mucked up our timing but glad we did for other reasons. Lets get to the hotel. There are 3 floors centered around a pool. We had the worst room in the hotel for noise. The ground floor right next to the pool entrance door. Ask for a 3rd story room facing away from the pool if you want quiet. We had to ask 2 groups to be quiet as it was. The rooms are bery basic. Old air con but works, take air plugs! Clean and tidy though. Actually had a fridge but no other extras. Free coffee from reception from 4am onwards which was appreciated.The free shuttle is good but ring for them when you arrive. We did and another group didnt. They were told to wait, even though there was enough room in our shuttle. The Chinese restaurant attached to the hotel provides adequate meals and are very accommodating. We took the bus into Waikiki, the stop being only 5 minutes walk away. Take the number 19 or 20. We think they are quicker but you can take number 42. It is not a fast trip. Give yourself at least an hour. If paying cash, keep your ticket as you can use it again until the time shown on the top of the ticket. Great for transferring to another bus or a short stay in Waikiki before returning.

The rooms are very small but they are clean and the proprieters are polite. They also had a shuttle that took us to the airport in the morning. For me, the best part was to see all the effort they put into the Christmas decorations- the place was spotless and well decorated for the holidays, which shows they care.

We missed a flight and with Mr 4 and Miss 5 needed quick emergency accomodation. It was not a great standard but they picked us up from the airport for free in 30 mins and got us back there in the morning. We did not have our bags and they had shampoo and conditioner. The price was right for the last minute!

Way too expensive for what it was- very small rooms, thin towels, homeless sleeper by pool.My review is supposed to be 200 character long. xxxx hhh oooooo kkkkkkk ppppp uuu ooo u ho yo de prpe tho awe small hot bad area

I am a easy person to please but this hotel was about get the money. We asked for a ground floor, preferably handicapped and a double room. We got a ground floor, handicap room with a 48" bed, no closet, no suitcase rack and super dirty laminate floors. The bed had to be pulled from wall in order for either my wife or I to get in it. The A.C. was 6' up in the wall and I had to stand on the bed(quite a feat for a 73 yr. old 300 lb.cripple) In order to turn the thing on. When I asked to be changed to a bigger room after the first night, they said it would be an additional $300. for the 3 nites remaining. When it was time to fly out, I asked about checking in for the flight with the airline with their computer and was informed to go to airport and use their kiosk. One star is probably too high for this hotel. We doing our bucket list trip and this is about the twentieth place we have stayed in since Sept. and doesn't even have a close competitor for the worst.

On a trip to the big island Hawaii we stayed overnight in Honolulu at the Pacific Marina motel. The motel, bar (Canoe Hut Lounge) and restaurant (Lagoon Chinese Food) are all connected and we used all three. In keeping with the racing analogy, I rate them Win (bar), Place (restaurant), Show (motel), although I should add that this was a pretty low stakes race, so even the winner was a bit of a nag. The motel room was clean and comfortable , but very small and basic. It reminded me of motels from the sixties. It is located in an industrial area just a few minutes from the airport, which is the attraction when you have an early morning flight. Free shuttle is available, and the staff was friendly. No breakfast, but coffee was available in the lobby the morning of departure. The restaurant is Chinese and seems to be popular with locals. My boneless chicken was a bit tough, but my wife's stir-fried veggies were delicious: fresh and crisp in a nice broth. With 4 spring rolls the bill was $21. They don't serve alcohol, so we took our food to the adjacent bar, which on our visit was tended by the very friendly Ross. The "lounge" was by no means fancy but served our purpose of having a glass of wine with our meal. A good pour of house white cost $4. The bar is obviously a favorite with locals, and we enjoy finding such places on our travels.In sum, not a place to stay for an extended visit to Honolulu, but for a short overnight in transit, it sufficed.

If you have an early morning flight or a long layover this hotel is fine. The rooms are small and basic, a bit over-priced in my opinion - but it is Hawaii and nothing comes cheap. My room near the bar was noisy on a Saturday night as they had the bar door open! They did close it on request which was good. The pool looked nice but I was there in the dark so didn't use it. Waited 20-30min for the shuttle to pick me up from the airport but the drop off in the morning was more efficient. It is first in first served in the morning, but they tell you this when you are picked up.

Perfectly OK for spending a night close to the airport, but for nothing else. The rooms are smallish and mostly motel-style, yet reasonably clean and functional, incl.a decently reliable free wifi. There are no details of shuttle operation on the hotel´s web, yet we were lucky enough to hail one within a minute from our arrival at the curb (hint: the shuttle is yellow and thus easy to distinguish from a distance). The property gets some noise from the airport (departing planes at full throttle overfly the place) and the room choice makes no difference.

If you're after a hotel within close proximity to Honolulu airport, this is it. Stayed one night before an early flight and the hotel was pleasant and most staff friendly and accommodating. Additionally, there is a free airport shuttle that runs on the hour or half hour (depending on request) to and from Honolulu airport. The lady who picked us up was very friendly, and gave us lots of tourist tips.Rooms are clean and well kept. Although they are not flashy, they are exactly what we were after - a clean, comfortable bed and well-maintained bathroom. Cable television was nice addition and free wifi was excellent. This hotel would not be appropriate as a base for sight seeing, as it is incredibly far from anything else. There are no restaurants or stores close by the hotel, although there is a very cheap Chinese restaurant within the complex, offering large meals at surprisingly low prices. We ate here for lunch and dinner as everything else was too far away.All in all - if you're after casual airport accommodation, this would be a good choice to consider. I would stay here and again and I would recommend.

We were dreading our one night after reading so many terrible reviews. When the hotel shuttle took nearly an hour to pick us up at the airport, we feared the worst. The shuttle driver doubles up in reception, hence the delay - the hotel foyer was packed, so clearly not too many people were put off by bad reviews. We were checked in very quickly - got a ground floor room which was great as our luggage was heavy. The room had all that was advertised, no frills but comfortable, clean, air-conditioned and good en-suite. The Chinese restaurant was closed (as it is every Monday - did not know this beforehand) but there is a pizza take away option with delivery, so that's what we did.The bar was handy but we could have done without the lady behind the bar who we found a bit dodgy and familiar, and who conveniently could not produce a tax invoice for us when we wanted to settle the bill. You can get coffee in the foyer from very early in the morning - good for early rising travellers or those with jet lag that can't sleep. The shuttle got us to the airport on time next morning - it's a free service which is great, but remember to give a tip otherwise they might start to charge.This hotel gave us absolute value for the very reasonable $120 it cost us for the night. If you're in transit, stay here - only 5 or 10 mins drive to the airport.

The decor is stuck in the 1950's but it is clean and neat. The lady at the bar makes an awesome Mai Tai. The staff Is helpful and warm. Great affordable place for an overnight on our way to New Zealand. The pool was closed due to a mechanical problem. Short walk to waterfront where outrigger kayaker aiming was being held. Not a fancy part of town, more old industrial area, but we walked late and it was safe.

The hotel is old and in an area with absolutely nothing around but the airport. It's more a motel really. If you are just looking for a clean place to overnight, have some rest and keep going with your trip, this hotel should do.There's free wifi available and the free airport shuttle every 30 minutes is pretty convenient.If you book it somewhere that offers a "orientation breakfast", don't count on it... It's not the same hotel... They don't offer breakfast.Everything also closes pretty early, so if your flight gets in late, make sure to have snacks on you.

Ok... So after the reviews I read, I was actually terrified to stay by myself for one night while on a layover. I REALLY didn't want sleep on a humid airport floor...This is THE CHEAPEST and CLOSEST place to stay in Honolulu when you have to get to the airport. It's less than 10 minutes away, and there is a free shuttle that runs every half hour. The staff are AWESOME. Super friendly and accommodating, very nice to talk to. The room was VERY basic, but not disgusting and unsafe as people said. As a women traveling alone, I'm especially sensitive to this. It was actually extremely clean, and everything worked very well. The pool (didn't go in, just walked around) looked really cute, good enough for a dip. The property itself looks like a well maintained motel 6, and there is a restaurant ONSITE. People coming from it said it was good, if you like Chinese food. Pizza pamphlets are in the rooms... More than I expected. Why not five stars... they never answered my emails when I emailed several times asking about the shuttle. If I would have had a response, it would have been 5 stars. But, waiting, alone at the airport, wondering what the heck I was looking for, and having some other random shuttle driver drop me off as a favour, was creepy and not cool. I would have felt better knowing that to wait, where, and what to look for. Just a suggestion.Oh yeah, the air conditioner was great, hummed softly. Never got woken by a plane once... Ask for room 358, I have zero issues.Would I stay again? Absolutely.

Hotel was very basic, but clean and convenient to airport and most things, including wifi, worked (except batteries went out on TV remote). Staff friendly, Location very good for air travelers. Shuttle very convenient.

This place is awful. In an industrial area with no nearby restaurants or any other shops. Can't believe a friend recommended it.......I thought she had far better taste! Not to mention that the whole place feels downright creepy. We waited 90 minutes for their airport shuttle; made SIX phone calls to find out why it hadn't arrived despite having given them very specific instructions about where we were told to wait for pickup. Looked forward to a swim when we finally arrived. Pool was filled and looked OK......but no swimming allowed. Room is tiny and smells musty. Definitely advise everyone to stay far away from here.......can't wait to leave in the morning!

This hotel is close to airport and has a shuttle to and from the airport. Friendly staff.I felt that this hotel (motel) is very very dated!!! I was expecting more for the amount we paid, however the convenience of the location makes up for the lack of style and comfort.I would recommend this airport hotel if you have a quick HNL layover and need to rest.

One could rate this hotel as a one or a five, depending on expectations. The hotel is close to the airport. The room rate was inexpensive in a very expensive city. The free shuttle to and from the airport functioned as advertised. The room was clean - supported by the odor of bleach upon entering. Everything worked: the air conditioner, mini- fridge, TV, shower, and internet, although I did not use it as my service provider screen warned the connection was not trustworthy. The room was small with the minimum of furniture, which, along with the building, was well past the refresh date. Surprisingly, the bed was comfortable and I was able to get a restful sleep. The wall-mounted air-conditioner was loud enough to block out most of the airport noise. The front desk greeted me with smiles and lots of aloha but no help. There is no way to print a boarding pass for upcoming flights. The area is downright scary... I scrapped plans to take the bus into town because I wasn't comfortable walking in the neighborhood at night and opted for pizza delivered to the room. So - is this place a bargain? I guess it depends on what you bargained for. One night was enough for me.

Booked here by phone but when I arrived with family, tired with 2 kids, at 2am hotel had given away room. This occurred even though my time of arrival was noted. Now I have no place to stay since all hotels were occupied [Aug 8-9].No apologies or compensation offered. Hotel response ..."sometimes but rarely occurs"

This hotel was conveniently located close to the airport and they gave military discounts. It was an open concept motel style place, but it did have plenty of parking and a nice pool. It was in an industrial location but you would expect that next to an airport. The rooms were average and a bit dated but clean enough. We enjoyed having a central location for travel between Waikiki and larger shopping areas. There was a small Chinese restaurant attached to the hotel but we never ate there. It also had a small bar area, I think. We mainly chose it due to price and proximity to the airport.

It's O.K. First impression was kinda scary. And sign out front for parking talking about how if something happens to your vehicle. It's not their fault. They messed up our room right when we got here and that room was scary looking and wasn't big enough for my party either. And bathroom was a little gross.  But our room is good. Bathroom is decent. But it's better than a hustle. The pool is clean and friendly little environment around the pool. You get what you pay for. So don't expect first class and champagne.

It's said that you get what you pay for in life. In the case of the Pacific Marina that's so, so true. Honolulu is a very expensive stay city so I figured I could save some money by checking into this place for just 1 night. The shuttle was OK if a little old and worn and the reception welcome was fine. From that point it went sharply downhill.My room looked like a scene from a 1960's motel. Basic amenities which must have been there for 30 years with outdated electrics I was simply too scared to use. It was clean but I'd have left immediately if I'd reserved more than 1 night. Going out into the street was risky in daylight and out of the question at night.The 1 and only plus side of staying here is that it is cheaper than anywhere else so if that matters above all then stay here. If anything else comes into the reckoning then steer clear.

This hotel is in a not so nice part of town near the airport and some of the guests are of questionable character. If there were such a thing as low income hotels, this would be it. It's not unusual to see police called here frequently because of some of the "guests" that stay here. But don't expect to pay budget prices here.

Due to my mainland flight arriving into HNL too late to catch an inter-island flight, I needed to stay for 1 night. Using Hotwire to book the location for me near the airport, Pacific Marina was the chosen hotel. Luckily, there was a Chinese restaurant on site that was still open when I checked in & had decent food. Loved the mac salad! The hotel is older but the room was fine with 1 queen bed and the bathroom was clean with white towels. There is a hair dryer & fridge in the bathroom. There are 3 floors to the building but my room location was ground floor next to the pool area and being it was the July 4th weekend, I thought it would be noisy but it was quiet. No jet noise either considering how close the hotel is to the airport. The staff was very nice at providing information and the free shuttle to & from the airport is very convenient. I would recommend staying here.

Very close to airport - free, easy hotel shuttle. Bar open upon 11p arrival. Blends in to industrial park type area - no exterior "hawaii" stuff as you look out at ground level.Front desk team (and shuttle driver) very friendly.Room small and very simple - 2 twin beds, desk, air conditioner, ceiling fan, lots of plugs!, MINI FRIDGE!, decent free wi fi, quick hot water, small window.Coffee in lobby in a.m. shuttle back evrry 30 minsI got great 8 hrs of sleep and mo stress before flight. I recommend for ehat I expected and they delivered.

This is not a hotel ! It is located near the airport in a run down industrial estate. We had a person follow us all the way to Waikiki in the middle of the day after checking in. There are no shops nearby. The staff were ordinary. The rooms very old and run down. Bright lights from outside shone through the venation blinds at night. We had to put some towels over the window do darken the room. The air conditioner was very noisy. Full review: Please try to avoid this property.
