It is in a dangerous area.Shortly after checking in mid afternoon we had a person follow us to a bus stop about 10 min walk from the hotel. We knew where we were going and had a plan. Each time the bus stopped and the door opened this person watched us. Eventually , one time when he wasn't watching we got off and ran. This hotel is about 40min away from Waikiki on TheBus which is the name of the local public bus transport company. Catching TheBus from downtown to the airport hotel you go through many suburbs which look extremely dangerous to wonder in especially at night.. Some of the people who got on our bus were drugged out, homeless, stunk and gazed at you. It was a very uncomfortable felling, also for our lady bus driver. I have never been so scared in my life asa going to this place. You see strange people lurking in the parks while passing through these suburbs.The hotel offers a free shuttle transfer which only takes 10 min. This service is not 24 hr. It was noisy at night with the occasional plane taking off.. The rooms were 70's style, very old with basic facilities. air con very noisy, bright lights from outside shone through our window - we had to put towels over the windows to sleep.. The water pipes were noisy, they waked me up a couple of times during the night when another room is showering in the middle of the night. The staff did not seem all that friendly. There is a Chinese restaurant on site but very dirty looking and uninviting.. We could not get a room for 1 night in the city so this was our only option with a 10am departure the next day. Rooms totally overpriced at about A$190 for 2 persons. Visited in July 2015.

i stay with my friend this hotel for 6 night and i am not happy with hotel service at all breakfast is very poor customer service very poor not friendly at all we paid $ 131 per night we did,t get service not worth even 50% of money we paid very out of town i really not recommend this hotel to any one who go to hawaii stay in waikiki area same rate you can fine far better hotel neat the beach

Great ti have the 24 hour free shuttle which you can call free from the airport to get you. Vending machines with just about everything to purchase. Good Chinese restaurant but no alcohol served. Opposite Bar was closed. Staff were reasonably personable. Great top floor unit but hard with luggage. Pool super cold so just a jump in for me. Good to see it being cleaned in the morning. Air Con loud -Accommodation sufficient for a one nighter. Bed comfy and room clean. Had early check in so got bus to Waikiki for day. Would not want to be in the street after dark so back before dinner.. Would stay again as convenient and clean.

The free shuttle, and nice driver were a great first impression. Although I arrived late, travelling alone and was a little concerned about the location, room condition, and even the lack of friendliness of the desk clerk, in the morning my experience was much better. The day time staff were very friendly and even suggested I use their free shuttle to collect my daughter from the airport and come back so that our taxi fare would be less when we went to our next hotel. They called the taxi for us and we liked our driver so much we used him again on the trip and he gave us a repeat customer discount. This motel needs updating and the rooms could be a little less bare, but for the $$, location and convenience it was a perfect place to start our trip.

This was the only place that had vacancy close to the airport and thus my only choice. The hotel is very expensive for what you get. The staff are unfriendly and rude. They charge if you want toothpaste. I Will never stay here again if I have a choice.

The location is near the airport, HOWEVER, it's in an "industrial" area off a side street. Not a very safe looking area. Walked around, as with most hotel stays and did not feel safe, homeless man laying in a business doorway. The EMS & police came to the Inn. I initially was on the first floor (room 154) but something was biting me, showed the desk staff the two different small bugs that were on me & he laughed, stated they were from the plants and were harmless. Was moved to an upstairs room (#256). A/C window unit with remote control & TV worked well. The bed was ok. Only used the sink not the shower (all the faucets were corroded) The refrigerator had previous guest hair in it. The "one" bottle of shampoo had been opened & used. During check-in wasn't sure how many nights to stay so the front desk staff told me to confirm before 11a.m. the following morning. Went to the front desk @ 7:30a.m. (the following morning) to confirm 2nd night stay and "Geno" (who wasn't there during initial check-in told me they had booked that room "months in advance" without any eye contact and kicked me out of the Inn. I explained what his co-worker told me the previous day to no avail. Had NO other place to go and Geno could have cared less. (Stressful situation). I was told some Hawaii hotels do not like complaints. The front desk staff wasn't friendly. This was the first time I have ever put a chair to the door for security. The room door (which opened to the outdoors) had a lot of space between the bottom and top (could hear outside conversations very well). First & possibly last time in Hawaii - not a good people experience.The adjacent restaurant looked a little unclean & unsafe from the outside, did not go in at all. Found another hotel approx. 20 minutes from the airport which was great!

This was very much a '2 star' hotel we reckoned. The beds were comfortable and the facilities just adequate. There was a nearby Chinese restaurant where the food was very reasonably priced, and there were vending machines in the courtyard area for light snacks and drinks. We drowned out any noise by putting the air-con on 'fan' mode. The main advantage,m of course, was the free shuttle to and from the airport.

The hotel was close to the airport and had a free shuttle, which were pretty much our only requirements, as we were only in Honolulu for an overnight layover. The furniture and bed weren't comfortable, and everything was quite dated, but at least it was clean.

We have stayed just one night - transfer to another island. Hotel is cheap it has free shuttle bus to and from the airport.We didn't expect much . Yes, it's close to the airport so you can expect little noise from the airplanes .We found hotel clean , quick transfer from the airport. After long haul flight (London) I slept and didn't heard any planes.We haven't used any facilities so I can't say anything about them.Hotel is in area where you won't find any restaurants. Next time I would find something on the airport before getting on the shuttle.I would use this hotel again but only as a airport hotel for transfers or late - early departures - arrivals.

We stayed for 1 night and it was suitable for our needs. Very close to the airport and with a convenient shuttle service at no extra charge. The room was spacious and had 3 beds, which was great. Both rooms within the room had air conditioning, however it seemed to be working better in one room than the other. The bathroom was unremarkable but suitably clean. There was a stained top sheet on one of the beds. Looked like clear nail polish or clear wax or something, but we removed the sheet and slept without it just in case. We also found the noise from the bar to be quite loud, but it didn't affect our sleep. All around a decent and affordable spot to stay for a night amidst travel to other destinations among the islands.

Dirty sheets,dirty pillow cases, dirty shower, broken toilet, and dirty pool furniture. I ask for clean sheets the first night, cuz the ones on the bed was filthy at midnight, I got more dirty sheets from the front desk. Three out of four sheets were dirty. The shower was dirty like a blind person was cleaning it, horrible. The toilet tank was leeking. Dirty orange furniture in the pool area and no ones sees it. A nasty hotel, and a rip off.

I was very grateful to learn that this place had a room for approximately $100 for the night.I called several places and they all wanted $159 for one night.The staff was so friendly, the bed comfortable, and the room was clean.There is a nice little restaurant, Asian food, great portions of food for the price... you just have to be sure to tell them "no msg".

This place is extremely affordable. Although the rooms are simple, they met our needs after having an unexpected lay over. The staff were friendly. Lotda (sp) at the Canoe Hut Lounge was very friendly. The drinks were cheap and the karaoke was fun. Lotda even fed us after finding out were didn't get to eat because we arrived so late and the restaurants were closed. Mahalo!!! Will not hesitate to stay there again.

This hotel met every expectation! We needed a clean, safe, reasonably-priced hotel close to the airport with a free shuttle, a bar and a restaurant...They met all three criteria...The Chinese restaurant connected to the hotel was good and the portions were generous and the price was reasonable...The bar, Canoe Hut, was fun and the bartender talked to us about our upcoming Molokai trip and the manager/owner was flirty, funny and entertaining...

Very basic. Clean. Free parcking and wifi. Close to HNL airport. Definitely not a final destination in Hawaii islands. Good for one night. Compare to the same properties in mainland it is two or three times overpriced motel.

Very friendly staff and helpful. Met lots of nice people, some will remain friends for life..Clean, good coffee and lots of it. Kewl bar connected with more friendly people andKareokee... Yes, it's out of the city, but you can cab to Waiki Beach for thirty bucks orwalk a couple of blocks to the bus....(don't do that at night). Industril area....like an osis in the middle of industrial....

This is a perfect place and still he central for everything to do..Waikiki is 20 minutes away and nothshor is 30 minutes away and in between all that are places to and things to do. This is a quaint little hotel with a nice and helful staff and free shuttle. They have a restaurant and bar onsite. I stay here every time I visit Honolulu because it's cost effective and affordable for a place to sleep. They have a nice pool with a well kept garden. Oh and btw, Hawai'i Five-0 uses this hotel for their show!!!

Having booked this hotel and read the reviews, I was a little concerned whether I'd made a mistake but for my purpose it turned out to be fine. I arrived in the evening for an early flight the next day. I called the hotel from the free phone at baggage claim and the free shuttle picked me up outside baggage claim E within 10 minutes. No more than 5 minutes to the hotel and in my room a few minutes after that. The room was close to reception, small, one Queen size bed, desk and a bathroom with walk in shower. The room and bathroom were clean and the bed comfortable but no coffee making facilities. There was some noise from the bar area but as I'd eaten on the plane I stayed in my room and slept comfortably. The shuttle bus leaves on the hour and half hour back to the airport. I overslept , having intended to catch the 5am shuttle to the airport. I got to reception just after 5.30am to find there was a problem with my full prepayment from ebookers. I had my booking confirmation and confirmation of payment but had to leave my credit card details with reception in case the hotel couldn't recover the payment from ebookers. I don't know whether ebookers or the hotel were at faulty but my credit card hasn't been charged again so they must have sorted of out. As it was 5.45am, the next bus at 6 would have been tight for checkin so one of the reception staff kindly did an extra trip to the airport in the shuttle bus to make sure I got to check-in in time.I didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on availability or quality of food. There is no computer at the hotel so no facility to print boarding passes.For my purpose, the hotel was fine and although expensive for what it is, compared to Waikiki, it is one of the better value hotels.

I spent one night at this hotel. It was clean, the bed was comfortable and a nice size. There is a pool, sundeck, flat screen tvs, hairdryer and free WiFi - perfect if you just have a stop over like I did... and there's a free airport shuttle so saves taxi money.The only problem which I had was getting something to eat. The hotel is in a strange area which has little nearby and is quite industrial. After speaking to a chap on reception about where I could walk to he advised that Dominos would deliver. Other than that the hotel was fine.

I can confirm the other comments: ok for one night or 2, this hotel must be the cheapest one in waikiki providing a free airport shuttle service. You have to call the hotel from the bagage clain E (free phone available for it) and they send you a cab for. No real breakfast but some muffins, coffee and tee at the reception on every mornings. Room was clean, personal very friendly. But $127/night still leave a bitter taste for such low standard...I guess it's just Waikiki!

A convenient place to stay. Stay here all the time. Staff is extremely friendly and courteous. Seem to have renovated a little. Much roomier and clean the last time I was there which was just recently.

Yes, it is true, this place is dated & could use new carpeting, paint, etc. It was surface clean..not deep clean. But it is just fine for those waiting on their next flight. The on site restaurant has good food (they're closed Mondays!) & very cheap for the huge portions. The airport shuttle is free & convenient.Price is excellent, we paid about $100 for a room for 2, we know others who paid $200 for something equivalent the following night!Keep in perspective what the intention of this place is & it is just fine...we arrived HNL one evening, stayed the night & transferred to another island the next morning, so it was perfect.

I did not get any sleep at this place. First all, it was so dirty I did not want to sit anywhere or even put my suitcase down. I used the phone once and it was filthy. I don't think the carpet had been cleaned in 50 years. On top of that cars came and went all night and would pull in with their lights shining into the window. Planes flew overhead all night. The room was very small. Definitely find a different place.

This place is convenient to Honolulu International airport if you need a place to rest your head between flights. There is not much beyond that to recommend it. Be prepared to put up with the indifferent people at reception and to carry your bags up the stairs. Don't plan to stay any longer tan you really need.

Just needed a place to crash before an early morning flight back to Las Vegas. Easy courtesy phone in arrival hall and a max. of 15 mins of wait and I was taken to the motel.Easy check in, friendly reception and help with my luggage. Promt transfer back to hotel next morning.Room is simple but clean, has cable tv and wifi, no coffee facility. There are more things at the property which I did not have time to explore.There will be noise from cars, flights and rolling luggagePrices taken into consideration and the friendly service, I would have no problem choosing the Pacific Marina Inn, should I come back to Honolulu.

This is an older Hotel and the rooms are showing it. The rooms are functional but have no flair. I would not bring my wife in a place like this. For 20$ more you can find a better place in a better location.

We booked ahead. Requested a Ground Floor Room. We got the Ground Floor Room. Asked for directions on how to get the airport shuttle: Collect Your luggage, use courtesy phone in baggage claim #62. which claim area (A thru H) and they will direct you to where to wait. 5 mins. later the shuttle appeared. We barely crossed the road and there it was. Friendly, helpful advice on the area as we went back to the hotel. Next day, a MAP for the BUS ROUTE to Atlantis Submarine and Hawaiian Village. We enjoyed seeing all the sites from our visit years before and had all day to enjoy before our flight to Kauai. Was told to be back by 5 pm or 5:30 to make our flight. We left our baggage for FREE at hotel for the day. Free coffee in the morning. Friendly Staff. May not be a 5 star hotel, but they treat you like a 5 Star Customer. All we asked for and more was done for us. Yes we gave them advance notice. but it paid off.

I had no idea this place would be as bad as it was. After all, Castle Hotels Group has it listed as one of theirs, so I did not thank it could be THAT bad. And it offered free airport shuttle. So we booked her for a one night stopover during flights from New Zealand to Seattle.Grumpy is how I would describe our welcome after a 9 hour flight. "Wait over there, I'm busy"."Right".We were given a room at the very end of the complex, our door being right outside the parking lot. The minute we walked in our noses were permeated with the smell of bleach. We only imagined why.The sheets were white and clean, the shower curtain had no mold, so we decided to stay. Our mistake). This 'motel' is in the MIDDLE OF NOWHERE. There are trucks all around, warehouses, tankers, factories. Around 7PM we decided we needed dinner. Nowhere at all to go. There were a couple of machines selling cupcakes/diet cokes/"Lunchables" and lots of candy bars. I needed at least Fruit and Milk. We went into the so called Chinese restaurant on site. It was FILTHY. The counter/kitchen was right as you walk in. A very young Oriental woman was dishing up food. She had the worst cold and was coughing up all over everything. She had to drink a cup of water before even talking to me. I asked if they sold Milk. "No, no milk". I asked "what do you use for white coffee?" She said "You wan two coffee?" I said no thank you, and left. I went to the Front Desk of the hotel. a different person this time, younger and pleasant. I asked him where on earth can we get dinner around here, or anything for that matter:". He asked if we had a car. No. we took the Airport Shuttle. He got us a map and showed us a route to walk to 'Nimitz Mart'. We could buy some things there. My husband walked there thinking he might get a pre wrapped sandwich or something, He got back much later, he said it was at least a mile and a half in a terrible area. But luckily next door there was a Subway. So he bought home two sandwiches a some milk. The milk was way past it's 'best by' date. But I did not care at this point. So we ate this crummy meal in this horrible bleach smelling room. Which was a real disappointment after our wonderful 4 week tour of New Zealand. What a let down, after we imagined sipping martinis in Hawaii as an end to our trip.

This hotel offers good value for a short term lay over stay. The free 24 hour shuttle bus service was convenient. This came with dedicated telephone number to call once arrived at Honolulu airport. The room was basic but clean. There is a Chinese restaurant on site as well as a cocktail lounge and pool. We only stayed one night. The service was adequate. A couple of cautionary notes - the location is remote - in that there are no other shops nearby - so you'd be isolated unless you have a car. The noise level increases after dark as there is free entertainment in the lounge bar and it attracts rather cheerful company. Also if your room faces the car park - then you will also get the noise from the cars & the luggage being dragged on the road & the corridor. As this is a hotel near the airport - arrivals & departures happen at all hours.

Rooms need to updated and looks very dirty.... the restraunt attached is ok it's Chinese food.... lounge was cold.... person at fd was ok... seem a little irritated when we tried to check in... for 150 a night it's not worth it... you can hear everything outside very thin walls not recommended

We live in Hawaii (on a neighbor island) and needed to stay overnight in Honolulu for a medical appointment. This hotel met our needs for that short visit, close to the airport. The room was very basic, but there was a pool with a nice pool-side lounge area. There was coffee in the morning in the lobby. No coffee makers in the room, but there was a micro wave and refrigerator, which was great to have. If needed, request two twins ahead of time, otherwise there is only one queen, which was comfortable, but we needed two beds, but by 3:15pm they were all gone. For a short stay, a traveler will find this facility to fit the bill.

We stopped in for a night on our way to Kauai. It was just what we needed. Free airport transfer and a clean room. The pool was a nice benefit for coming off of a long flight. The planes overhead are rather loud, but to be expected so close to the airport.

We needed a place to rest between flights in Honolulu. Arrived 6am and had to depart 11.30pm same day. Easy pickup from the arrivals areas of the airport with hotel's own bus. Only about a 10 minute wait and less than 5 minutes to the hotel. Just need to use the hotel directory phone in the arrivals hall of the airport.Reception is 24 hours and the checkin and departure procedure is easy and handled promptly. Rooms are basic and old, but clean and surprisingly quiet. All you need for short stays.There is a pool for refreshing dips set in a manicured garden. A courtyard for outdoor relaxation and a Chinese restaurant and bar for food and drinks. The restaurant is open from around 8.30am till 9pm approx. Bar only during evenings. Checkout is fast, drivers waiting for almost instantaneous departure 24 hours. The longest we had to wait was 20 minutes because the first bus was full and left just as we were checking out. Always good to give an extra half hour before needing to be at the airport.Was so efficient that we stayed again a few days later for an overnight between flights four days later. Nothing to see in the area apart from a beach park around the block. Set in an industrial area. During our stay we ventured out to Ala moana shopping centre. $2.50 by local bus or $30 for taxi. About 30mins by bus and 10 mins by taxi.

very dated and ordinary hotel.but for an overnight stay for onward travel it is fine.nowhere it eat nearby at night - except wendy's drive though a few blocks away on dimly lit roads.the airport shuttle was a big plus and the friendly staff even dropped us off at the car rental office in the morning

This hotel is basically a cheap, one night stopover for the airport, and as such it is fine. Our room was small and the bed only acceptably comfortable. Someone played a TV or radio loudly a couple of times during the night. But we slept, we got our wake up call (more accurately, we got a call asking if had had a wakeup call, which we hadn't), and the shuttle service is short. Staff seemed friendly and helpful.

Pacific Marina is a hotel we all liked. It gave us a Hawaiian fill. Since this was our first hotel to stay in for a day, it was a good choice. The desk clerks was very friendly and helpful. We like the pool area with the colorful orange umbrellas and the surrounding vegetation. The room that we stayed was clean and comfortable. There were three beds in our room. We even like the bedding. There is a reataurant attached to the hotel but we did go to it. We wanted to go else where to dine. Pacific Marina is in walking distance to the bus stop area. If you do not mind ridding the bus, it would be a good way to travel and sightsee and meet the local people. The bus fare is very reasonable. Ask the desk clerks, they will give you the details on the bus system. We used it and we found our way to a very nice beach and shopping area.

The Pacific Marina Inn provides excellent service and comfort at a reasonable price. The Inn's shuttle provides transportation, making it easy to get to the airport. The friendly atmosphere and great service add greatly to the value!

We stayed at the Pacific Marina due to a late change in our vacation dates, since we couldn't extend our Waikiki hotel. Imagine how I felt after paying $380 CDN for two nights in the tiniest room ever when I saw two other guests walk up to the front desk and pay $49 a night! FOOLISH AND EXPLOITED! Small bed with only two pillows, no drawers,(not that there was room) Hangers only in the bathroom, ice machine that didn't work, airport shuttle loading 24/7 right outside of our door. Food service all closed for the holiday.What a nightmare! If we hadn't been desperate for a room and depending on websites I believe we would have done better. Make that call, people!

The hotel is about 5 minutes from the airport and has a free shuttle. The drivers are prompt and courteous as well as the front desk. The rooms look old, but if you are there for only one night it is good for the value. They are clean and not too small. I arrived late evening and had a afternoon flight out the next day. Several vending machines are available and useful since the restaurant was closed when I arrived. Overall, a good place to stay, for the value if you are looking for something close to the airport.

Should you just stay overnight at the airport this is ok, but just one night. To visit Honolulu, you can find a much better more central location. This hotel is located in an industrial area. It has a simple, good restaurant door in the door. Note that this is closed on Mondays!The hotel offers a convenient shuttle service to the airport.There was a pool. We didn´t try it.

The other reviewers are right -- this is a cheap hotel, even if the nightly rate makes it seem like it ought to be better (everything is pricey in Honolulu). No chair to sit in, only one hand towel (we did get two bath towels and washcloths), no coffee pot or microwave (although we did have a small refrigerator), small room, no elevator, that sort of thing. They can't help being close to the airport, so consider bringing earplugs for the thunder of airplanes coming and going. Last night there was a group of people standing around smoking and drinking under the no-smoking sign. Gives you a feeling of the ambience. They do have an airport shuttle, and they will microwave your leftovers at the front desk. Plan to drive somewhere for food, though, as we didn't like the Chinese restaurant next to the lobby. The key is to have low expectations, then your visit will be fine.

This hotel is ok for a night layover when connecting for a flight. Small room, smaller bathroom, even smaller tv. No frills. The place is as dated as Paris Hilton.Very clean, with a very attentive shuttle driver, and a so-so front desk clerk.I'd probably give one of the other 2 airport hotels a try before coming back here.
user_name:
Lloyd G
Ceres, California, United States

review_body: Nice & clean. Friendly staff. Shuttle driver on night shift went above and beyond. Close to the airport. Rooms as nice as the Courtyard Marriot and much cheaper just not so close to the beach. Roberta G.

This is very nice establishment with friendly staff and ideal location close to the airport. It is really worth your money. Our room was clean and surprisingly quite large: with sofa, sink and TV in one room and table with chair and bed in the other one. What we've found most convenient was the airport shuttle which is free of charge. Staff here was all super friendly and tried to make our stay a pleasant experience. At the end of our stay the receptionist gave us complimentary snack to sweeten our waiting for the shuttle and the lady behind the wheel then offered to transport us directly to the car rental company we wanted to visit (without slightest hesitation). Such helpfullness was super nice and makes the stay worth it. However with breakfast it would be even better :)

Stayed here because of proximity to airport but would not do so again.We are a retired couple and we will on the third floor. There is no lift and we had to carry our luggage ourselves. There is literally no place locally where you can have a snack or even a coffee or tea. The rooms are tiny and not very clean. The fridge is in the bathroom. The only saving grace was the airport shuttle

This property is ok for a 12 hour layover but much more look elsewhere. The rooms are clean but are small and straight out of a sixties B grade movie. The hotel is in an Industrial Estate and the surroundings are a bit spooky the only plus is the closeness to the Airport and free shuttle. The restaurant at the front is closed Monday. Lastly it is expensive I have paid less for far better but if you are looking for a bed only and some run down sixties nostalgia go for it.

Stayed here back in 2007 in June my first time to Hawaii , after one night lost three night stay because I went in to Waikiki the city the only thing good about this hotel was the staff. they should leave this hotel for a better hotel to work for. Don't reline on the shuttle to pick you up it takes 1 hour for him to come then 20 min's to get to the airport. I well not think of staying here ever again

I paid what seems a huge sum for a room which while adequate is tiny but clean enough. The bar and restaurant were closed (of course it is Monday) with no apology and in this industrial part of town the only food within walking distance is Wendy's and it didn't feel particularly safe walking there in the dark. There is no bar anywhere nearby. For the $150+ it cost I would have been better off staying in town and at least being able to enjoy the evening. I have air conditioning but it is louder than the aeroplanes taking off nearby and the other residents are louder still. For this type of motel experience I should be paying a motel price. Such a disappointing end to an otherwise wonderful stay in Hawaii.

The ugliest, dirtiest hotel ever. Not only that, we called to be picked up at the airport ,which is 5 minutes away, and it took an hour. They saidthey forget to tell the driver. I would not stay here again if they paid me.

We just needed someplace to stay while waiting for a 4am flight and this was it. The room was very, very small but did seem to be clean. I hoped to get a few hours sleep before our flight but honestly it was a bit noisy. The staff was extremely friendly and the airport shuttle easy. If one is looking for a place to stay inexpensively while waiting for a flight, this could be it. If one is looking for a fabulous Hawaiian getaway, keep looking.

All previous reviews accurate. They really take advantage that it is close to airport. 12x12 room with inferior bath and close to nothing in an ugly area. Not exactly the welcome to Hawaii one anticipates. Next time will stay in Waikiki first to avoid the overnight at this hotel( more like a motel you would find at the edge of town)

A bit too expensive for what you'll get but it's the cheapest option close to HNL airport. Room was rather clean, staff friendly and shuttle was very useful. You can even get free coffee before your airport transfer.AC is a nightmare and no real food options close to the hotel but that will change soon due to the opening of a MacDonald restaurant at walking distance... At least for Europeans :-))Saw some comments here regarding security around the hotel... For sure not the nicest area but don't forget you're close to an international airport - and that's probably why you stayed there. Walked to Alamo in order to get my rental car and had absolutely no problem.The only problem... Don't ask for any service ! Tried to get my boarding-passes printed but the answer was... NO !And you can't book the airport shuttle for your transfer back to the airport. First come first served... Or you'll have to wait for the next one. Be careful !!!

I stayed one night at the hotel after visiting the Big Island. This is my second time to stay at this hotel and once again i was not disappointed. The staff is friendly and helpful. I requested a ground floor which they quickly accommodated. Glenn the manager of the hotel came out into the lobby in the morning greeting people and making us feel welcome. This hotel has clean quiet rooms, close to the airport, shuttle provided, nice pool, free parking. Again, I would highly recommend.

I stayed one night at the hotel so I could catch a plane the next morning. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean and quiet. All my needs were met and the shuttle to the airport was great. He reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 is because it's not a place I would want to stay all week on vacation. Its not near any attractions and the walk to the bus is long

My wife and I were on a layover from Maui back to Sydney. The hotel manager allowed me to keep one suitcase at the hotel while we travelled to Maui - $5 per day storage fee, which was cheaper than taking it on the plane with us. On check in every one was friendly - the rooms are small and very dated. We drop our bags off in the room and headed into Waikiki for dinner - caught the #42 bus $2.50 each for the 40 minute trip down town. Arrived back to hotel at 11pm and straight to bed. Good sleep, comfortable bed. TV remote did not work. I would only stay in this hotel for an overnight only. The free shuttle and being so close to the airport are the highlights.

We only made a reservation, as it was close to the airport, and we had to move on early the next day. They have a complimentary shuttle bus, which is the biggest plus about this place. There is a lot of noise from the street and the airport as well, and it feels like someone could break the door inn every second. Don't stay unless you are desperate.

Pros: Has a complementary shuttle bus and is close to the airport. Complementary brewed coffee in the foyer in the morning. Clean & comfortable.Location: the hotel is in the middle of a light industrial area; however it is very close to the airport. Not much else around the hotel. Take a bus to Honolulu.To order the hotel shuttle bus, phone the hotel from the airport by using the free hotel directory phone near the Hawaiian Airlines baggage pick-up; phone #62; then meet them in the car park close by. The hotel is in the middle of a light industrial area and reminded me of motels (in Australia) of the 70's & 80's. However it was very clean & the staff were friendly and let us check-in early at around 13.00hrs. The room and bathroom were small, but very clean. The fridge and wardrobe are at one end of the bathroom. The a/c was a little noisy but after about 30 minutes the room was cool we turned it off. The ceiling fan was all we needed after that to stay cool. We had a twin room & the beds were comfortable. If you are arriving late or flying out of HNL early and want an inexpensive place to stay for the night, then this is the hotel for you. We had an early flight and the hotel is about 10 minutes from the airport. I'd stay here again if I needed to overnight in HNL.

Customer service was very good, but the property is very dated and in an industrial area. It is definitely not worth saving the few dollars to stay here. I was only here one night, as I was moving to a rental property the next day. If I had been staying more than 1 night, I would have moved. Definitely not a location I would take my wife.

The most recent review tells it all. This is by far the cheapest place to stay near the airport. And in comparison to the others and the prices they charge. You really get your money worth here. If you hope to visit Honolulu then don't stay here, it's too far. This is the perfect place to stay if you have a lay over at the airportAirport shuttle runs every 30 mins and is free. The staff were great, drivers and desk staff.Of course some people would expect more, but for the price, you get what you want.Key points to note- mattress was comfortable and the place was clean. Isn't that what most people would first hope of??Will return

Stayed here overnight between flights. Very average hotel but OK for a layover. I wouldn't stay for any length of time!Useful that it had a free shuttle to the airport.Don't get me wrong - it wasn't bad or anything, just very average and maybe a bit expensive but there probably aren't any cheap better options. There are other airport hotel options but they cost more. I think some people forget that you get what you pay for. The room was clean but very tired.

We were only gonna use this hotel because of it location close to the airport and a free shuttle. It was a huge mistake. The only positive point was the free shuttle to and from the airport. The staff was rude, not very helpful at all, the room was tiny, with a horrible bathroom, which any good horror story could use as a possible location. The free WiFi wasn't working, but there was one that you could purchase. As far as getting a rest after a long flight from Canada, not so much, because the party in the next door wrapped up at 3AM.In the morning, the empties were floating in the pool and cake was smashed on the floor. Not a good start to our vacation.

a disapointing experience.luckily only stayed overnight.flight arrived 10.pm but pre arranged shuttle didnt arrive till closer to midnight after several phone calls as we waited in a totally deserted airport.room very dated, musty, with most uncomfortable beds and pillows.staff had little conversation.a lot of dollars for very little.handy to airport but would look elsewhere next time.

Was greeted by the very bitter and salty staff. Checked in and got my room key and headed straight to my room with my luggage in hand where i was greeted by 2 mid 40s, trailor-parky prostitutes. They offered to keep me company but i politely declined. Walls are non existent you could hear people all around you and yea this place is built like a motel. It was a bargain for 85$ but you really get what you pay for.. this MOTEL is trouble in paradise.

We needed a hotel just for 10 hours between flights, and the other airport hotels were booked. While this place would not be my first choice, it was fine for one night ... if there's no other options, it's an ok place to stay, but look other places first.Pros: pool, decently comfy bed, friendly airport shuttle service, A/C, free coffee, wasn't too noisyCons: scratchy comforter, would be extremely overpriced anywhere that wasn't Waikiki, but still a little pricey for what you get

I would never stay here again! I wish id read these reviews before I booked! It's in a really scary neighbourhood, I didn't even want to step out of motel room. It's VERY rundown and not everything works. My room smelt mouldy and what ever way I shut the blinds you could still see in. I felt unsafe the whole time. I think people just see the free shuttle and book it with out investigating what it's like. I can't believe how much it cost me for one night. Such a rip off. I thought it was going to be a lot nicer for what I paid!

The one positive thing about this place is the shuttle service from the airport. When I flew in I called all the places featured in the airport (yeah, I should have planned better) and this was the only one with availability. Went, paid $200 for a crappy tiny room that sounded like the walls were nonexistent, and it didn't help that it was in a trashy area. Like I felt unsafe. Long story short, I found another place to stay that night and the three guys at the desk all told me different refund policies and refused to give me even a partial refund. I was in the room less than an hour and hardly touched anything! Sleezy people, way overpriced for what you get, terrible service. Sleep in the airport before you come here!!

Close to the airport w a shuttle, that's about it for the positive. WAY overpriced! $115 after tax for a single that was small, cinder block walls and old. Id say it was a $30 room at best normally, but it is in the most overrated place Ive ever been, Honolulu! The staff at check in was miserable, I asked for a AAA or other rate and they were blunt to tell me the rate was $99 per night no matter what. I went down the next morning, which happened to be Easter, to see if I could get a late check out since my flight was not until 8pm. I was told by a very inpersonable man that check out was 11am and he asked rudely what time I wanted the late check out for, like I was trying to screw them. I said 1pm and he rudely said no 12pm would be the latest I could check out. I asked "not even on Easter since Im away from my family huh?" He said "nope." Not even a sorry. Not a great way to make a return customer. Very rude and no caring for the customer. He did mention they charged for a later check out and I said I had already given them plenty for this place! Pay the extra at the airport or stay in Waikiki, do not stay here!!

The pro's: the shuttle was great. The con's; everything else! Creepy, small, noisy room. Spend more and stay elsewhere. The hotel is in need of a major refurb. We were only at the hotel for about 12 hours, and that was too long.

I stayed here on my way to Micronesia. It worked out well. I came in late and did not have to wait long at the airport for the free shuttle. Once at the hotel I was checked in quickly. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room wasn't fancy but it was clean and quiet and I slept well. The pool looked inviting but my bathing suit was on its way to Micronesia in my checked luggage. The price was more than what I wanted to pay for a quick overnight stay but I think reasonable for Honolulu and as it is so convenient worth it. I would stay again.

The motel was is on a bus route. I was concerned for my safety after dark; walking the 3 blocks to the motel. I was approached nightly by people in need ,asking for help. The room was clean, but I felt the mattress spring poke me. Being near the airport I heard the planes take off in the morning. The staff was friendly and helpful. I used the shuttle service to the airport. If you use public transportation the nearest restaurant is Wendy's. No ABC or other stores or restaurants are close. I did not use the parking and I wonder if your car would be damaged by those needing "help". I would stay again but would rent a car(but I don't walk much in retirement).

Thankfully (?) I got a deal on the rate online or else this probably would be a worse review. I needed a place to crash for one night near HNL - and this was the cheapest option. The limitations were numerous: My large rolly bag and I received a 3rd floor room - no elevator in the place... the room was small, the bed was pretty poor (I could feel the springs through the comically thin sheets and mattress pad). the bathroom didn't even have a small shelf for toiletries - I had to you the top of the toilet itself, etc. You get the idea I'm sure. it's also located in an industrial area - nothing really "walking distance" away. It was clean, I'll give it that, and the AC worked. So it could have been worse (which is why it doesn't get a 1 star). If you just need a quick, clean bed, and money is a priority, you might want to consider this place. Next time I'll pay a few $$ more and get something a rung up...

decent motel but bare bones.and rather shabby.We stayed one night before flying out to San Jose,Ca. We arirvied from Tahiti at 5:30 AM. and they had the room ready (we had called and told them about our arrival when we bookd the reservation) Room was dated and had twin beds but was clean and has decent beds and bathroom. The best thing was the room was ready, Chinese restaurant attatced with decent food If you not fussy ew reccomend this place

I know the Title of this Review sounds a bit odd, but ......this would be a good hotel and a reasonable at rates of $80 to $100, not at the exorbitant rates commanded now. Note that other reviewers have also felt rates were too high. But, this is not a bad property if the rates were less. There is a very pretty pool area and the pool itself is sparkling clean. The room I had was smaller than some jail cells, chuckle, and did not have a refrigerator. (In fairness, Honolulu electric rates are high and small refirg-erators are not energy efficient). The stall shower had good water pressure. The water closet (i.e. toilet--I'm trying to be classy here) was tiny, tiny, and tiny.....where did they find it?It was not comfortable. Parking was adequate and, hurrah, free. And, as an airport hotel, it's a good location for business travel---but management just ruinedthat aspect by removing the lobby computer that had been there for guest use (pay for use) Apparently, one pays a huge premium for the location.

I was very disappointed with this hotel. The room smelt and was in need of refurbishing. After a full day flying I was tired and hungry but the only food choice was delivery pizza or snacks from vending machines. No tea or coffee facilities in the rooms and I paid $150 for the 8 hours I spent. It is just passable if you only have an overnight stay and need to be at the airport early but otherwise there are much better options in the city. The free shuttle was the best thing about this place.

Rather than take up an hour of your time listing what's wrong with this place, I'll write down all the good things (on a postage stamp):1. Near the airport.2. If listening to airplanes floats your boat, then that's also a good point.3. In-room wifi (sporadic) and free shuttle bus every 30 mins.Dated motel on an industrial estate. Previous guests' hair remained on bathroom floor and elsewhere, despite cleaning visits. No soundproofing. Paid $150 a night, a joke, and a fair amount higher than my "booking" with booking.com. Plus they took my reservation of a smoking room, then tell me on arrival it's all non-smoking. That's just a scumbag trick, as I wouldn't have booked if I'd known.My advice if you have to stay here, is move on to a proper hotel asap.

Worst hotel of our trip. We were only on a layover so thought this would be a good option to save travel time - mistake!Our first impression wasnt great and nothing changed our mind. When we arrived they were drying the rug in the foyer as it was roped off with "crime scene do not cross" tape. The room itself was old and depressing, certainly not newly renovated as advertised. We had a number of cockroaches camping out with us, and a creature that I would guess to be some sort of weasel running around the garden near the pool. The pool also needed some attention - cigarette buts and dead insects++.The airport shuttle was at least free and ran regularly.Many of the people I saw staying there seemed to be longtermers and they certainly didn't look like tourists.I certainly could not recommend this place to anyone -not even to the budget concious as I paid almost $200 for the 8 hours we were there.

If you have an early flight from Honolulu airport this is an excellent cheap option for your last night. The staff are very friendly and obliging from the shuttle drivers and front desk to the bar staff. You may want to pass on the Chinese restaurant but Papa John does great delivery pizza just ask the front desk for the phone number. We took the free shuttle to catch the 7.30am Jetstar flight to Melbourne and it takes just five minutes to get there as opposed to at least half an hour from Waikiki (can be longer in the traffic which is often bad).

When did I suddenly wake up and find that $100 per night gets you budget accommodation? Well it does in Honolulu. Location, Location, Location I guess is the key to it. In reception they have photos of the cast of Hawaii 5O thanking them for filming there. The cast didn't stay there but I am guessing the hotel was used for where the plot tracked some low life criminal who was crashing at a cheap hotel. (Photos showed the cast with guns drawn around the hotel) Anyway the Hotel was proud of it's 3 seconds of fame.So don't stay here if your overweight or have a heart condition because it is a 3 story walk up with no elevator and if you get a room on the top floor which I did then you’ll want to be part pack mule. They don't have a anyone to help you with luggage either or, if they do they certainly didn't volunteer him when I complained. I had 3 bags one heavy so I made 2 trips up and 2 trips down.The room is very spartan but has a bed and a shower. There is a microwave and an empty fridge. No jug, no tea or coffee and no cutlery and no minibar. I made the joke when checking out that I didn't have anything from the minibar and the guy serving me looked confused. Okay, so my sense of humor might be a bit esoteric.The hotel is isolated so you'd need to get a cab for a restaurant but they do have a restaurant downstairs next to reception. It's a Chinese Hamburger crossover joint if you can cope with the food culture. Next to the restaurant there is a Bar too. I didn't eat there so I can't vouch for the food.This place did have a really nice swimming pool and it was well maintained. The internet worked great and was free and easy to log onto with no stupid passwords. It also has a 24 hour shuttle that runs every half hour on the hour. I found it clean and reasonably well managed.So if you need a one night stop over near the airport at a reasonable price then this place might fit the bill.

For me the most important criterion was location when looking for a hotel for our late night arrival in Honolulu as I would be driving, tired and slightly disoriented after a long flight, in a city whose streets I didn't know. So I chose the Pacific Marina. It is about a 3 minute drive from the car rental area of the airport. I highly recommend this hotel for its location. The room was OK. A bit run down but clean (that was the next important or equally important criterion) and there was a second room where we left all our luggage and as it was late went right to sleep. In the morning I went down for coffee and, tea, for my husband. The sign said they provided both but there were no tea bags and no hot water. However when I pointed this out the young man behind the desk gave me a tea bag from his personal stash and heated up hot water so my husband could have his tea. Very thoughtful. This hotel was OK and I recommend it for its location and as an overnight hotel.

The pick up from the airport was good. But then you enter a complex reminiscent of the crystal palace in breaking bad. Add to this that the room smelt like toilet cleaner, the air conditioner was so loud one ear seems quieter this morning, and they failed to tell us that the shuttle back to the airport requires you 10 minutes before the departure time (although the 'it's not my problem' sign was tapped this morning displaying this rule - it wasn't shown after midnight last night) and all in all I'm not a happy camper this morning. Spend $20 more and go for the next one up.

We stayed one night here on our way to Maui. We had a room with a queen bed and two full size beds in the other room. It works great for families as our 13 year old daughter and 17 year old son each had their own bed. A little on the small side but clean. They have free airport shuttle and coffee. That's about it for amenities. The Chevron station is around the corner so the kid and I went and got ice cream. Woo hoo. There is also a small fridge in the room so it makes it very handy. I am pretty sure that there are people living at the hotel so that makes it kind of weird. However we felt safe. No elevators so you have to carry your luggage if you are on the 2nd or 3rd floors. Nothing to do in the are so hopefully you are coming to sleep, shower and leave. Great for one night stays. I wouldn't do more than that. Oh, and some of the new Hawaii 5-0 has been filmed in the hotel lobby. That makes it fun. Or at least notable.

The right hotel for staying overnight close to the airport. They provide all the basics for a fair price and they offer a free and very convenient free shuttle service to the airport. We didn't try the pool, the chinese restaurant wasn't really worth it. The room was small and very noisy, at the ground level and on the outside, so that in addition to airplanes flying over our heads, we also had cars and passers buy keeping us awake.

We used the hotel as a day room for a long lay over in Honolulu. The hotel is close to the airport and has a free shuttle. After arriving at HNL we called the hotel for the shuttle and it arrived within 15 minutes, although it passed us and we had to run after it. Check in was very nice and courteous. The rooms are very similar to a Motel 6,'plus the hotel offers free parking. It might be noisy at night since the windows are not isolated. The pool is nice although cold. The hotel is in an industrial area void of civilization, no shops, no services. Several buslines pass by closely. There is a good and friendly Chinese restaurant in the hotel-- the only one around. The area is filled with several homeless, scavenging through the garbage. The hotel might be filled with Section8 type housing. Although safe, not inviting and a far cry from paradise. Avoid unless you are desperate.

Was here for a quick night in Honolulu from an international location before flying in to Kona the next morning. Regretted staying in this hotel. Very small room. Bathroom and bed were ok. Restaurant does not open to serve breakfast until 0900. Staff not customer-service trained.

We needed a room for one night in Honolulu that offered a airport shuttle, so we selected this place. While the shuttle is great, the old, small room with older shower stall bathroom is not good. The staff were friendly and the pool looked nice. The deck chairs seemed updated.However, the motel is located in a commercial district by repair shops, gas stations and some auto dealerships. You are just off of Nimitz Highway. We asked about a bus or shuttle to Waikiki or town center and were provided with a little map to the bus stop. It's about 3 blocks away, under the highway overpass. We caught a #42 bus to Waikiki ($2.50 p.p.) and took an hour ride to Kuhio hotel area (the backside of hotels on strip). Walk up a block to get to beach area. The ride back to motel was longer, 1.5 hours and dark upon return. I didn't really feel safe walking under the highway overpass in the dark. We had no troubles, though.Sleep wise, it was noisy, so not a restful night. We enjoyed the Airport Best Western more, on a previous visit.

It was clean (except for the worn carpet), but way too much money for the quality - hasn't been renovated in over 20 years. Mix of attitudes from the staff - some good, some not - the shuttle policies weren't clear either. It was OK but I would not stay again. Tip: wait until the last minute to book airport hotels and cars - you'll probably get a better rate.

I had reviewed tripadvisor and that was helpful. The food at the chinese restaurant was mediocre, the accommodation ware spartan. However, the people were friendly and the location could not be better. We had a 5 am flight and this served us well.

The only reason to stay here would be for an early flight out of HNL. The room we had was minute with almost no facilities and a very small bed. There is a cheap Chinese restaurant on site for evening meal but it closes early. No breakfast facility anywhere in the (industrial) neighborhood. Shuttle to airport OK but we waited for ages to be tranported to motel from airport.

This motel is located in an industrial area. There is the airport, car dealerships, & Wendy's off Waiwai Loop. This motel was kinda hard to find considering the fact that I road the bus from Waikiki marina. On the positive side, this motel was clean, very close to airport(they have a shuttle), walking distance to gas station(light snacks for purchase), & across the street from a bar(If you need a stiff drink). This motel could use lots of updates. I booked this motel because I wanted a place to rest and shower b4 my long flight back to the mainland. Its perfect for that purpose. They have a pool, which isn't very clean. A restaurant attached to the property but has weird hours. The staff was very friendly and polite. They do their best to accommodate whatever needs you have.

Hotel located very close the the airport. I got this hotel through travelocity and didnt want to spend alot since it was just going to be a back up place to stay for me. I paid to stay 3 nights with my package but only stayed the 3rd nite (last night), and that wasnt an issue at the front desk. They even gave me a graded room with 3 beds. The staff was nice and the rooms were fairly clean. There were some stains on some of the towels...which i wasnt happy about but I found some clean ones. The walls are thin and it is an older property but what do you except for such a cheap price. For me...it was worth the price b/c it only came up to about an extra $25 on my travel package. If you dont have a rental its about $30-40 cab rife to waikiki beach. Since I was traveling alone I didnt feel that safe at night, at first but no one bothered me. Free parking was a plus. I didnt try the chinese food but i heard it was decent
user_name:
Tiffany R
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It's an older hotel some might even say a little rundown and in an industrial park. But it's close to the airport and the staff is excellent. I agree with some other reviewers that it definitely needs some updating but staff and customer service makes all the difference I'd stay again.

Well lets start with the positives....It does have a free shuttle bus and a pool ,, thats about the end of the positives ..It is a VERY old motel in the middle of an industrial area surronded by factories and miles from anything, to go to Waikiki it is $40 each way, $80 return in a taxi so that takes away from any value of staying here , if you are flying into Honolulu late and flying out early the next morning this will fit your needs, the rooms are small but the beds are OK, but if you are staying any longer you would be better to stay in Waikiki, we stayed 1 night which was 2 days and we spent $160 just on taxi's.. there is no breakfast but it does have a chiness rest onsite and the food was OK.. We booked this motel on price and it was a mistake, if I went back I would pay a little more and get a lot more, I asked reception to check my flights they gave me a number to ring and said it was a free call at checkout they wanted me to pay for a FREE call.Would I stay at this motel again NO, would I recommend this Motel, ONLY if you need a bed and shuttle (Arriving late leaving early )

What an overpriced dive. We arrived in Honolulu at 9.30pm and was departing at 8.30am so I wanted a place close to the airport. There are way cheaper options in town but I figures it would still cost around $150 by the time you pay for shuttles or taxis. I didn’t expect to be in luxury accommodation but when paying $150 a night for this place I expected something ok. This place is not ok. Cramped room, dark and dungy. Very tired, peeling paint and wallpaper. The bathroom is unpleasant, cleanliness was average. I would have been ok with this had I paid $60-$80. But at the prices these guys charge, customers deserve better. I feel ripped off.

This hotel was very close to the airport and the shuttle driver was very nice. He picked us up after we took our rental car back and then the next morning took us to the airport. The hotel is older, but the room we stayed in had 3 beds, perfect for 3 adults. It was clean, just wore out. My sister and I went down to the vending machine and had a creepy man watching us. Kind of looked like a transient. If you need a place to stay close to the airport that doesn't cost you over $200.00 then this place is okay. The courtyard and swimming pool looked nice, we did not use it. Just like other viewers said, the lounge was crowded and loud with some sort of bingo charity game going on, but that didn't bother us. Did not use their restaurant so I cannot comment on that.

I read some of the reviews and should have paid attention to them. If you need a decent place to stay overnight while waiting for a flight - go over to the Airport Hotel or the Plaza. This place here is only a little bit cheaper, in an industrial area and has some real strange folks hanging around. The nearest store is a gas station a block away. Rooms are tiny and noisy. Front desk was curt and short with me. The breakfast was coffee and stale rolls.I did not feel comfortable here at all so I canceled my second night and went over to the Airport Hotel (formerly Ohana). When I asked to cancel, some guy in the back said I had to call central reservations since I'd made mine on-line - so I asked them to call the number for me so I could cancel - geez.Too creepy for me - never again!

This is the place to stay if you just want somewhere not too expensive close to the airport.The pluses are that there is a direct call phone from the baggage area at the airport and 10 minutes later they pick you up for free and take you back to the airport every 30 minutes on the hour and 1/2 hour.The staff were very helpful and everything was OK.The rooms are very small the really are just for overnight and the area around the hotel is industrial and a bit rough. There is a licensed shop / petrol station 2 minutes walk away and they have a restaurant but it was closed when I was there.I would stay there again for an overnight stop unless you have not been to Honolulu then you should stay in town and have a look around it would not be worth the taxi fares to stay here and go to / back to town.

I missed the last flight out of Honolulu and had to find a hotel room in a pinch. Two other hotels were sold out so it was either this hotel or a bench at the airport. I didn't know what to expect because I didn't have a functioning phone to check reviews online. They made it really easy to arrange a pickup late at night. I arrived at the hotel in a few minutes and the driver and staff were friendly and efficient. It was a Friday night so there was loud music at their lounge and very mixed crowd hanging out around hotel property. The room has minimal amenities and is relatively clean. The decor and condition however made things feel dirtier than it looks. I was a little surprised upon taking a quick shower to find a woman's underwear hanging on the shower curtain rod. This hotel is an acceptable choice if you need one during a layover and want easy access to the airport. The shuttle runs every half hour and is very efficient.

review_body: I arrived on Oahu too late to catch the last flight to Maui so stayed at this hotel which is close to the airport. I did not know what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. The staff were courteous, I was picked up in a yellow van, the room was clean and furnished appropriately. There is a large pool in a courtyard and plenty of large umbrellas. The surroundings are very commercial so not a sight-seeing spot but very adequate for a short stay.

The shuttle pick up and drop off was very good and only 5 minutes away from the airport. Staff were very good and the small pool seemed clean and useful. However, the hotel is in an industrial area and if you want any breakfast before 9 you have to take a city bus many blocks to the nearest restaraunt.. On site restaraunt closed at 8.30 pm.The rooms and AC were quite poor. At the airport it said something like recently renovated ??? Long time ago. I think. No fridge or microwave in room..I stayed two nights. Would have been a bit happier if the price has been half of what I paid.

We stayed here for one night so we could fly out to another island. The room was very dated, like from the 50's. it was old and really small. The paint was peeling in the bathroom. The bed wasn't very comfortable. The air conditioner was noisy all night. The pool area was nice. We did not swim, but it looked like a nice area. The airport shuttle service they provide was prompt and useful. The front desk was not very friendly or helpful. The on site eatery isn't open until 9 a.m. Nothing is easily reached in walking distance. Not an easy walk to the beach. It was expensive for what we got. We were glad it was only for one night. The rest of our trip could. Only go up from there.

Not a clean place to stay. Bathroom was dirty. Rooms literally opened into the parking lot. The free shuttle to the airport was the only positive of our stay. Small and not clean rooms. Only stayed for a night but was tempted not even to stay at all after I saw it.

This was perfect for an overnight stay. If you are looking for just a nice, cleanplace to sleep and don't mind that the room is small, then it will meet your needs. Though there was no microwave in the room, we asked the staff, and they allowed us to use their's located in their breakroom.There is a Chinese restaurant on site that is very cheap and makes some of the best Chinese food we've ever had!! It is not overly seasoned, and NOT greasy! They do serve breakfast, but it's Chinese style-- eggs, bacon and rice instead of toast.Although a little pricey, it was very nice. We would stay there again if we return to Oahu.

We stayed overnight between flights and it worked for that but I wouldn't stay more than one night. For the price, the room was small, very basic and dated. As it faced out into the central area around the pool and caters mostly for air travellers, it was fairly noisy as was the air conditioner. On the other hand, the (free) airport transfers worked well. We used the free phone in the Arrivals area and the shuttle arrived in about 15-20 minutes. The next morning, we went early for the shuttle and thought we weren't going to be able to fit but a couple of people were just seeing someone off. I presume that we would have had to wait half an hour if we hadn't been able to fit.

It WAS convenient and the hotel DID provide a driver (free) to and from the airport, so it was suitable for a late night arrival and early morning departure but honestly i think next time I'd just take a snooze in the airport- it would probably be nicer. The photo is pretty deceiving- it actually looks fairly nice, but the second you open the door to the hotel room you get a little thud in your gut and all you can think is 'wow a jail cell'. the doors open directly to the walkway and there is a little window but everything is so tight you will shut everything up tight. Really in general it was pretty bad. Normally I'd say it served a purpose but as I said - I'd rather sleep in the terminal than this. In fairness to the hotel, the staff was very nice. Worst coffee ever (though it was free). we woke up and left the hotel at 6:00 am for a 10 am flight just to get out of there and sat in the terminal, where the coffee was also terrible (and $4.00 a cup)

Stayed a night here as my flight came in too late to fly over to Maui. This inn does the trick, clean enough rooms, the most basic of amenities, staff are busy and straight to the point but friendly. The bar includes karaoke and is quite a fun time. Free wireless internet was definitely a bonus too, didn't expect it from this place. Overall, as long as you're not expecting luxury you'll be just fine!

Nice staff, good service, very convenient to the airport.I ended up staying in Honolulu unexpectedly for a few days, and found the Pacific Marina at the last minute. They were great to work with, and understanding that I wasn't sure how long I would be staying. I ended up being there for over a week, and they just kept my room ready for me in case I didn't ship out and returned later in the afternoon.A nice restaurant (Laguna Chinese) on the premises, as well as a lounge. Free wifi, fridge in room, cold AC. A family oriented place.

The room was old. Old fixtures in the bathroom, old bed, old dressers, old carpet. 30+ years old. The tile in the bathroom is old. Its been "cleaned" but doesnt feel like you are walking into a new, fresh room. It reminds me of the old motels in Santa Cruz - everything is just old, and it feels musty. I found a long, black hair stuck to the side of the bathroom sink, and I dont know that the shower has been much more than wiped down for 10 years or more. The tiles and fittings look 30 years old.The workers are sociable - but not welcoming or hospitable. I did not venture into the restaurant (an old chinese place), nor the bar. The pool was refreshing, on the cold side (in June). Overall, I would never stay in a place like this. Other reviewers speak of drug activity, and while I did not personally view anything like this - it would not surprise me in the least to see it. I was only here one night and that was more than enough.

No frills cheap hotel.got everything youll need.Bed , shower ,fridge, TV.No room service.Rooms are pretty quiet.clean, but old style tropical vents above door don't seal out the heat so well.Not the best place for a Motel in an industrial area, But its close to the Naval base and shipyard.

After reading the reviews of all the Honolulu Airport hotels, which were all pretty poor, we decided to go for the cheapest - and were really happy with our choice. We arrived 7 hours before check in time and wanted to go into town without our heavy luggage, called the hotel and they sent the shuttle (with the lovely Trish, who went out of her way to make us welcome) to pick us up within 20 minutes and checked us in to a newly-cleaned room with larger beds than we had booked (yay!). We were able to relax, shower and leave refreshed for our trip to Ala Moana and Waikiki. The room was older, a little worn around the edges but spotlessly clean and with everything you could want: comfy beds, ample towels and pillows, nice linens mid-size fridge, flat-screen TV, microwave, free WiFi, great A/C and excellent showers. After our trip into town we ate at the Chinese restaurant which was more than reasonably priced (a huge mixed plate of fried rice, duck, pork, brocolli beef and crispy wonton for $7!!) with good service. The pool was great, nicely framed with red ginger and new pool furniture. There was no hairdryer, iron or board in the room but we were easily able to get them from the desk. Airport shuttle runs every 30 minutes and the staff are so friendly and helpful. We slept really well (despite being on the ground floor with the parking lot on 2 sides!) and checkout was easy - we will stay here again. Not luxury but everything you could need at a great price!

Heed the low rating people! It's there for a reason. We stayed here for two nights when our place was being fumigated for termites and will not stay here again! For the price we paid, it's not worth it. We could've stayed at other hotels in Waikiki for a cheaper price and been within walking distance of beaches and shopping.It's not overly expensive here but as a warning to tourists, you're probably better off paying the same amount of money or just a little more for places closer to all the attractions. This hotel is remotely located after passing a few auto dealer centers. There is a park area next to the hotel which is nice for walking. They also have a swimming pool which can get loud with all the people screaming, running, and jumping into the pool. So if you want peace and quiet, this is not the place for you. The furnishings are basic: cheap bedding, cruddy flat carpeting, bar soap with no suds...that type of place. No other amenities, no niceties, no aloha at the front desk. Just process in and process out. For a cheaper price I would understand. For $140 a night, I expect something more.

Read a lot of pretty negative reviews for this place but we decided it was so close to the airport and the right price for us so we took the chance. After a 12hr journey from New Zealand, we arrived at Honolulu Airport and made a call using the supplied free phone and the complimentary airport shuttle was there within minutes. Check in was pleasant and friendly and we arrived at our room exhausted. Very basic room, but exactly what we needed for one night before our flight to Kauai the next morning. The pool was a welcome sight at midnight and 26 deg c, and the room was tidy and the bed comfortable. This may not be a luxury spot, but for one night, it certainly did the job and the location so close to the airport that it seemed like a good option. Free shuttle back to the airport the following morning was very appreciated and the concierge who drove us was very forthcoming with local information and a very friendly attitude. Keep your expectations realistic and the location and convenience of this place will reward.

Ok, we "won" the bid on hotwire for $99. The Motel (not inn as they suggest) is near the airport its only advantage as we just spent 10 hours in the air and we were leaving for Maui the next morning.. Rooms are out of the 50's. Double beds etc. We would not venture out of the room after dark.

Everything is basically in the title: the room was a bit old and needed refurbishment, the staff was not always friendly, and I ended up by paying c. 120$. So a good choice, but only if you're between planes, I wouldn't stay more than a night...

Just got back from a 5 night Stay at this property.Only thing this Property has going for it was location to airport.If you want sleep forget about it at this place very noisy walls paper thin.Front Desk Staff very unfriendly felt like I was putting them out when I needed something.My Wife & I have travelled ali over the World and this is the First time I'm compelled to write a negative review.
