review_body: I spent a week here alone and the staff was extremely nice. There were no other rooms to be found on the island due to the Chinese New Year. Its old but my room was clean and my first room's AC broke and they moved me immediately, offering to move it all for me. They made me feel safe and they had coffee in the lobby. There are a couple of quick marts at the end of one street, just a few hundred feet away. The ride to and from the airport was quick and friendly. They even carried me to my rental car on my second day there.The restaurant on the grounds was passable - always busy. Yes its in an industrial area and yes it costs more than mainland motels. It felt like Grandma's place.

I read the reviews here before booking. We had to stay over one night between travelling from Big Island to Australia. I reluctantly booked this and lowered my expectation level to zero. On arrival the staff were very friendly and they had free wifi. The room was simple but clean. The bathroom was clean. I can compare this to a clean Motel 6 room. This was perfect for a one night stay over but don't book this as a holiday destination as it really is just a transit hotel. We ate before we arrived as I read from previous reviews that there is only one Chinese restaurant nearby. The Motel has a bar but no food.They offer a free shuttle service which was good.

We called for the shuttle service and the driver was there in minutes-so fast. The clerk at the desk had our reservation ready for us and we were so excited. We walked into the room and looked at each other in disbelief. The best that we can say is that it was close to the airport. The staff were friendly but there's no free wifi, no free boarding pass printing options and the only restaurant is the one on site. There's nothing else close by. We'll opt to drive a distance next time and skip this property.

It was our first trip to Hawaii. Our plane was hours late, we were tired, and I was worried that our room might be rented if we did not show. I called to explain. The person who answered the phone told me, "You call when you get in, and I'll come get you." The rental car company was still open when the plane finally arrived, so we did not have to call for a ride, but it was reassuring to know there was a bed waiting and that the hotel would take care of us with a backup plan.We pulled in to the parking lot after midnight. We are usually intrepid travelers, but we were relieved that we did not have to drive a long way or deal with navigation in an unfamiliar city while we were so tired. It was dark, and we drove through an airport industrial area to get there, but our first impression was that we were parking in a garden. There were tropical flowers everywhere! A wall of flowers screened our room from the pool area. We had chosen the hotel because it was relatively inexpensive and close to the airport, so our expectations were not high. However it was quiet, and the room was charming and clean. The only reason I did not rate the room as excellent is that we would have preferred 1 full-size bed to the 2 twin beds, but we knew it would be like that when we booked it. The next morning we realized that, even though the hotel is wedged between several other buildings, it backs up to a park's open space. If you want to stay in a big, high-rise resort next to the beach, in the middle of expensive restaurants and shops, and be among crowds of tourists, go stay in Waikiki and plan on an hour's ride through traffic to or from the airport. If you want a clean, quiet, safe, comfortable, welcoming, charming place that the locals might go to if they did not have a relative with a spare bedroom in the area, this is your place. It was an excellent beginning for our vacation. We started our three-week adventure rested and happy.

Our room was terrible. I wouldn't even take a shower for fear the bathroom wasn't cleaned properly. The service of the staff was very friendly, but not enough to ever choose to stay here again. It's too bad there aren't more hotels close to the airport. We stayed here out if convenience and would rather drive the extra 30min for a decent place to stay... even if our flight leaves at 5am, it would be worth the extra time.

Looking back on it, I resent having paid $98, plus Honolulu's healthy hotel tax, for this no-big-deal place at the end of 2012. Yes, there is service to the to the airport, but a lot of places in the other 49 states provide that for a lot lower room rate. I even took The Bus to there, and would NEVER have found the motel from the "correct" bus stop without the aid of a local couple, since the walking route is so winding, and partially-hidden.The motel itself is set back off a big intersection and would be hard to find even by car.No, I didn't encounter hookers and the karaoke bar was OK as such places go, but was not inspired at all.

Most people stay here to save money for a night in order to catch their flight the next day, thanks to the airport shuttle service - that's why we stayed here. Guess what? IT'S NOT WORTH IT!! Pay the little bit extra, stay in Waikiki, and just get up a little earlier the next day to make your flight. The motel is located in an industrial area that feels extremely unsafe, particularly at night. There were a lot of dodgy characters floating around, and we hardly slept because of the noise that people made running around the motel grounds all night. The rooms are uncomfortable, musty and claustrophobic. The motel's claim to fame is that an episode of 'Hawaii 5.0' was filmed there. I haven't seen the episode but I'll bet that it was the location for some scene involving a seedy drug bust. Honestly, the only thing missing from this place was a chalk outline and yellow police tape. The only redeeming feature of this place was Luis, the front desk clerk who entertained us with stories about the film crews who had worked there, and gave us great information on the area to try and make our stay as convenient as possible. Apart from him, everything else about the place was awful. The fact that it is close to the airport is not enough of a reason to stay here.

This hotel is basic, but clean and safe. The staff were welcoming and accommodating. It has dependable 24 hour shuttle service to and from the airport which was important to me since I had to be at the airport by 3:30 AM. The room was small, but offered free wifi and a comfortable place to lay my head for the night. They offer several types of discounts. Be sure to ask. I received the senior discount for being over 55. After the discount, the room was about $60 cheaper than the other two airport hotels nearby. If you are after convenience rather than luxury, this is the place for you.

Basically a trucker motel in the midst of blocks of industrial buildings, in the morning I couldnt walk far enough to get a real coffee, and after a huge flight from NZ, nothing else was on me mind..a cheaper hotel rater was available in Waikiki, several in fact, but I was flying-on the next day and thought I could save on taxi/shuttle fees and access, this hotel picked me up, ad it was typical...clean linens, slight antiseptic cleaning smell, great access I love where you can park at your room, and the restaurant opted at 9am, me mind was on a 6am. No complaints for near airport crash pad, except I like coffee in a paper cup with halfnhalf..

We stayed here one night while in transition through Honolulu. Nothing fancy in this hotel but it was clean and served our purpose. It is very close to Honolulu International Airport, with a courtesy shuttle to and from the terminal. The only real negative was the bed was very firm, we prefer a more plush mattress. I would reccommend this establishment to those seeking a basic and clean place to stay short term. Much more reasonable than the Waikiki hotels. The staff was very friendly and responsive.

I can't emphasize this strongly enough...this is by far the worst hotel/motel I have ever stayed in, and I have traveled throughout Southeast Asia on a shoestring. Let me repeat: this is by far the worst lodging I have ever stayed in...period. More than being dirty. it feels unsafe due to the sketchy area and the fact that the rooms all open up to the parking lot. And the doors are paper thin and hollow, so there's not even the illusion of being locked away and safe at night...the door could have been broken in by a firm push. And to make it worse, when I told a local business associate who works in the area, he told me that the hotel is known for hookers turning tricks in the rooms. And you know, it didn't take me long to spot a few of them outside their rooms between tricks smoking.If this room cost $30/night, I would feel that it was still too high, but at least I'd have an idea of what I was getting into. But through Expedia, this "2-star" (omg, who does the ratings...I see Priceline has them as a 1-star) cost me $135/night. Unfortunately, I was making last minute plans on Expedia and with not a lot available in Waikiki, I expanded my search and put an order in for their supersaver discounted room (still at $135/night), and this was the hotel that came up, and at that point it was confirmed and non-refundable.Still, the hotel was SO bad, that with 2 nights remaining which I had prepaid for, I left the hotel and stayed in Waikiki at around $200/night. Money well worth spent...that hotel was just grim.

This is a motel, not a hotel. Outside door access to all rooms. Very sketchy industrial neighborhood. Might as well be in Detriot except for the palm tree. Looks like it was built in the 50's and remodeled in the 70's (popcorn ceilings). Very spartan interior. Noisy fan kept me up most of the night. Mold growth in the shower and the shower water had a petroleum smell to it. Towels were clean and plentiful however.

Stayed overnight on a business / shopping trip from Kauai. Close to the Airport, but little jet noise. Easy to get to town or out to Central Oahu. Fairly inexpensive, not much more than a motel, but that is what Honolulu needs more of.

We stayed in this hotel just one night before our departure to Kauai. There is nothing special in the room, it was pretty clean and the aircon works well. Front office staff is very friendly and helpful, free shuttle from and to the airport whith funny chat with driver was appreciated. Swimming pool was nice and refreshing. I wouldn't stay in this hotel one week but for shorter stays it is definitely good place.

The hotel’s website shows a pool with palm trees and an inner courtyard. The reality is fairly close. We were given a parking lot 1st floor room but we also were there only for 1 night, so they may reserve those nicer located rooms for those staying longer, but request them anyway. The parking lot gets more noise, as people leave and arrive at all times of the night. They have a free airport shuttle that you contact in the baggage area. Dial 62 and you get their front desk where the driver is one of the owners. The wife picked us up, and she was timely, friendly, and gave us tips on which buses to take into town from the hotel, and some other info handy for our stay in town. The room was small, but there was a small fridge in the bathroom closet, bath towels and wash clothes for two, tho only one hand towel. The bed was very firm, no pillow top or plush mattress, upon which we had a good night’s sleep, but then we prefer firm beds. There was a TV, small table and luggage rack, plus a bench like chair. The room was clean, the shower was hot, and everything worked fine for us. The lobby had a book exchange, some chairs to read in, and there was free wi-fi. Overall, the friendliness of the owners, the cleanliness of the room, and the free airport shuttle made this hotel one I would recommend to anyone who needed a place to stay for one night b/c of a layover, or a late night arrival.

The hotel is more a motel, which is conveniently located close to the airport.Nothing much to say about the place - not good, not bad, but the neighbourhood is boring, and you will have difficulties finding a restaurant close to except for a chinese.BUT- according to the internet we were able to book a room at a very speciel price offer of $129,- - but later we realized that this is not an offer, but their normal price.We wrote a complaint to the Castle hotel main contact, but "surprisingly" we have never received an answer

Only things this place has going for it are friendly staff and almost walking distance from HNL. shuttle a breeze and driver a delight. We've stayed In hotels with bathrooms larger than our room here!

The best part of this hotel is the free shuttle and close vicinity to the airport. The room was not dirty, but not exceptionally clean... however, we did not have extraordinarily high expectations given the fact it was much cheaper than most accommodations in the area. The negatives: there were comings and goings ALL night long. A car was honking its horn at around 2am; a couple was yelling at each other right outside our door around 4am; and the attendant gave my husband major attitude when he asked for coffee (after calling to see that it was ready).But, this place did its job: gave us a place to stay for our short stay in Oahu before we left for Maui. Although, in reality, this place (without the HI inflation) should really only charge about $50/night.DO NOT STAY HERE FOR A LONGER DURATION. I personally believe that you will be sorry, (and we are NOT pretentious, stuffy travelers...)

Close to airport. Free shuttle. Rooms do not get dark or quiet. Layout of room is nice and front desk staff is very accomodating. Bathroom not as clean as I'd like, but acceptable for a midrange hotel. Has a pool that looks nice but we didn't use it. Chinese restaurant on site was good.

Fine for an overnight stay if you're flying in late and flying out early. Very dated and worn, very simple and my room smelt but thankfully it was otherwise clean. It is just around the corner from the airport and they provide a free shuttle bus to pick you up and drop you off. $161US including taxes is outrageous for what is an $85 hotel at best. However, the bed was comfy (although the sheets were thin and damp with no blanket or duvet) and the staff were the highlight... very friendly and helpful.

We chose this hotel for its location near the airport - overnight stay only. Obviously we got what we paid for and were not surprised. Room was small with tv, shower, small refrigerator but was clean. Though close to airport it was surprisingly quiet as far as planes but noisy pool users just outside door. Though we arrived early from an overnight flight and room was not ready, after a very short wait they provided us with a room. Shuttle service was prompt. Definitely an older motel from about the 1950's so if you're planning on staying more than overnight, we'd suggest some other hotel but this one was adequate for our needs.

I did not expect much so was pleasantly surprised by what one might call a 1950's motel. The location was excellent, 5 minutes from the airport, and the shuttle van came fairly promptly to pick me up. It is not a destination hotel or by any means fancy. You get a small, clean room, with a tv, small refrigerator, comfortable bed, shower and not much else. It was inexpensive and perfect for a one night stay in Oahu. The Chinese restaurant next door was very good. If you are not looking for an expensive beachfront destination hotel, this place is perfect. The price was 65% less than the destination hotels in Waikiki.

New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here like many people have - because it was inexpensive and close to the airport. We read the reviews and didn't expect much. It was small, older and not fancy. However, it was clean and the staff was very pleasant and helpful. It was just what we were looking for as a first night hotel after a late arrival in Honolulu. The staff realizes this and is well prepared to help you find your way around Honolulu. The shuttle was a little late getting to us at the airport - but again it was free. I think it is well worth the money.

The only positive think I can say about this hotel is that it is close to the airport. I used it for a short one night layover in Honolulu. The room was small, sad and extremely noisy. It would have been ok to pay $50 or so, but the room price above $100 was ridiculous. My suggestion: find another hotel or sleep at the airport and save yourself some money.

I was going to stay in another accommodation choice however when that went belly up I was running out of options. Despite the horrid reviews I gave Pacific Marina Inn a chance. I actually really like it. They have cleaners who tidy up your room around 9am nearly every day with fresh clean towels and clean your sheets basically once a week or more (haven't been around to notice.) It's simple. It comes with basic TV channels, a little desk, and night table. The shower works, no sign of bugs or creepiness. It has an A/C unit and an overhead fan/light. Swipe the room open with a key card. There is a 24 hour gas station nearby for all your nonstop munching needs. The area isn't Waikiki amazing, however it's near a Wendy's and a bus station that can take you basically anywhere you want to go.. I started out a solo traveler however my boyfriend stayed with me a few nights in this room and he thought it was pretty good too. Definitely not a resort, or fancy.. but it gets the job done!It also has a swimming pool on property and a restaurant but I rather explore Oahu instead of remain at my hotel.

Made a reservation over the phone for a coworker and called back to find out the attendant didn't put in the reservation. Thank goodness after reading the reviews. I gave her the name and she said there was no record and I had just called her 20 minutes after to confirm. Maybe this was a great reason not to book with this hotel. GROSSED out by reading the reviews and not to mention the attendant sounded like she had no idea what she was doing or didn't care...

Emi L
Hill City, South Dakota

review_body: We booked a room for a layover and, after reading some reviews, we were terrified of what awaited us! We bought dinner at the airport before leaving to find the shuttle which was a good call. The only food nearby is the Chinese restaurant in the hotel complex. The shuttle was fast, the hotel is 5 minutes drive from the airport, the room was small and dated but clean room, check in was less than minute, tv worked. Only complaint is the walls are a little thin.It was fine for a layover....

This is an airport hotel and with that in mind let us not set our expectations too high. This was my mindset when I booked this hotel for a 13 hour layover. All I wanted was a place to rest for the duration of my stay and I got what I wanted.. a prompt airport shuttle, a small but clean room, a comfortable bed and a a friendly front desk staff. I would agree that this is not the best hotel to stay if you are going on a tour of Hawaii but if you are just there for a night then this will definitely do. I did not see bed bugs nor was I bothered by people of dubious reputations as often mentioned in earlier reviews. Most of the visitors I encountered were Asians like me so I will not have any problem if you booked me again in this hotel for an overnight stay. For longer stays I would look for other hotels.

one chair for two people, very small room, location not at all attractive we would not book this hotel again the book laying out in the room was much more beautiful in showing other castle resort hotels

What a disgusting place. Front desk couldn't find my reservations that I made a week earlier. Apparently they don't believe in computers. Finally got to our room and it stunk like wet dog, the floor Obviously hadnt been vacuumed in sometime, there was hair in the showers and BOOGERS ON THE TOWELS and HAIR on the sheets!!!! Really!?!?! When approached about this the front desk person got very defensive. We demanded a refund and he said he couldnt do that. We got our luggage and called best western down the street and there shuttle came and picked us up at 2am. MUCH better service, clean rooms, clean sheets. 20 bucks more but atleast my 5 hours of much needed sleep was in clean, comfy sheets. Oh and pacific marina got a little visit from the health department...sincerely, yours truly.

I had a friend stopping over to HNL for an overnight layover and visited him at this dive of a hotel and was horrified at the rooms, the unsavory and unsafe location (this is based on our observations that night and the next morning AND the warnings of the desk clerk when my buddy checked in). His room (down a few rooms from the office on the main floor) was very small and rundown. It was so moldy smelling that it was disgusting and unhealthy, and the pillows, bed linens and mattress all had the same strong moldy smell. The wallpaper was stained and ripped, and in the bathroom it was stapled onto the wall! The bathroom vent was filthy and rusty, tiles and woodwork old and stained and a decrepit air conditioner in the wall. The unit was incredibly poorly maintained. I can tell you that any of the hotels near the Honolulu Airport are average to bad, but his place was off the chart.

The only thing going for this place is the front desk staff and shuttle drivers are nice and the shuttle convenient. But this place is grungy! Not to mention that since it is across from the exotic dancing place the back side looks like a gathering place for "undesireables"...(if you are into that)... you definitely won't want to go barefoot in the room....maybe its worth the extra money to go farther towards town in the CBD or Waikiki or get someone to hose you down in the morning. ps, i found hair on mine, too. good to know it wasn't just my room. But could have been the same towels!

My friend booked this place without reading the reviews! Who doesn't read reviews?? And by the time I looked at them, it was too late to cancel the reservation without losing money. The room was small and dirty, I found hair on the linens and the towels. The bed was uncomfortable. The TV remote was broken. There was no wifi in the room, only in the lounge (that doesn't have ac). We asked the front desk about getting wifi, he gave us a phone number to some tech people in order for us to figure it out. My friend called them several times, once for 40 minutes and they weren't able to do anything. We found other people who were sitting in the lounge on their laptops and found out that they didn't have wifi in their rooms either. When we told the front desk about this and said that they shouldn't advertise the free wifi, the person didn't care and didn't even look away from his computer screen. When I asked about getting an extra towel, they told me to look for the maid who was cleaning on one of the floors. Uhm, I never had to chase down a maid in order to get a towel. There were soo many cons to this place. The only pro is that it is close to the airport, but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Also, some people commented that they saw druggies and prostitutes but I didn't see any and I was there for a week. So I guess that's a pro too....

I booked this hotel from an online search as I needed an overnight stay in Honolulu due to my flight connections. There are many negative reviews of this facility but lets be fair and keep it in perspective.The hotel is located in an industrial area about a 10 minute drive from the airport. They provide free pickup and return to the airport. My room was clean and basic with A/C, TV and WiFi. What does one need for an overnight stay. Free morning coffee is provided in the lobby area. The restaurant is open from 8 am to 8pm. I did not eat there so I cannot comment on it. I brought my own food/snacks to eat on the flight and had leftovers at the hotel. A far better choice than U.S. carriers airline food, some of which you have to pay for. There are no facilities in the immediate area other than a 24 hour Chevron station with the typical snack shop. It is located about a block away. Is it safe to walk there at night? Is it safe to walk in an industrial area at night where you live?If you are looking for a luxury hotel in Waikiki then that's where you should go and accept the one hour give or take ride to the airport in Honolulu traffic. If you are looking for a budget priced hotel (for Hawaii) that is close to the airport then this is the place.

Stay away! Yes, this place is close to the airport and that is all. The rooms were not very clean and the carpet had sort of a damp/sticky feel to it, even with shoes on. There was hair on the bed linens. This place is more than dated. It is old and dirty. Despite the noisy wall-unit air conditioner we were awakened several times throughout the night by people talking directly outside our window and people running by yelling. We clearly did not read the trip advisor reviews prior to booking this dump.

We had a connecting flight in the morning and just wanted something with a shuttle to get us back and forth. The room was tiny but clean. With the airconditioning running any parking lot noise was muffled. While this would not be my idea of a Hawaiian vacation accommodation, it served a very short term purpose.

How does this hotel manage to be on so many international websites? It is terrible. It's close to the airport but that's it. It has nothing else to offer. We got there late as a stopover before we moved to where we are staying now in Laie. We were shocked to find how bad it was and if we had known we would never have handed over our hard earned cash to this place.It was filthy there were cockroaches in the rooms. The linen was filthy and scratchy to skin. It was noisy and there was a prositute hanging around by the pool area waiting to be paid and shouting at abuse. I had booked the room for myself but was meeting friends there. I was so scared one of my friends stayed in my room with me. It's not safe for single women to stay here as the area it's in is lonely and not very friendly. There was nothing to eat so we had to go to the gas station to get some food.Breakfast in the morning meant eating Chinese food at 10am as they did not serve anything else. I would never recommend this place to my worst enemy in fact I think tourists should be warned about the dangers of staying here. It's a motel for locals. Security was non existent and there was no part of my stay I found remotely welcoming.

We arrived in Honolulu about 10pm, phoned for shuttle bus and 10 mins later it arrived. We were unsure what to expect given some negative reports, however we were very pleasantly surprised. It's not the Hilton, it doesn't charge those rates either, its an older style motel, however extremely clean, comfortable and above all, welcoming. After travelling for 24 hours, we were delighted, and we really just wanted somewhere to rest before continuing on to Maui the next day. We had a couple of drinks in the bar where everyone was so friendly, Hawaiin music played, drinks were cheap and they even had some food there to share which was free! Haven't seen that before. So if you are looking for a stop over place like us, you really can't go past this place for value and comfort

The picture on the web is very misleading. My daughter and I got there early as our flight was an early flight. The desk clerk was a very rude man. He said we still had to wait until 3:00PM to get into a room even though there were plenty available. Then there were about seven police cars outside of one room as my daughter and I were going to walk at least two blocks to catch a city bus. I went back and told the desk clerk that I need a ride back to the airport since I was not going to stay in a place like that with my daughter. He was going to charge me for the whole nights stay even though I had never even checked in. I argued and he still charged me $50.00. The woman who drove the van was very nice but that is the only positive about the whole place. I went to Best Western and they let us check in right away.

I arrived in Honolulu after an unexpected stay in Narita and needed to find a room for 2 days for 3 people, which is how I ended up at Pacific Marina. My girlfriend and I found a kiosk at the airport and phoned in to make reservations. The staff was extremely fast and very friendly. I havent read the other reviews on this site, so I'm writing this only from my perspective.The first day we arrived, we were picked up about 15 minutes after we made reservations and made it back to the hotel in about 10 more minutes. The proximity to the airport, along with the free shuttle to and from the hotel were a major plus. Almost zero traffic coming or going. We were able to check in about half an hour earlier than usual and made it to our room with no problem. Inside, the room was clean and we were able to access the free Shakanet with no problems and a decent speed. TV also had a lot of channels that kept my mom entertained. There were plenty of toiletries and overall, for both nights, the property was quiet especially for being so close to the airport.On the day we checked out, we had the last flight out of the day but check out time was noon. We wanted to see more of Oahu rather than spend several hours at the airport and they staff helped us our yet again by telling us where to go, what bus to take, and best of all they helped us store all our luggage so we didnt have to worry about it (this was the biggest help to us, as we were traveling internationally and had about 10 bags, checked and carry on, total).Conclusions: the room itself isnt anything spectacular, but the price also was too bad for 3 people. What made this place great were the people working there. Extremely helpful and very friendly.

The Pacific Marina Inn is a stones throw from HNL Airport. When I landed I called the front desk and after asking who I was, they sent their yellow van to pick me up, the woman driver was friendly and helpful. So much for the good points. I was given a ground floor room right next to the parking lot. So I had people walking past my door and sometimes brushing against it at all hours. The "furniture" in the room, looked like it came with the building when it was built. I heard a commotion at one point, peeked out the circa early 1960's window and saw a man laughing it up with what appeared to be ladies of the evening. My room was tiny and with the fan on the ceiling had the feeling I was Martin Sheen in the famous hotel room scene in Apocalypse Now.For a quick night where you have to be extremely close to the airport it will do, but this is not the place you want to stay for your full Honolulu vacation.

Bad experience. Poor desk service. The man at the desk was super rude and unhelpful. The airport shuttles ladies are nice though. The rooms are clean but the energy was not conducive and you just want to not stay in the room. If not desperate, please look for other options!

I was traveling on business and needed to be not far from Honolulu airport, so I decided to try out the Pacific Marina Inn.As others have indicated, the bedrooms and bathrooms are small, but not more so than most low-priced hotels in Honolulu. (I've seen smaller.) The hotel itself could use a bit of updating, but I've spent more to stay in similar places in Waikiki. The free wi-fi was reasonably fast and the desk staff was pleasant and efficient.My main complaint was the minimal amount of parking--I had to park on the street one night.All in all, I would use this hotel again for a similar trip but not if I were going to Hawaii for pleasure.

We needed a place to stay for our connecting flight next day. We were picked up by a friendly shuttle driver at the airport with little wait. Office staff were friendly. If you are looking for a big fancy hotel in a resort, this is not the place. It was clean and quiet. It accommodated four adults in three beds. Two beds in one room and a queen in a separate room. Nice restaurant next door at very reasonable prices. It is hidden in an industrial area, our sons took the bus to Waikiki. But an older historical clean place between connecting flights - ok. Sight of the new "Hawaii Five O" movie setting of some scenes

We got in late from the airport. There was no parking whatsoever. We drove through the hotel's parking lot multiple times and each time, there were some scary gentlemen waiting around, approaching some cars as they drove up, handing goods over in exchange for something else. If it weren't so late, I would have gone elsewhere to stay the night. Finally found a parking spot, and made it up to our room. The room was decent: the bathroom was fairly clean, given its dilapidated condition. We checked out early the next morning. The grounds are clean, pretty planters and floral arrangements. The staff were very friendly. Wouldn't stay here again though.

We rented this room only for the purposes of leaving our luggage in the room while going to Pearl Harbor. We were almost too afraid to leave our dirty clothes in the room. The Ice Cream Vending machine sits near a vending machine with items that you may want if you are renting a room by the hour. The bathroom was less clean than the dirtiest truckstop I have ever seen. The front desk was polite and helpful. That is the best I can say. If you want a cheap room - this is it, if you want a clean cheap room somewhat safe, keep looking. Desperation should play a role in booking this hotel...

I booked this hotel as I had flown from the UK via La and after a 25 hour flight need a place to crash for the night before going on to my final hotel in Oahu.This hotel was perfect for that. It is not far outside Honolulu and while you could use it for a base for your holiday it make a perfect stop off for me.

We stayed here one night when we got in a 9 PM and were leaving at 10 AM the next morning. We called for the shuttle bus on the cell phone when we arrived and they told us exactly where to meet them and what color van they would have. We thanked the driver for coming out so late to get us and he said they see themselves as an airport hotel and they must have the shuttle to have satisfied guests.Our room was clean. It was very basic. We were on the ground floor by the pool and there was no traffic noise. I would never recommend someone stay for a week. But it was great for what we wanted...clean and close to the airport. We woke up early since our bodies were on another time zone. There was free coffee available in the office but at that time of early morning I had to try 3 doors to find an open one. I went back for coffee 6 or 7 times. I sat out by the swimming pool to drink the coffee and it was very pleasant. There were lots of flowers in bloom and it was clean and neat. A nice quiet place to sit and read and drink coffee.We went to the airport early to get through security and get some breakfast. At the motel there are lots of vending machines. There are no restaurants in the area. The shuttle carried us back to the airport in 10 minutes and we were on our way.

We had a stop over on way to Maui, we weren't expecting much so were quite surprised that the rooms were clean & bed comfortable. I wouldn't want to stay here longer than 1 night as it isn't close to anything. We thought the Chinese restaurant next door was great! & free shuttle service was fantastic.

I stayed at the hotel for 3 days. Unfortunately I left my Kindle sitting on the bed when I checked out. It took 2 days of calling the hotel to get anyone to even admit they had my Kindle. I kept being told they didn't find it. Then the manager finally said yes they had it and I made arrangements to pick it up. He then asked me to please write a nice review of the hotel once I got my Kindle back. Well..... I got it back and it was ruined. I don't know what they did to it but it's definitely broken and the managers response was that I couldn't prove they ruined it. So I'm not real happy.

Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: This hotel is located close to the Honolulu International Airport and there is a free shuttle; If you are looking for a hotel that is close to shopping and the beach, this place isn't for you. The rooms are average, nothing special, and fairly clean, I would rate this hotel as a 2-star. This hotel is located within an industrial area, and I was disturbed every morning by loud noises (traffic, construction). Overall: NOT a great vacation hotel! Spend the extra money and rent a nicer hotel in the Waikiki area!

We stayed here as a stop-over only. We arrived late at night and were happy for the free airport transfer to the hotel.The rooms are old and very basic. There are no tea and coffee making facilities, although the beds were comfortable enough. We also found the room to be clean, despite its age.The room had a small microwave and a fridge, and we picked up free internet, which on our trip to Hawai'i we found quite rare. This was a nice bonus.The hotel is old and basic, but it was okay for a one night stop-over. We arrived around 11pm and left at 8am, so we didn't spend much time there. It was a quiet location, although it is in an industrial area, so I wouldn't like to spend more than a night there.The hotel is only 1 mile from the airport which is handy, but as I said, I'd only stay there for a stop-over. The room rate was quite attractive too.There was a pool that looked nice, and the staff seemed okay, but didn't offer much in the way of conversation.On checking out we discovered the hotel was used in an episode of Hawaii Five-O, as there were pictures in reception.

After 6 nights in fab hotel in Waikiki we transferred to Pacific Marina for last night as early flight next morning. The double room was horrible, small, dark, smelly, awful furnishings and no room for cases or clothes. To our disgust when we got into our single beds both of them were crawling with bed bugs, yuk! We immediately left room and demanded a refund, which we got straight away. We asked for lift to airport and spent from 1.0am sitting in empty airport waiting for checkin to open 4 hours later.

Very small room, not clean - the bathroom was filthy. Does have a free shuttle and is close to the airport. The only friendly staff was the shuttle bus driver. There has to be better close to the airport?

Room Clean, Location excellent, restaurant food good but priceyHad a great stay for one night prior to an very early flight. shuttle is superb.Our only problem was that you could not really get away from the very loud traffic noise as this hotel is situated right next to a major roadway network. You do get used to the noise after a while ....

We stayed here hoping to save some money. Heres a tip, don't bother. It was so dirty, the staff wasn't helpful or friendly. We actually book 2 nights, the first and the last of our trip. After a night from hell we decided to cancel our last night, (id rather sleep on the beach then there again) and they REFUSED to cancel our reservation. We had to call Castle Resorts and do it via them, on our OWN phone since they refused to let us use their phone. When booking, I was told my credit card would be charged with 24 hrs and there was no other options, once we arrived I was asked to pay again. Not sure why I would have to pay again if I payed 24hrs after making my reservation. Spend 50 more dollars and go somewhere else. Oh ya, and there is NO where to eat around there, unless you want to eat at the Chinese food restaurant, wouldn't recommend it.

After missing our inter-island flight connection we needed a place to stay, getting in late and leaving early. For the price it was a place to sleep. The hotel is old and worn but clean. No elevators, no amenities. Wouldn't want ot be here more than 1 night.

I called ahead to book the shuttle to pick us up after a nine hour flight. When we arrived, no shuttle. I called again and they said 10 mins. When the driver arrived their we're other passengers as well as myself. I had an oversize luggage bag(which i mentioned to them on the phone when i called), despite my previous booking, due to my luggage I was left to wait at the airport while the driver took everyone else to the hotel and then came back for me.I knew the Hotel was in an industrial area, but upon arrival the place just looked cheap and shady (not even close to the pictures displayed online). The man behind the counter took the time to tell me all about his back problems and bad day as he checked me in. Seeing as how he thought we were so close I asked if I could get the $89 price he charged the guy in front of me! He of course said no, that that was the price for locals.The room was small and cramped, and even tough we didn't find anything, it felt dirty!We called our airline and changed our flight to earlier the next day just so we could get out of there early!Don't waste your money!

I stayed yesterday while transiting in Honolulu on the way to Guam. This is not a great hotel for overnight or longer stay, however, if you are looking for day room, for few hours, it is still good choice compare to other hotels around the aiprport area...mainly due to cost which is around 70$ for day room and over 100$ for overnight stay. I also checked other hotels in that area for day room only, and their cost was over 100$ and not sure how good those hotels are. You can book this upon arrival from the dedicated telephone kiosk once you come outside the terminal and easily find out the availability and cost. Mind that their transfer may kill your time as it took over 45 minutes for me to find their transfer car which was bit bad experinece as when you are looking for few hours rest, killing almost an hour for waiting transfer...not a good idea. Also be careful, if you have heavy bags and you want to take them in your rooms which was given to you at 1st or 2nd floor...no lift there and you have to sweat yourself. An average chinese restaurant connected to the hotel, good to take some quick bites. Don't be surprise to see that staff may ignore you and there is no smile on their face. Probably they have enough business and they become habitual to ignore and not smile. All the best.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in February 2012 as a last resort since our departure plans had changed unexpectedly. We had originally booked a package for a hotel in the heart of Waikiki, which was AMAZING!!! We were culture shocked when our trip had to end here, but there were nearly no other vacant hotels unless you wanted to spend over $500 per night. I can agree with the other reviews that if you are on vacation you will want to stay someplace else. Rooms are small and old. The a/c works and you do have a mini fridge. There is a bulky older tv. The lights and faucets are old. There is no in room safe and you dont feel safe sleeping here. The walk to the bus stop is very long and poorly lit at night. There is gang graffitti all around the overpass where the bus stop is located. The nearby gas stations are old and dont carry much. The phone in the room did not make outgoing calls. Some of the staff (mostly the guy with the Asian accent, sorry I dont remember his name) are not welcoming and make you feel like you are burdening them when you ask for stuff, like: getting your room key reset because it looses its code if you get it near your cell phone!! The pool area is kinda pretty, but it looked like the pool was harboring its own life so we never got in. The restaurant was under renovations and there are no decent looking places to eat anywhere close, even fast food (we were told there was a Wendy's about 6 blocks away but after walking 4 or 5 blocks to the bus stop we were usually spent and didnt care to venture into anymore industrial unknown areas). The hotel has some vending machines on site but they were about as pricey as ones you'd find in the Ala Moana Shopping Center, so we just went to Walmart and got lunch meat for dinner and tried to eat while we were out and about during the day. It is in an industrial area so the views are pitiful. However, if your alternative is sleeping on the beach with the vagrants then I would recomend this place, as was the case with us. They did hold our bags for us the day we had to leave so we could go shopping. Also, the housekeeping staff did their job very well. They did their best with what they had to work with. I suppose, overall it was better than sleeping on the beach but IDK, I kinda think the streets in Waikiki seemed safer than being locked in a room at this place. Oh well, we survived and didnt see any roaches or bed bugs so I guess it was all OK.
