Fair Play, Missouri, United States

review_body: The hotel is approximately 2 miles from the airport, so if you simply need a place to crash, the Pacific Marina Inn will work. It was noisy all evening, as the parking lot was two feet from our door. We could hear people driving in and out, and yelling into the wee hours of the morning. It's located in an industrial area, and is in dire need of an upgrade. If you're vacationing in Honolulu, I'd recommend that you stay elsewhere. They do have a shuttle that will take you to and from the airport.

Without a doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. We only stayed here overnight whilst in transit. It was disgusting. Old, Dirty, Tiny rooms, Noisy(take your earplugs). There was a hooker hanging around looking for business and other weirdo's lurking around at all hours. DONT stay here, anything else would be a better option. You have been warned!!!

Hotel was okay--fairly clean, but the rooms were somewhat oddly arranged, and the beds were uncomfortable. There also was no elevator, so if you can't do stairs that would be a problem. It was noisy outside, and we could hear a lot of activity above us. The worst thing was the location -- the area did not feel safe at all. There also was no safe in the room. We ended up cancelling our reservation and going somewhere else.

Reading some of the other reviews I agree, this is not the hotel you want to stay at in Hawaii. Just like another reviewer we wanted to have a hotel close to the airport as we only cared about the overnight stay and the ability to sleep. Problem for me was that is exactly what I didn't get.. sleep. As we had a room at the lower level, the neigbor upstairs had people over that continued making noise on an ad-hoc basis. Other than that, this neigbourhood is an "exotic dancers" area, and there are no decent restaurants around. Only nice thing is the shuttle bus that picks you up and drops you off at the airport. The price that I paid for this hotel is definitively not worth it.

We island hopped back to Honolulu for our last night. Not wanting to catch morning traffic and risk missing our early morning flight we opted to stay closer to the airport. Not what we wanted to be our last views of Hawaii. The location of this hotel is scary and depressing. Look carefully at their pictures and you'll notice they're none of the surrounding area. No restaurant, being renovated or closed, don't quite remember. Ate at a chinese restaurant across the road and got snacks, water at the gasoline station. Our room was cramped (barely enough room to walk around our full size bed). Pay only a few dollars more and get up a little earlier. You'll be glad you did. Shock still hasn't worn off yet.

I realise airport neighborhoods aren't the greatest of areas. This place couldn't suit the very worst of characters. This section of honolulu makes Compton and Newark seem heavenly. You can't get a decent meal on-site. Management knew full well that thier restaurant was closed for most of the winter season, Referring guests to local greasy spoons that offer barbaric atrocities. They happily take your money knowing full well that there is no other choice. Insects and feral cats abound contributing to general filth and desease THe help doesn't seem to know any better and go mum when confronted about abhorrent conditions. I wouldn't stay there again if given a gift certificate. Choose anywhere else.

Our stay at Pacific Marina was very pleasant. The room was very comfortable and clean. Landscape and pool area was outstanding. The price was very reasonable. We will definitely stay at Pacific Marina on our next trip to Honolulu. The adjoining restaurant is presently closed for remodeling with the closest service 2 blocks. This was a problem but appears to be close to opening in Jan.2012. Service to Airport was prompt and less than 10 minutes.

This place is so seedy, grim, dark, and scary, it looks like it was dreamed up by a set designer. The rooms may be decent enough if all you need is a bed for one night -- though still barely serviceable at more than $100/night -- but the location is appalling. It is sandwiched amidst dark alleys and industrial warehouses and is so close to the airport runway that the planes seem to be landing on your head. To add to its visual charms, the cab driver was quick to point out that the hotel is a favorite haunt of drug dealers, though it's apparently gotten better recently since the arrival of undercover cops. Stay somewhere else.
The staff was very helpful. Free Internet provided was a bonus. Free shuttle. The rooms were so tiny and had a very small tv. There is no restaurant nearby.

My family and I were treated great, the internet in the lobby was helpful to me, thou I wish it was in the room, im glad they had it. The room was clean & we had everything we needed!! THe STAFF was AWESOME and the best thing about the hotel. THank You to them for taking care of me and my family!! Will definantly be back many more times!!

My husband and I were in Honolulu for a day-long business trip and decided to stay overnight instead of flying our little plane home to our island so late. The Pacific Marina is close to the general aviation side of the airport, and it's inexpensive, so we thought, why not? The rooms are basic and fairly clean, and comfortable enough for one night's rest, we thought. We had a little room right alongside the lovely pool area. There are two long three-story buildings with the pool area right in the middle, and it looks like a lush little tropical jungle. There is the occasional arriving guest or traffic noise, we expected that. My husband usually wears earplugs when we travel but I don't like my ears plugged, so I don't. We turned on the air conditioner and it was noisy enough to drown out the sounds. We had been sleeping peacefully when a group of very loud people (who might have been drinking in the hotel bar) went into the pool area and began laughing and talking loudly. They were swearing, screaming, and moving the furniture around. It was 2:30 am!!!! And they were literally right outside my window!!!! I was so tired, I hoped perhaps they would go to their rooms or maybe security would ask them to quiet down. No WAY!!! They kept going for over an hour. It got so bad that I got up in the dark to push a chair against the (flimsy) door, because they were so intoxicated I thought they might break into my room. It was not a restful night.The next day when we checked out, I asked the desk clerk if there had been any complaints about people at the pool and he said he didn't know, he just started work. No apology. It's a great value if you can sleep through disturbances and don't worry too much about safety.

You get what you pay for. This is a motel not a hotel. In the middle of nowhere, the rooms are very basic and old but were clean. Noisy, our room faced the carpark ( nothing that ear plugs and a sleeping tablet cant fix ). The shuttle service was on time, it is only a 5-10 minute trip to the airport. Staff were nice. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay near the airport than this place is ok,
dont believe the photos. in the WORST area. No cafe. Worst service. Filthy. Scared to sleep at night. Chalk outline & police tape only thing missing. Worst night of our life.

BEWARE!!! WATCH OUT this place is full of drug dealers and drug addicts and prostitues.. i've awaken to people walking around looking for their pimps and drug dealers... you gotta be careful.. don't let the pictures fool you.. the people that work there are nothing but RUDE!!! People that work at HOTELS are supposed to be cheerful and welcoming... BUT NOOOOO! once you go in you'll be GREETED by SOUR FACES... OH BY THE WAY.. THE POOL THERE IS FILTHY!!! IT'S DIRTY..

Our plane arrived in the evening. We got to the hotel at 9pm, but our brains were in midnight time from California. We had seen the bad reviews. And the good ones. Well, unless they snuck the one great room by me, and were nice to me and only me, this place was fine for what it is. Lower cost than nearby places, totally adequate for an arrival or departure sleep, and not bad at all. Not fancy, but our experience was good service, fast wifi (free), free onsite (but very full) parking, and a very clean room with nothing negative I could say about it. Not as fancy as some places, but not a bit creepy or dirty or dingy or sad. In the morning we saw a nearby park with tennis courts, grass, trees, and it seemed maybe we should stay another night. I would stay here again any time. And will update this if next time I get a different type of room. Until then, for what they are offering, this place is just fine. Excellent for a two star place, really.

This is the best deal in Honolulu. I stayed for two nights and was so impressed with how clean my room was. Yes, a bit frayed and worn in places but very clean. The rooms are spartan but pleasant and the staff friendly and helpful. There is a pool that is beautifully maintained. The restaurant on the premises serves good food at a fair price. It is in an industrial area but I just wanted it near the airport. When I arrived and called the hotel, the van was there within 10 minutes. I was concerned about the noise but I could hardly hear the planes. For the price it was all in all a very good experience.

We arrived at Honolulu Airport in the evening and had a flight out the next morning so needed an airport hotel. We booked this one despite the bad reviews on the basis that it was cheaper than the only two other options which also had bad reviews. It is surprising that Honolulu has no decent hotel near the airport and it is also surprising how expensive all three hotels are given their quality.The Pacific Marina Inn is not really a hotel at all. It is a 1960s motel located in an industrial area which would appear to have had no refurbishment since it was built. It does have a pool and a restaurant on site but we (fortunately) did not have the time to use them. The room was small, basic and spartan but to be fair the beds were OK and the shower worked well. There was no way to get WIFI as far as we could tell.Sleeping was a bit of a problem given that our room opened onto the gravel parking lot and cars were coming and going all night. In addition, planes were landing and taking off frequently and the hotel must be close to the runway.One good thing was the free shuttle which arrived promptly to pick us up and took us as planned to the airport in the morning. Outside of that this place has nothing much to offer. Our advice would be to ensure that you don't have to stay overnight near Honolulu Airport.

I had to spend one night near the airport before flying to another island. This hotel had a free shuttle.It is in an industrial park area and is nestled between warehouses. Behind the hotel is a state beach that overlooks a lagoon.The hotel looks tired and rundown, but my room was clean.I tired to connect to their free wireless, but could not.If you need a cheap palce to stay a night, then this is fine.

Having read reviews on tripadvisor we had much trepidation about checking in here. (booked through priceline's name your own price system, so no choice in the matter!) but were pleasantly surprised by our experience. Stayed for one night (good location near to airport) and were pleased to have a direct line from Honolulu airport to the hotel to arrange our free airport shuttle pick up (friendly guy on the phone + pleasant shuttle driver) which arrived in just ten minutes. Easy check-in with the friendly chap I'd spoken to on the phone. Room (ground floor- off parking lot) not the largest but clean and cool with air con on, although unfortunately we had a constant hum from the aircon vent in the bathroom, even when our aircon was not switched on, which was quite irritating at night, to say the least. On site restaurant/cafe/take away very basic, but good, tasty food (we went with the Korean options, as opposed to burgers, etc) and friendly staff. On site bar also friendly (far from busy) and a pleasant enough way to spend an hour. As noted in other reviews, you really wouldn't want to go wandering about at night, but this is as the hotel is amidst warehouses/industrial buildings giving you nothing to see or do, rather than because it's a scary place to be.On the downside, it is not the quietest place to be at night- between the white noise hum of the aircon (as mentioned), the planes in and out of the nearby airport (not all that frequent overnight, but planes nonetheless) and late night arrivals in the parking lot (cars and voices) I'd recommend ear plugs if you can't request a room away from the car park.The next day staff were happy to keep our bags in the office while we headed into Honolulu (bus stop 5 min walk away) to kill time before our evening flight. Free shuttle bus to the airport again (shuttle service runs hourly (at half past the hour) 24hours a day) with a different friendly driver (a tad more eccentric this time!)All in all, I can't see a reason to avoid this hotel if you're looking for a budget somewhere close to Honolulu airport and aren't looking for nightlife.

We were just in Honolulu overnight. This was great because they had a free shuttle, and it was close to the airport. The room was very clean--we didn't see a bug anywhere, clean bathroom, sheets, and a clean shower. It had everything we needed for one night, plus the free shuttle back to the airport. The service was also great. They don't have an elevator, and the driver of the shuttle helped up get our bags up to the third floor--total unsolicited. No complaints. Would definitely stay there again.
Could it be worse?Nah..Everything about this place says run don't walk to the nearest police station and sleep in your car.

I walked in and it looked like a pay by the hour hotel. I made the mistake of taking my shoes off and the carpet was sticky. I soon realized it was the whole carpet. We booked for two queens and they gave us one full. There were smashed bugs on the walls and a bug trap in the bathroom. There was what appeared to be listerine spit in the sink and spit with blood on the knobs of the sink. The toilet had a smudge of blood on the bowl. They refused to give us a new room and it was non refundable. We had to pay more if we wanted a new room. They treated us like we should just deal with it. DON'T STAY HERE!!!!! it is also in a bad neighborhood.

I just stayed in this terrible hotel for one night before flying back. i was so shocked when i arrived. the location is really bad - i walked through the area at 12am and was already scared! the staff was quite friendly and there is also a free shuttle bus from the airport, which is very convenient. the room was so horrible, it was the most terrible room i have ever slept in! the smell was incredible and you could hear every word that people outside and also in the room next to us said. the bathroom was also very very basic.the atmosphere in the hotel is so bad (we only saw strange people sitting around the lobby) that we fled as quickly as possible to waikiki and just returned late in the night with a taxi. we were happy that we already had to leave at 5am and could escape from that place so soon.don't stay at this hotel! the only positive aspect about it is its closeness to the airport. that's it.

I can't believe I paid over $100 for such a disgusting filth pot! Just thinking about it gives me the chills. I have never in my life paid so much for such a horrible room and I hope to never have such an experience again. When we walked into the room, the first thing my daughter noticed was a mass extinction of small flies on the lamp post. Then came the towels which I suppose were once white and new, but by the time I came around, disintegrated into an off-white puke-scented piece of cloth. There were three bars of soap in the bathroom and that was it... thanks for nothing. Overall, I get the impression that management is cheap and greedy (i.e. not paying to have renovations/toiletries/chairs and still charging a steep price). I had a layover in Honolulu as well and I must say the only good thing about this hotel is the fact that it made me happy to be leaving Hawaii, when just a few hours before I was extremely sad. I regret not reading the reviews for this place. DON'T BOOK HERE!!!

I had an 11 hour layover in Honolulu. I ended up calling the Pacific Marina Inn, from the courtesy phones in baggage claim. The rate was great, the room was clean and cozy, and best of all, there was a FREE shuttle to and from the airport 24/7! The staff was VERY courteous. I will stay there again!

We booked on Hotwire and was initially apprehensive given some of the negative reviews. Needless to say, we called ahead and got upgraded to room 281 which included 2 queens. Room was clean and simple. Mini fridge and microwave. A/C was adequate. Staff were very courteous, especially their drivers of the free shuttle service. Definitely would stay again for one night. Would not recommend for longer stays as hotel is located in an industrial area near the airport.

As most other people who stay here we needed a place to sleep after a late arrival and an early flight the next morning. Booked with Priceline and the place looked fine for a one night stay and as the cost was $113.00 thought it would be o.k. We took a cab as we did not realize there was a shuttle which was the least of the problems. The front desk guy was o.k. but not exactly friendly. The room was TINY just enough to hold a bed and enough floor space for our luggage. It looks like it was built in 1945 and has had nothing done since. The main room has a bed, an armoire with a t.v., a small table and a chair. The bathroom is not inviting and I refused to shower in it as it had roach traps all around the walls. There is nowhere to eat in the area and it is not a place I would walk in. Spend a few extra dollars and leave this place alone.

We booked this hotel through Hotwire as we wanted somewhere close to the airport for an early morning departure. The shuttle was prompt and courteous. At check-in I discovered that I had booked the wrong month and I actually had no reservation for that night. The check-in staff went to a lot of trouble attempting to rectify the problem with both their reservations system and Hotwire without success. In in the end I called Hotwire and they refunded my reservation as they were unable to change the date. The front desk ended up giving me a better rate than I got from Hotwire! -- $74 -- because I was unable to rebook . The rooms are small, very basic, dated but clean. There is a nice pool area (though I didnt actually use the pool) and the gardens seem very well taken care of. There is a fair amount of noise from the nearby runway though it didnt seem to effect my sleep. The area seems a bit seedy. There is a scattering of car dealerships and light industrial businesses. Dining options are limited to the restaurant in the "hotel", a greasy spoon Chinese restaurant down the street and a Wendy's about two blocks away. There are two gas stations for convenience food half a block away. There is free wifi though I couldnt get a signal in my room so had to use it in the lobby -- and it was down for a good portion of my stay. There is also a computer in the lobby that is $.25/minute, $5.00 minimum. Overall I found the staff very friendly and helpful and the room basic but adequate for an overnight stay. The close location to the airport is very convenient. I would probably stay there again for a one night stopever but not any longer.

We booked this hotel for its location by the airport, free shuttle service, and reasonable price. It was not fancy, but we just needed 1 night on Oahu before going to the Big Island the next day. The staff was friendly, and I would stay there again. I would not stay there if I was spending a few days on Oahu - I would stay in a better area. The neighborhood isn't much, even though there is a beach behind the hotel. The freeway is a couple blocks away, and it is very close to the airport. The on-site restaurant is open 7am until around 6PM. It was closed when we got there, so we ordered Domino's. The breakfast at the on-site restaurant was good with reasonable prices. We were able to walk to the bus stop to go to Pearl Harbor so it was convenient for that reason too.

We stayed here for just one night (thank god) in January 2009. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. In hindsight, I should have cancelled and changed hotels. It was in a very seedy neighbourhood. The bar was just as seedy as the neighbourhood. We were not given an itemized bill in the bar and were totally overcharged by the barmaid. Our room was small, with a sagging mattress on the bed. The whole room smelled musty and unclean. It was also very noisy because of the bar downstairs. We were more than happy to leave this dump in the morning. I can not believe that this is a Castle property. They should be embarassed to have their name attatched to this property.

I entitled this "Not All Bad", because I found that there was one thing that I liked and that was the closeness to the Airport and my mom's house. Other than that, I wouldn't recommend it for more than a quick nights stay. The price was right, but next time I'll pay more to stay somewhere else. The first room that I was put in was right next to the pool, forget getting any sleep due to people partying until late into the morning right outside my door - what a nightmare. Can't believe that the staff couldn't hear the loudness. I then asked to move to the outside area by the car parking area, that too was heavily noisy due to people coming out from the bar area located downstairs and loud people and honking of cars. Forget getting a good night's sleep here. Do not bring a family, not recommended. I brought my laptop to use and I could not get it to hit the internet during the full time I was there. Their computer in the lobby was down the entire stay there, but to amazement it was working the last day I was there..but, forget that....they have a charge of .25 cents per minute with a minimum charge of $5.00, that is totally ridiculous. What's up with that??? The best experience that I had was the greeting I received from Bryan Chang and his partner at night. There were very friendly, the others, especially the day shift, NO SMILES. Can't believe that the people that greet you and take your money can't be nice and issue some smiles upon your arrival. They don't appear to want to help with anything and I became afraid to even ask for assistance, I didn't want to ruin my whole day. The final straw was when I came back to my room on a Saturday night. I attempted to park and guess what, all the parking was taken and I finally found a spot about 1/4 mile down the darkened road and left it there all night, now that's pretty scarey to think your card is somewhere parked, and you're thinking is it going to be there in one piece the next day. I stopped into the lobby and asked what was going on and the clerk told me that there was a big party in the bar and all parking was taken up by them. Geez, I'm paying for a room there, shouldn't I have a parking space? They should have informed those people that those spaces were for paying guests, not partying guests.

Needed a place to stay one night for Pearl Harbor Commemoration. If I had been with wife, I would have left to find another place to stay. The only bright spot was that my rental car was still in the parking lot in the morning so I could leave.

Customer service was the worst I've ever experienced!!! Personally coming from the hospitality field myself, the way the management handled a customer complaint was worse than that of a teenager. The way he handled himself was more then inappropriate. Harassing a Veteran on Veteran's Day is not exactly what I would call "top of the line service." If you are looking to book a hotel reservation I highly recommend that it be elsewhere, where the staff cares more about the customer than the over-pricing. Jeff Kemblin, the manager I spoke with, humiliated me when I was in the presence of an out-ranking Non-Comissioned Officer; I spoke to him on speaker phone.

Needed a hotel room near the airport because of an early flight. After reading reviews for all Honolulu airport hotels, chose this one mainly due to price. We were pleasantly surprised to find a clean, relatively quiet, spartan room with functioning A/C, prompt shuttle service, and friendly staff. The hotel is in the middle of an industrial area. A bit overpriced, since a bit further into Waikiki there are cheaper hotels, but perfect for quick airport access.

I paid $110 for one night (for a party of three) at this hotel. Overall, it was a disappointment. The hotel is like a glorified motel, with a pool and cleaner rooms. Though it had two beds in our room, there was not a single chair. it also lacked a bedside table. The bathroom had a shower only, no tub. Though it is close to the airport and it offers free shuttle service, the shuttle bus runs only every half hour or so. The sound isolation of the hotel rooms is terrible -- you can hear every take off and landing, unless, of course, you are too tired to stay awake. I would not recommend this hotel.

We received a AAA rate and it was $122 after all taxes. This hotel is located very close to the airport but it has no restaurants or hotels nearby . The room did not even have a coffee maker or a hair dryer. the bed was clean. The pictures on the website does not at all resemble the place. Really scary place. We did not feel safe.

I was stopping over in Honolulu for four days in early December 2007. As it turned out, my visit unintentionally coincided with the timing of the Honolulu Marathon. Therefore, I could not book any of the budget-priced hotels in Waikiki. My choices pretty much came down to something really expensive or... the Pacific Marina Inn. The website makes it look like a decent little property so I figured why not. The stay started out promisingly enough with the complimentary pick-up from the airport (great driver) but went downhill rapidly as we approached the hotel. Looking at the neighborhood, one could be forgiven for thinking that they had been somehow teleported to an industrial park in Oakland, California. The hotel itself is dingy, the pool which looked inviting on the hotel website, looked like something that you wouldn't want to expose your skin to. The room was smallish and barely adequate. A real negative at this hotel is noise from the airport. I have stayed in plenty of airport hotels. They're usually located in such a manner as to avoid as much noise from the runway as possible. Not so with the Pacific Marina Inn. I am an early riser so was in the lobby for complementary coffee before 06:30 in the morning. The thermal pot ran out after I had taken a cup and I informed the desk staff that they were out of coffee. They told me that they only made one pot per morning and that was it! Apart from the coffee incident though, I would have to say the only positive about this hotel is the staff. Everybody I encountered was actually really nice and made you feel welcome. Too bad that they're stuck working in such a horrible, horrible hotel. Thumbs down - adequate for an overnight near the airport and that's about it.

I stayed here recently and I can't see what everyone's complaining about. I had a really nice ground floor room. It was spotlessly clean and the staff were really helpful. Yes, it's close to the airport- that's the reason I stayed there, along with the 24- hour free shuttle service.

This hotel was so bad, I am glad we stayed for the hour we did, because it gave me a great story to tell our friends back home in Atlanta. We only needed to stay on Oahu one night before our real vacation on Kauai, so I was not picky. I booked through Hotwire. We got to the front desk to check in and they handed us our room key...and the remote to our tv. Um...ok....? That was weird. We walked to our room and saw a sign in one of the rooms that said "Nancy's Fantasy Massage." This is not going to get better, is it? No, no it's not... We get to our room and it was what I would expect to find in the worst hotel in El Salvador. It was horrible. But I STILL was not ready ready to give up on my bargain. Until the domestic violence ensued in the room next to us. Oh yeah...full on fight. smashing, yelling, hitting. The WORKS. We call the Hilton at Waikiki and book a room. But we were stuck at the Pacific Marina Inn until the the fight (which they had taken outside - right next to our door) was over. I threw the keys and the remote on the front desk and ran as fast as I could.

This is NOT a two star hotel and for $130 ($150 after taxes) it should be considered stealing. I walked into the room and it was VERY small, dirty and not even close to the pictures on the website. I went to the desk and imeditly sked for refund. Since I booked this through EXPEDIA they would not give me a refund. I called EXPEDIA and they would not refund my money. I ended eating the $150 and stayed in Waikiki for another $180. Much nicer. Don't let the location fool you. it's not worth it. The staff was not friendly either.Oh yeah, the hotel is in the middle of a large industry section by the airport with no other hotels nearby. I wish I had taken a photo of the room so you could compare it with the photos on EXPEDIA. not even close.

My wife and I stayed here for one night because we had to change planes at Honolulu Airport to get to Kauai. Once we checked in, we were disappointed by how small and dirty the room was. Quite cramped for two people. Ugly furnishings.Worse, no one told us that the hotel is located right next to the airport runway! At 5am the next morning, huge jets started taking off every 10 - 15 minutes. They planes were so loud that our room literally shook. I can sleep through just about anything, but this was ridiculous. We got up an hour later and checked out, because it was unbearable. The front desk was rude and acted like everything was normal.If you need a good night's sleep, do not stay here. For a similar price, you'll be better off at the Ohana airport hotel or the Best Western Plaza.

Our first impression was positive when contacting this hotel from Honolulu Airport - the quoted price included the tax (which wasn't added on when checking out as we experienced at the Radisson Hotel at LAX!) After thirty minutes waiting, the 'Free Shuttle' collected us from the Airport. Our room was on the ground floor alongside the pool. The first problem we encountered in our small but adequate double bedded room was that after pushing the plug (plunger) into the handbasin to fill it with water, there was no way to release it to drain the remaining water away. The plug (plunger) didn't fit the basin adequately in the first place, which meant that water was constantly emptying. (We informed Management who said they'd have someone check it out!) Our main frustration that we had at this hotel was the refusal to let us put through a necessary 'Reverse Charge' telephone call to New Zealand from either our room or from Reception. We had to use a telephone out in the open area alongside a snack machine, with people walking past talking and laughing loudly - hardly the place to hold a private conversation. I went into the pool for a swim in the evening but found the water positively freezing after such a hot day. After our one night stay, the 'Free Shuttle' meant just that but it wouldn't leave the Hotel until there was a ful complement of passengers! Other than those gripes, the positives are: overall, the Staff were friendly, the bed was clean and comfortable and the inexpensive public transport bus was close by which we caught to Waikiki Beach. The small shop nearby stocked a very limited supply of snacks.We would stay here again, if on an overnight stay but most likely not for longer than that.

I booked through Priceline and was a little apprehensive before arriving. In reading the previous reviews on here you would think this hotel is a dump, terrible, not safe, etc. etc. However, I found this hotel to be an adequate "stopover" hotel.We stayed one night after arriving in Honolulu and, needing a place to stay near the airport before our flight to Maui first thing the next morning, this hotel fit the bill.Here are some positives:Free shuttle to/from Honolulu Airport.Free coffee in the morning.Free computer with internet in lobby.Cable TV with at least 50 channels.As for the "negatives" (which weren't too bad really):Small rooms with outdated decor. Our room also had two twin beds, which was kind of funny to see!Overall, if you want a clean hotel that is close to the airport, and you just want a quiet room to sleep in, this hotel is fine. Check-in was a breeze, they were welcoming, and it only took a minute. In no way did my wife our I feel "unsafe" or were disturbed by anyone while there.

Perks: 1. After arriving late at night, they have a shuttle that picks you up and drops you off at the airport2. It's close to the airport3. They drop you off at the airport the next day for your next flight"not so" Perks:1. A very basic room - small and boxlike, kind of like a private hostel room - the rate (approx $120 US) is overpriced for the room2. Noisy - be sure to ask for a room away from the parking lot - there were lots of people shouting outside, and as it's close to the airport, their were lots of people starting their cars and leaving during the night - and no they weren't quietThis is a step up from sleeping at the airport itself - only reason we chose this place is that either renting a cab or renting a car to go to another place would have made our one night stay more expensive than $120. The only reason to stay here is if you need to rest and then leave - not a place to stick around.

I would not recommend this hotel - had an early flight out of honolulu in the morning so we stayed here for one night. pay a little more for something better. It just feels gross, it was loud and there was activity all night that kept us up. I felt like i shouldn't touch anything in the room. made for an exhausting long travel day the next day. not a way to end a hawaiin vacation.

Friendly staff, small on-site restaurant & lounge, pay-per-use lobby internet access, and pool make up for the retro-drab rooms. The rooms are reminiscent of Route 66 motel rooms, with the added charm of lamps nailed to the desk and nightstand. Adequate for a one-night layover, but no more.

We spent fortunately only 1 night at the Pacific marina inn, because Hawaiian airlines cncelled our flight so we had to spend one night in Honolulu and fly ou the next day. We found this hotel on the Lonely planet guide and I think they should cancel it from the guide. We have used all our hotels based on tripadvisor, and all of them have been great. The room is very basic, and not very well cleaned. I did not have a shower because I felt very uncofortable. It is a very BASIC Motel. We paied 100$ which I think is really too much for what the offer. Do not stay there ever!!

This is a transit hotel near Honolulu Airport. For more than $100USD you get a $50USD room with a shower and a TV. It is more a down market motel than a hotel and is surrounded by industrial sites. The staff are at best disinterested but at least the linen was clean and they do run a regular free shuttle to the airport.Do not use the phone. They charge a $0.75 "service" fee even for prepaid phone cards using toll free numbers. Pick up and call an outside line and the fee is applied. I have travelled extensively and this is the only hotel where I ever been charged for using toll free numbers.Take the $8.00 shuttle into Waikiki and get a room back from the beach for less.

Pacific Marina Inn is not a vacation hotel. It is simple clean, convienient to downtown and the airport. Also has a free shuttle that will pick you up and drop you off at the airport 24/7.At times the hotel can be a little noisy (especially on Friday Saturday nights), but generally it is clean, has a decent pool for the kids, and with a car you can be downtown and to the University area in less than 10 minutes.This is a very economical place to stay if you are a former resident and are just visiting for a few days business, or you are a frequent traveler and just have 10 to 24 hours between flights to other Pacific locations. I have stayed there in just these situations over the last 7 years and have paid as little as $75 per night (May '06), it pays to call and talk directly to the hotel for the best rates. It ain't the Ritz, it ain't on the beach, and there isn't even a Marina, but for a simple, clean, cheap room for a night or two, not a bad choice, especially if you have kids.

I stayed at Pacific Marina Inn February 23, 2006 and paid $110 including tax. The area is mostly warehouses but it appears to be safe, as far as I could tell.The parking lot was full but fortunately I was able to find a space on the other side of the building. Spillover parking was available on the street. Parking was free, a big plus in Honolulu.The room was very small. The room was nicely decorated and the furniture was in good condition (better than I expected). There was a wall unit air-conditioner that was typically noisy (about what you'd expect in budget motels). There was a louver-style window which did not keep out the noise very well (I was along the parking-lot road and heard vehicles). Also note that the motel is on a runway flight path, but I heard very few aircraft.Traffic going into Honolulu on the Friday morning was horrendous. Do not plan to stay here if you need to commute into town on a weekday morning.Overall, I rate this place as acceptable. If you can find a better hotel at the same price, I would recommend taking it. But if you just need a basic motel with easy parking, this could be your best bet in Honolulu.

Watch out! It may be inexpensive and close to the airport. But after my car was stolen from the "video survalenced" parking lot, the police told me to avoid that hotel unless I was looking for illegal activity.

OK, so it's not the Ritz, but what do you expect for £60/night? Yes my heart sank when we arrived; it looks like a typical motel (which I guess is what it IS)but the staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. The room was tiny but clean and the A/C was noisy but extremely efficient (FYI the controls are awkwardly placed on to of the box). The bathroom was also small but there were plenty of towels, soap and hot water with a very good shower unit. Pure cotton sheets, rather than 50/50 would have been nice and the bed was not particularly comfortable.Although the place was full the night we stayed there wasn't too much noise, yeah a bit at kicking out time from the bar but this was only marginally annoying as we had gone to bed early for an 0545 start (although there were signs around asking people to be quiet).There is a nice-looking pool and terrace area, as well as a restaurant (which we didn't try as the husband wanted to go into Chinatown in HNL, now THAT was a mistake!), a friendly set of barstaff and locals having a few drinks at knocking-off time, and a couple of vending machines. We asked for an alarm call which came promptly on time.We didn't use the shuttle service as we dropped our car rental off before we checked in, which is why this pace was so fab, as the car rental return is signed right from the back of the hotel! Literally 30 mins after being woken we were checked in and hanging around for the flight. Couldn't have asked for anything more convenient!I do recommend ear plugs if noise is a problem. It's not a palace, but more than adequate for the job at hand.

I booked with PRICELINE...so far a big mistake since I didn't realize the rooms you book with Priceline only accomodate 2 people. Really...After booking (and paying) I discovered that priceline sells the smallest rooms in the hotel and these rooms have 2 twin beds. If I want a place for my 2 year old daughter to sleep I'm going to have to pay an upgrade fee. So I haven't saved any money but have already experienced grief before leaving on my trip. My advice to you is to skip Priceline altogether.

I chose this hotel because it's next to the airport, and we had an overnight layover. When I called from the airport, the hotel said a shuttle would pick us up in 5 or 10 minutes. Instead I waited almost an hour -- it was after dark and I had a small child with me. I called several times from my mobile phone, and each time the operator said the shuttle would arrive in "just a minute." Finally a rental-car courtesy van driver took pity on us and drove us to the hotel. Incredibly, the desk clerk was totally unapologetic and claimed it was my fault. She said the shuttle had driven by twice to look for me, but I wasn't standing where I was supposed to be. I knew perfectly well that I had been in the right place, and later I happened to see the shuttle driver, and she admitted that she hadn't come to look for us because she was too busy with other customers. Next morning I complained to the manager and she gave me a discount on the room rate. But you couldn't pay me to stay in this hotel again.

I stayed here for one night and will unfortunately not be recommending it to anyone. To start with the positives at least - the staff were all very helpful and the shuttle to the airport - extremely handy, (and the amount of channels on the the tv is unbelievable to me coming from an area with only 7 channels) but the negatives started as soon as I got to my room. Firstly the key to the door had a trick to it so I had to ask for help with my room key, then when I entered the odour was insane - the room reeked of mould. The only way to get rid of it was turn the A/C on and get used to it. The walls were showing their age and mould and/ or serious dust/ dirt appeared in most cracks/ fittings. Then to add it is in an area in the middle of nowhere. Luckily there is a bus stop a little walk away and it is frequently stopped at but I wouldn't have walked out past dark in such an industrial area. The final negative was that a number of people I met up with complained their showers and/ or sinks (2 out of 5 showers and 1 sink) did not work due to either water pressure or faulty nozzel. I'm thankful mine did work as with 11 hours of flying ahead of me I would not have coped doing it not having had a shower prior. For anyone looking for somewhere to stay I would personally recommend trying somewhere else in the airport area even going closer into town if the place has a shuttle.

We stayed here on a seven hour layover on the way to Kauai. The free shuttle picked us up quickly, and returned us to the airport early the next morning. The service was excellent and very friendly. We felt very welcome. The pool and courtyard areas are well kept. It was exactly what we needed for our first night in Hawaii. We would stay here again.

I stayed several days at this hotel while visiting my son stationed at Pearl Harbor Naval Base. My room was clean, for a few dollars more you could upgrade to a Suite. The staff provided excellent and friendly service. The pool is maintained daily and there is several places to lounge in and out of the sun. The Canoe Hut lounge was a great place to relax and regulars sing Karaoke including Hawaiian songs and if you're lucky you can learn to hula. The rooms are being remodeled. You can spend your savings at the Aloha Stadium flea market.

This is a 'Mom and Pop' hotel, in an industrial area of town, very close to the airport. We got in late and didn't want to navigate unknown roads at night. The rooms are small and old, but ours was very clean with fitted sheets and a cold AC. The staff were nice and they had a lovely little pool. We only 'slept' here. We ran around the island all day. We wanted to spend our money on excursions and side trips, not a room. We would use it again.

We have used this hotel since before the name was changed a number of years ago for layovers. Pluses: Proximity to airport & free shuttle. Fall into bed after a long flight, change into shorts the next morning, have a hearty breakfast, and take your Inter-Island flight. I've never had a complaint!

When we booked our room at the Pacific Marina Inn, I really wasn't expecting much. However, the hotel/shuttle staff were very friendly and we had a nice quiet stay. The rooms, although smaller than the average hotel room were clean and quiet. And the courtyard's flora was well groomed. We also enjoyed breakfast at the attached restaurant. The P.M.I. is not a place you would want to stay if you are a tourist and planning a multiple night stay. The hotel is situated in a more commercial neighborhood with warehouses and highway as the main attraction. However, the close proximity to the airport and the free shuttle service was the deciding factor for our family. For anyone considering staying at the Best Western near the airport, I might advise against it. That hotel is located at the end of HNL's runway and directly against Nimitz Highway. The noise there is unbeleivable.

My husband and I and another couple spent one night in Honolulu after a wonderful two weeks in Kauai and Maui because we wanted to see the Pearl Harbor memorial the next day before our flight departed Hawaii. The hotel description made it sound basic but nice, which is all we needed for that night. We stayed there last Saturday evening (10/9) and were horrified at the rooms, the unsavory and unsafe location (this is based on our observations that night and the next morning AND the warnings of the desk clerk when we checked in). Our room (down a few rooms from the office on the main floor) was very small and rundown. It was so moldy smelling that it was disgusting and unhealthy, and the pillows, bed linens and mattress all had the same strong moldy smell. The wallpaper was stained and ripped, and in the bathroom it was stapled onto the wall! The bathroom vent was filthy and rusty, tiles and woodwork old and stained, and the room was loud all night long with truck doors slamming right outside and a decrepit air conditioner in the wall. The unit was incredibly poorly maintained. The restaurant was not open when we arrived (8:30 p.m.) and didn't open in the morning until 8:00 a.m. We had to be picked up by a tour van to the Pearl Harbor memorial at 7:45 a.m., so breakfast had to be a roll and a bad cup of coffee from a gas station a block away. We were not able to change hotels at that late time because the Pearl Harbor tour van had instructions to pick us up at the Pacific Marina Inn so early the next morning, and we did not have a rental car because we had airport shuttle transportation from the hotel. Even if we had been able to change hotels, this hotel has a 72 hour cancellation policy, so we would have had to pay for that room and another for the night. Some day we may laugh about this, but it truly was a nasty place. The website for the hotel was really misleading, and if it had been a woman traveling alone it would have been even a worse situation than we had with two couples. Don't even consider this place!

My ex-husband came down from the mainland to visit his children. He got this hotel from the web-site. Even though I live in Hawaii, I did not know where this hotel was. When we got there the lobby itself was appauling. I didn't want to sit on the chairs because they looked dirty. I actually tried to talk him out of getting the hotel. He took it for a couple of nights. When we got to the room, it just didn't even look clean and it was EXTREMELY small. I stood the entire time. The bed spread looked dirty as with the chair that was in the room.  My husband is in Afganistan and will be coming home in a few months and we were looking for a hotel to stay in for a few days to get away from "military" living. We also are on a budget, but I can definitely say that this would not be the hotel that we would go to. I'd rather pay more and go somewhere else.

Typical to Hawaii homes, the rooms are small, but really we didn't come to Hawaii to sit around in a room. It's a convenient hotel, away from the tourist flocks in Waikiki. The price is right! Go for it!

Its a nice little hotel...clean..but it didnt have a bathtub.....thats the only thing i didnt like...it had a nice pool and cabana, friendly crews, and lots of parking....good place to stay for the money....air conditioning was ace....it kept the room nice and cold.....

This was a perfect hotel for a layover. Literally 4 minutes from the airport. I was picked up promptly by the free hotel shuttle, there is a phone on the kiosk at baggage claim to call when you are ready. I was checked in quickly and my luggage was taken to my room. I had an early morning flight, got a prompt wake-up call at 5:30am, free coffee in the lobby, and a shuttle ride back to airport. All with a smile and great service. Yes, the rooms are small, but they were clean with new linens, bathroom amenities and a hot shower. It was exactly as advertised, and for a great price. I would definitely recommend it for a layover or an inexpensive couple of days in Oahu. And while it is not a resort location, it has a pool with comfortable lounge chairs. (Bring a small alarm clock as there is not one in the room.)

Reasonably clean, reasonably good service, reasonably quick shuttle pickup, and a reasonable restaurant on site. But overall, of course, in Honolulu, this is a choice you make only if you need to be near the airport. It is not a resort destination in any sense of the word. That in mind, it is fine for the price.

The hotel is close to the airport and there is a free airport shuttle. The staff was very welcoming. However, the room was very worn and in need of renovation. It was clean enough, but I wouldn't stay there again.

The standard room was 6 feet wider and 6 feet longer than bed. Request for suite was charged at rack rate. Had to go to desk for cups, then rationed at 2 per request. Severe disturbance, at 2AM, in an adjacent room with no effort by the desk to correct when called. Continued for over an hour with inadequate attention after a second call to the desk. Left the Inn at 5AM. Lodging was part of a Hawaii Airline package. Unfavorable Comment Card being sent to Castle Resorts and Hotels with name and address included.
